Chapter 1

It began in [a Woman ’s Club in [London]2-london]189-a woman ’s club in london on a February afternoon — an uncomfortable club , and a miserable afternoon — when [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , who had come down from [Hampstead]3-hampstead to shop and had lunched at [[her]64-mrs. wilkins club]190-her club , took up The Times from the table in [the smoking - room]191-the smoking - room , and running [her]64-mrs. wilkins listless eye down [the Agony Column]192-the agony column saw this :

To Those who Appreciate [Wistaria]4-wistaria and [Sunshine]5-sunshine . [Small mediaeval Italian Castle on [the shores of [the Mediterranean]6-the mediterranean to be Let Furnished for the month of April]194-the shores of the mediterranean to be let furnished for the month of april]193-small mediaeval italian castle on the shores of the mediterranean to be let furnished for the month of april . [Necessary servants]195-necessary servants remain . Z , Box 1000 , The Times .

That was its conception ; yet , as in the case of many another , [the conceiver]196-the conceiver was unaware of it at the moment .

So entirely unaware was [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins that [her]64-mrs. wilkins April for that year had then and there been settled for [her]64-mrs. wilkins that [she]64-mrs. wilkins dropped the newspaper with a gesture that was both irritated and resigned , and went over to the window and stared drearily out at [the dripping street]197-the dripping street .

Not for [her]64-mrs. wilkins were [mediaeval castles]198-mediaeval castles , even those that are specially described as small . Not for [her]64-mrs. wilkins [the shores in April of [the Mediterranean]6-the mediterranean]199-the shores in april of the mediterranean , and [the wistaria]7-the wistaria and sunshine . Such delights were only for [the rich]200-the rich . Yet the advertisement had been addressed to [persons who appreciate these things , so that it had been , anyhow]201-persons who appreciate these things , so that it had been , anyhow , addressed too to [her]64-mrs. wilkins , for [she]64-mrs. wilkins certainly appreciated them ; more than [anybody]202-anybody knew ; more than [she]64-mrs. wilkins had ever told . But [she]64-mrs. wilkins was poor . In [the whole world]203-the whole world [she]64-mrs. wilkins possessed of [her]64-mrs. wilkins very own only ninety pounds , saved from year to year , put by carefully pound by pound , out of [her]64-mrs. wilkins dress allowance . [She]64-mrs. wilkins had scraped this sum together at the suggestion of [[her]64-mrs. wilkins husband]204-her husband as a shield and refuge against a rainy day . [Her]64-mrs. wilkins dress allowance , given [her]64-mrs. wilkins by [[her]64-mrs. wilkins father]205-her father , was £ 100 a year , so that [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s clothes were what [[her]64-mrs. wilkins husband]204-her husband , urging [her]64-mrs. wilkins to save , called modest and becoming , and [her]64-mrs. wilkins acquaintance to [each other]207-each other , when [they]208-they spoke of [her]64-mrs. wilkins at all , which was seldom for [she]64-mrs. wilkins was very negligible , called a perfect sight .

[Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , [a solicitor]209-a solicitor , encouraged thrift , except that branch of it which got into [his]65-mr. wilkins food . [He]65-mr. wilkins did not call that thrift , [he]65-mr. wilkins called it bad housekeeping . But for the thrift which , like moth , penetrated into [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s clothes and spoilt them , [he]65-mr. wilkins had much praise . “ [You]64-mrs. wilkins never know , ”[65-mr. wilkins] [he]65-mr. wilkins said , “ when there will be a rainy day , and [you]64-mrs. wilkins may be very glad to find [you]64-mrs. wilkins have a nest - egg . Indeed [we]2685-we both may . ”[65-mr. wilkins]

Looking out of [the club]210-the club window into [Shaftesbury Avenue]8-shaftesbury avenue — [hers]64-mrs. wilkins was [an economical club , but convenient for [Hampstead]3-hampstead , where [she]64-mrs. wilkins lived]211-an economical club , but convenient for hampstead , where she lived , and for [Shoolbred ’s]212-shoolbred ’s , where [she]64-mrs. wilkins shopped — [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , having stood there some time very drearily , [her]64-mrs. wilkins mind ’s eye on [the Mediterranean]6-the mediterranean in [April]99-april , and [the wistaria]213-the wistaria , and the enviable opportunities of [the rich]200-the rich , while [her]64-mrs. wilkins bodily eye watched the really extremely horrible sooty rain falling steadily on the hurrying umbrellas and splashing omnibuses , suddenly wondered whether perhaps this was not the rainy day [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins — [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins was [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins — had so often encouraged [her]64-mrs. wilkins to prepare for , and whether to get out of such a climate and into [the small mediaeval castle]215-the small mediaeval castle was n’t perhaps what [Providence]66-providence had all along intended [her]64-mrs. wilkins to do with [her]64-mrs. wilkins savings . Part of [her]64-mrs. wilkins savings , of course ; perhaps quite a small part . [The castle]216-the castle , being mediaeval , might also be dilapidated , and dilapidations were surely cheap . [She]64-mrs. wilkins would n’t in the least mind a few of them , because [you]217-you did n’t pay for dilapidations which were already there ; on the contrary — by reducing the price [you]217-you had to pay [they]218-they really paid [you]217-you . But what nonsense to think of it . . .

[She]64-mrs. wilkins turned away from the window with the same gesture of mingled irritation and resignation with which [she]64-mrs. wilkins had laid down The Times , and crossed [the room]219-the room towards the door with the intention of getting [her]64-mrs. wilkins mackintosh and umbrella and fighting [her]64-mrs. wilkins way into one of [the overcrowded omnibuses]220-the overcrowded omnibuses and going to [Shoolbred ’s]212-shoolbred ’s on [her]64-mrs. wilkins way [home]222-home and buying some soles for [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins ’s dinner — [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins was difficult with fish and liked only soles , except salmon — when [she]64-mrs. wilkins beheld [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , [a woman [she]64-mrs. wilkins knew by sight as also living in [Hampstead]3-hampstead and belonging to [the club]210-the club]223-a woman she knew by sight as also living in hampstead and belonging to the club , sitting at the table in the middle of the room on which the newspapers and magazines were kept , absorbed , in [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot turn , in the first page of The Times .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins had never yet spoken to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , who belonged to one of [the various church sets]225-the various church sets , and who analysed , classified , divided and registered [the poor]226-the poor ; whereas [she]64-mrs. wilkins and [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , when [they]227-they did go out , went to the parties of impressionist painters , of whom in [Hampstead]3-hampstead there were [many]228-many . [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins had [a sister who had married one of [them]227-they and lived up on [the Heath]10-the heath]229-a sister who had married one of them and lived up on the heath , and because of this alliance [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was drawn into a circle which was highly unnatural to [her]64-mrs. wilkins , and [she]64-mrs. wilkins had learned to dread pictures . [She]64-mrs. wilkins had to say things about [them]230-them , and [she]64-mrs. wilkins did n’t know what to say . [She]64-mrs. wilkins used to murmur , “ Marvellous , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] and feel that it was not enough . But [nobody]231-nobody minded . [Nobody]231-nobody listened . [Nobody]231-nobody took any notice of [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins . [She]64-mrs. wilkins was [the kind of person who is not noticed at parties]234-the kind of person who is not noticed at parties . [Her]64-mrs. wilkins clothes , infested by thrift , made [her]64-mrs. wilkins practically invisible ; [her]64-mrs. wilkins face was non - arresting ; [her]64-mrs. wilkins conversation was reluctant ; [she]64-mrs. wilkins was shy . And if [one]235-one ’s clothes and face and conversation are all negligible , thought [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , who recognised [her]64-mrs. wilkins disabilities , what , at parties , is there left of [one]235-one ?

Also [she]64-mrs. wilkins was always with [Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , [that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party , merely by coming to it , a great air . [Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was very respectable . [He]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party was known to be highly thought of by [[his]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party senior partners]238-his senior partners . [[His]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party sister]239-his sister ’s circle admired [him]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party . [He]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party pronounced adequately intelligent judgments on art and [artists]240-artists . [He]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party was pithy ; [he]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party was prudent ; [he]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party never said a word too much , nor , on the other hand , did [he]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party ever say a word too little . [He]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party produced the impression of keeping copies of everything [he]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party said ; and [he]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party was so obviously reliable that it often happened that [people who met [him]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party at these parties]241-people who met him at these parties became discontented with [[their]241-people who met him at these parties own solicitors]242-their own solicitors , and after a period of restlessness extricated [themselves]241-people who met him at these parties and went to [Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins .

Naturally [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was blotted out . “ [She]239-his sister , ”[239-his sister] said [[his]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party sister]239-his sister , with something [herself]239-his sister of the judicial , the digested , and the final in [her]239-his sister manner , “ should stay at [home]222-home . ”[239-his sister] But [Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins could not leave [[his]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party wife]244-his wife at [home]222-home . [He]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party was [a family solicitor]246-a family solicitor , and [all such]247-all such have [wives]248-wives and show [them]248-wives . With [his]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party in the week [he]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party went to parties , and with [his]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party on Sundays [he]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party went to [church]249-church . Being still fairly young — [he]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party was thirty - nine — and ambitious of [old ladies]250-old ladies , of whom [he]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party had not yet acquired in [his]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party practice a sufficient number , [he]237-that clean - shaven , fine - looking man , who gave a party could not afford to miss [church]249-church , and it was there that [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins became familiar , though never through words , with [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot .

[She]64-mrs. wilkins saw [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot marshalling [the children of [the poor]226-the poor]252-the children of the poor into [pews]254-pews . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot would come in at the head of the procession from [the Sunday School]255-the sunday school exactly five minutes before the choir , and get [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot boys]256-her boys and [girls]257-girls neatly fitted into [their]258-their allotted seats , and down on [their]258-their little knees in [their]258-their preliminary prayer , and up again on [their]258-their feet just as , to the swelling organ , the vestry door opened , and [the choir]259-the choir and [clergy]260-clergy , big with the litanies and commandments [they]258-their were presently to roll out , emerged . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot had a sad face , yet [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was evidently efficient . The combination used to make [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins wonder , for [she]64-mrs. wilkins had been told by [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , on days when [she]64-mrs. wilkins had only been able to get plaice , that if [one were efficient]261-one were efficient [one]235-one would n’t be depressed , and that if [one]235-one does [one]235-one ’s job well one becomes automatically bright and brisk .

About [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot there was nothing bright and brisk , though much in [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot way with [the Sunday School children]265-the sunday school children that was automatic ; but when [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , turning from the window , caught sight of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot in [the club]210-the club [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was not being automatic at all , but was looking fixedly at one portion of the first page of The Times , holding the paper quite still , [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot eyes not moving . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot was just staring ; and [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot face , as usual , was the face of [a patient and disappointed Madonna]267-a patient and disappointed madonna .

Obeying an impulse [she]64-mrs. wilkins wondered at even while obeying it , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , the shy and the reluctant , instead of proceeding as [she]64-mrs. wilkins had intended to [the cloakroom]268-the cloakroom and from thence to [Schoolbred ’s]11-schoolbred ’s in search of [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins ’s fish , stopped at the table and sat down exactly opposite [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , to whom [she]64-mrs. wilkins had never yet spoken in [her]64-mrs. wilkins life .

It was one of those long , narrow refectory tables , so that [they]269-they were quite close to each other .

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , however , did not look up . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot continued to gaze , with eyes that seemed to be dreaming , at one spot only of The Times .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins watched [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot a minute , trying to screw up courage to speak to [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot . [She]64-mrs. wilkins wanted to ask [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot if [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had seen the advertisement . [She]64-mrs. wilkins did not know why [she]64-mrs. wilkins wanted to ask [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot this , but [she]64-mrs. wilkins wanted to . How stupid not to be able to speak to [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot looked so kind . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot looked so unhappy . Why could n’t [two unhappy people]270-two unhappy people refresh [each other]207-each other on [their]270-two unhappy people way through this dusty business of life by a little talk — real , natural talk , about what [they]270-two unhappy people felt , what [they]270-two unhappy people would have liked , what [they]270-two unhappy people still tried to hope ? And [she]64-mrs. wilkins could not help thinking that [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , too , was reading that very same advertisement . [Her]67-mrs. arbuthnot eyes were on the very part of the paper . Was [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot , too , picturing what it would be like — the colour , the fragrance , the light , the soft lapping of [the sea among little hot rocks]272-the sea among little hot rocks ? Colour , fragrance , light , sea ; instead of [Shaftesbury Avenue]8-shaftesbury avenue , and the wet omnibuses , and [the fish department at [Shoolbred ’s]91-shoolbred]273-the fish department at shoolbred ’s , and the Tube to [Hampstead]3-hampstead , and dinner , and to - morrow the same and the day after the same and always the same . . .

Suddenly [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins found [herself]64-mrs. wilkins leaning across the table . “ Are [you]67-mrs. arbuthnot reading about [the mediaeval castle]2687-the mediaeval castle and [the wistaria]213-the wistaria ? ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins heard [herself]64-mrs. wilkins asking .

Naturally [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot was surprised ; but [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was not half so much surprised as [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was at [herself]64-mrs. wilkins for asking .

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot had not yet to [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot knowledge set eyes on [the shabby , lank , loosely - put - together figure sitting opposite [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot]274-the shabby , lank , loosely - put - together figure sitting opposite her , with its small freckled face and big grey eyes almost disappearing under a smashed - down wet - weather hat , and [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot gazed at [her]274-the shabby , lank , loosely - put - together figure sitting opposite her a moment without answering . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot was reading about [the mediaeval castle]2687-the mediaeval castle and [the wistaria]7-the wistaria , or rather had read about it ten minutes before , and since then had been lost in dreams — of light , of colour , of fragrance , of the soft lapping of [the sea among little hot rocks]272-the sea among little hot rocks . . .

“ Why do [you]64-mrs. wilkins ask [me]64-mrs. wilkins that ? ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins said in [her]64-mrs. wilkins grave voice , for [her]64-mrs. wilkins training of and by [the poor]226-the poor had made [her]64-mrs. wilkins grave and patient .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins flushed and looked excessively shy and frightened . “ Oh , only because [I]64-mrs. wilkins saw it too , and [I]64-mrs. wilkins thought perhaps — [I]64-mrs. wilkins thought somehow — ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins stammered .

Steadfast as the points of the compass to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot were the great four facts of life : [God]73-god , [Husband]302-husband , [Home]222-home , Duty . [She]64-mrs. wilkins had gone to sleep on these facts years ago , after a period of much misery , [her]64-mrs. wilkins head resting on them as on a pillow ; and [she]64-mrs. wilkins had a great dread of being awakened out of so simple and untroublesome a condition . Therefore it was that [she]64-mrs. wilkins searched with earnestness for a heading under which to put [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , and in this way illumine and steady [her]64-mrs. wilkins own mind ; and sitting there looking at [her]64-mrs. wilkins uneasily after [her]64-mrs. wilkins last remark , and feeling [herself]64-mrs. wilkins becoming more and more unbalanced and infected , [she]64-mrs. wilkins decided pro tem , as [the vicar]2707-the vicar said at meetings , to put [her]64-mrs. wilkins under the heading [Nerves]74-nerves . It was just possible that [she]64-mrs. wilkins ought to go straight into the category Hysteria , which was often only the antechamber to Lunacy , but [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot had learned not to hurry [people]278-people into [their]278-people final categories , having on more than one occasion discovered with dismay that [she]64-mrs. wilkins had made a mistake ; and how difficult it had been to get [them]278-people out again , and how crushed [she]64-mrs. wilkins had been with the most terrible remorse .

Yes . [Nerves]74-nerves . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot had learned in [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot long life with [Frederick]75-frederick — [he]75-frederick was [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot husband]204-her husband , and [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had married [him]75-frederick at twenty and was now thirty - three — where alone true joys are to be found . [Frederick]75-frederick had been [the kind of husband whose wife betakes [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot early to the feet of [God]73-god]315-the kind of husband whose wife betakes herself early to the feet of god . It seemed short to [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot in retrospect , but it had really taken the whole of the first year of [their]316-their marriage , and every inch of the way had been a struggle , and every inch of it was stained , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot felt at the time , with [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot heart ’s blood . All that was over now . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot had long since found peace . And [Frederick]75-frederick , from [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot passionately loved bridegroom]317-her passionately loved bridegroom , from [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot worshipped young husband]318-her worshipped young husband , had become second only to [God]73-god on [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot list of duties and forbearances . For years [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had been able to be happy only by forgetting happiness . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot wanted to stay like that . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot wanted to shut out everything that would remind [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot of beautiful things , that might set [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot off again longing , desiring ....

“ [I]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’d like so much to be [friends]2712-friends , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot said earnestly . “ Wo n’t [you]318-her worshipped young husband come and see [me]67-mrs. arbuthnot , or let [me]67-mrs. arbuthnot come to [you]318-her worshipped young husband sometimes ? Chapter 2

Of course [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot was not miserable — how could [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot be , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot asked [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot , when [God]73-god was taking care of [her?—but]324-her?—but [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot let that pass for the moment unrepudiated , because of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot conviction that here was [another fellow - creature in urgent need of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot help]325-another fellow - creature in urgent need of her help ; and not just boots and blankets and better sanitary arrangements this time , but the more delicate help of comprehension , of finding the exact right words .

The exact right words , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot presently discovered , after trying various ones about living for [others]309-others , and prayer , and the peace to be found in placing [oneself]327-oneself unreservedly in [God]73-god ’s hands — to meet all these words [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins had other words , incoherent and yet , for the moment at least , till [one]235-one had had more time , difficult to answer — the exact right words were a suggestion that it would do no harm to answer the advertisement . Non - committal . Mere inquiry . And what disturbed [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot about this suggestion was that [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot did not make it solely to comfort [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ; [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot made it because of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot own strange longing for [the mediaeval castle]2687-the mediaeval castle .

This was very disturbing . There [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was , accustomed to direct , to lead , to advise , to support — except [Frederick]75-frederick ; [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot long since had learned to leave [Frederick]75-frederick to [God]73-god — being led [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot , being influenced and thrown off [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot feet , by just an advertisement , by just [an incoherent stranger]330-an incoherent stranger . It was indeed disturbing . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot failed to understand [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot sudden longing for what was , after all , self - indulgence , when for years no such desire had entered [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot heart .

“ There ’s no harm in simply asking , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot said in a low voice , as if [the vicar]2707-the vicar and [the Savings Bank]321-the savings bank and [all [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot waiting and dependent poor]333-all her waiting and dependent poor were listening and condemning .

[They]334-they got up simultaneously — [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot had a sensation of surprise that [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins should be so tall — and went to a writing - table , and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot wrote to [Z]76-z , [Box 1000]335-box 1000 , The Times , for particulars . [They]334-they both felt that it was [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot who ought to write the letter and do the business part . Not only was [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot used to organising and being practical , but [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot also was older , and certainly calmer ; and [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot had no doubt too that [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was wiser . But if [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was wiser , older and calmer , [[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’s new friend]336-mrs. arbuthnot ’s new friend nevertheless seemed to [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot to be the one who impelled . Incoherent , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot yet impelled . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot appeared to have , apart from [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot need of help , an upsetting kind of character . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot had a curious infectiousness . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot led one on . And the way [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot unsteady mind leaped at conclusions — wrong ones , of course ; witness the one that [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot , [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , was miserable — the way [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot leaped at conclusions was disconcerting .

Whatever [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was , however , and whatever [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot unsteadiness , [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot found [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot sharing [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot excitement and [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot longing ; and when the letter had been posted in the letter - box in [the hall]337-the hall and actually was beyond getting back again , both [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins felt the same sense of guilt .

All this was very unbalancing . That night in [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot prayers [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot asked for guidance . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot felt [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot ought really to ask , straight out and roundly , that [the mediaeval castle]2687-the mediaeval castle should already have been taken by [some one else]363-some one else and the whole thing thus be settled , but [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot courage failed [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot . Suppose [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot prayer were to be answered ? No ; [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot could n’t ask it ; [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot could n’t risk it . For [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , who had no money of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot own , was obliged to live on the proceeds of [Frederick]75-frederick ’s activities , and [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot very nest - egg was the fruit , posthumously ripened , of ancient sin . The way [Frederick]75-frederick made [his]75-frederick living was one of the standing distresses of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot life . [He]75-frederick wrote immensely popular memoirs , regularly , every year , of [the mistresses of [kings]366-kings]365-the mistresses of kings . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot was helpless . Whether [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot liked it or not , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was obliged to live on the proceeds . [He]75-frederick gave [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot a dreadful sofa once , after the success of [his]75-frederick Du Barri memoir , with swollen cushions and soft , receptive lap , and it seemed to [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot a miserable thing that there , in [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot very home]372-her very home , should flaunt this re - incarnation of [a dead old French sinner]373-a dead old french sinner .

Simply good , convinced that morality is the basis of happiness , the fact that [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot and [Frederick]75-frederick should draw [their]374-their sustenance from guilt , however much purged by the passage of centuries , was one of the secret reasons of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot sadness . [The parish]379-the parish flourished because , to take a handful at random , of the ill - behaviour of [the ladies Du Barri]380-the ladies du barri , [Montespan]14-montespan , [Pompadour]15-pompadour , [Ninon de l’Enclos]77-ninon de l’enclos , and even of [learned Maintenon]78-learned maintenon . [The poor]226-the poor were the filter through which the money was passed , to come out , [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot hoped , purified . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot could do no more . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot had tried in days gone by to think the situation out , to discover the exact right course for [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot to take , but had found it , as [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had found [Frederick]75-frederick , too difficult , and had left it , as [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had left [Frederick]75-frederick , to [God]73-god . Nothing of this money was spent on [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot house]382-her house or dress ; those remained , except for the great soft sofa , austere . It was [the poor]226-the poor who profited . [Their]226-the poor very boots were stout with sins . But how difficult it had been . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , groping for guidance , prayed about it to exhaustion . Ought [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot perhaps to refuse to touch the money , to avoid it as [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot would have avoided the sins which were its source ? But then what about [the parish]379-the parish ’s boots ? [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot asked [the vicar]2707-the vicar what [he]2707-the vicar thought , and , through much delicate language , evasive and cautious , it did finally appear that [he]2707-the vicar was for the boots .

At least [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had persuaded [Frederick]75-frederick , when first [he]75-frederick began [his]75-frederick terrible successful career — [he]75-frederick only began it after [their]386-their marriage ; when [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot married [him]75-frederick [he]75-frederick had been [a blameless official attached to [the library of [the British Museum]389-the british museum]388-the library of the british museum]387-a blameless official attached to the library of the british museum — to publish the memoirs under another name , so that [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was not publicly branded . [Hampstead]3-hampstead read the books with glee , and had no idea that [[their]3-hampstead writer]390-their writer lived in its midst . [Frederick]75-frederick was almost unknown , even by sight , in [Hampstead]3-hampstead . [He]75-frederick never went to [any of [its]3-hampstead gatherings]391-any of its gatherings . Whatever it was [he]75-frederick did in the way of recreation was done in [London]2-london , but [he]75-frederick never spoke of what [he]75-frederick did or whom [he]75-frederick saw ; [he]75-frederick might have been perfectly friendless for any mention [he]75-frederick ever made of friends to [[his]75-frederick wife]244-his wife . Only [the vicar]2707-the vicar knew where the money for [the parish]379-the parish came from , and [he]2707-the vicar regarded it , [he]2707-the vicar told [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , as a matter of honour not to mention it .

And at least [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot little house]395-her little house was not haunted by [the loose - lived ladies]396-the loose - lived ladies , for [Frederick]75-frederick did [his]75-frederick work away from [home]222-home . [He]75-frederick had [two rooms near [the British Museum]389-the british museum , which was the scene of [his]75-frederick exhumations]398-two rooms near the british museum , which was the scene of his exhumations , and there [he]75-frederick went every morning , and [he]75-frederick came back long after [[his]75-frederick wife]244-his wife was asleep . Sometimes [he]75-frederick did not come back at all . Sometimes [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot did not see [him]75-frederick for several days together . Then [he]75-frederick would suddenly appear at breakfast , having let [himself]75-frederick in with [his]75-frederick latchkey the night before , very jovial and good - natured and free - handed and glad if [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot would allow [him]75-frederick to give [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot something — [a well - fed man]401-a well - fed man , contented with [the world]186-the world ; [a jolly , full - blooded , satisfied man]403-a jolly , full - blooded , satisfied man . And [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was always gentle , and anxious that [his]75-frederick coffee should be as [he]75-frederick liked it .

[He]75-frederick seemed very happy . Life , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot often thought , however much one tabulated was yet a mystery . There were always [some people]349-some people it was impossible to place . [Frederick]75-frederick was [one of [them]349-some people]405-one of them . [He]75-frederick did n’t seem to bear the remotest resemblance to [the original Frederick]406-the original frederick . [He]75-frederick did n’t seem to have the least need of any of the things [he]75-frederick used to say were so important and beautiful — love , [home]222-home , complete communion of thoughts , complete immersion in each other ’s interests . After those early painful attempts to hold [him]75-frederick up to the point from which [they]408-they had hand in hand so splendidly started , attempts in which [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot had got terribly hurt and [the Frederick [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot supposed [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had married]409-the frederick she supposed she had married was mangled out of recognition , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot hung [him]75-frederick up finally by [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot bedside as the chief subject of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot prayers , and left [him]75-frederick , except for those , entirely to [God]73-god . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot had loved [Frederick]75-frederick too deeply to be able now to do anything but pray for [him]75-frederick . [He]75-frederick had no idea that [he]75-frederick never went out of [the house]410-the house without [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot blessing going with [him]75-frederick too , hovering , like a little echo of finished love , round that once dear head . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot did n’t dare think of [him]75-frederick as [he]75-frederick used to be , as [he]75-frederick had seemed to [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot to be in those marvellous first days of [their]411-their love - making , of [their]411-their marriage . [[Her]67-mrs. arbuthnot child]412-her child had died ; [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had nothing , nobody of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot own to lavish [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot on . [The poor]226-the poor became [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot children]414-her children , and [God]73-god the object of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot love . What could be happier than such a life , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot sometimes asked [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot ; but [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot face , and particularly [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot eyes , continued sad .

“ Perhaps when [we]2729-we ’re old . . . perhaps when [we]2729-we are both quite old . . . ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot would think wistfully .

Chapter 3

[The owner of [the mediaeval castle]2687-the mediaeval castle]415-the owner of the mediaeval castle was [an Englishman]417-an englishman , [a Mr. Briggs]79-briggs , who was in [London]2-london at the moment and wrote that [it]2687-the mediaeval castle had beds enough for [eight people]418-eight people , exclusive of [servants]419-servants , [three sitting - rooms]420-three sitting - rooms , [battlements]421-battlements , [dungeons]422-dungeons , and electric light . The rent was £ 60 for the month , [the servants]423-the servants ’ wages were extra , and [he]415-the owner of the mediaeval castle wanted references — [he]415-the owner of the mediaeval castle wanted assurances that the second half of [his]415-the owner of the mediaeval castle rent would be paid , the first half being paid in advance , and [he]415-the owner of the mediaeval castle wanted assurances of respectability from [a solicitor]209-a solicitor , or [a doctor]425-a doctor , or [a clergyman]426-a clergyman . [He]415-the owner of the mediaeval castle was very polite in [his]415-the owner of the mediaeval castle letter , explaining that [his]415-the owner of the mediaeval castle desire for references was what was usual and should be regarded as a mere formality .

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins had not thought of references , and [they]427-they had not dreamed a rent could be so high . In [their]427-they minds had floated sums like three guineas a week ; or less , seeing that [the place]428-the place was small and old .

Sixty pounds for a single month .

It staggered [them]427-they .

Before [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’s eyes rose up boots : endless vistas , all the stout boots that sixty pounds would buy ; and besides the rent there would be [the servants]423-the servants ’ wagesc , and the food , and the railway journeys out and [home]222-home . While as for references , these did indeed seem a stumbling - block ; it did seem impossible to give any without making [their]427-they plan more public than [they]427-they had intended .

[They]427-they had both — even [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , lured for once away from perfect candour by the realisation of the great saving of trouble and criticism an imperfect explanation would produce — [they]427-they had both thought it would be a good plan to give out , each to [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot own circle]431-her own circle , [their]427-they circles being luckily distinct , that [each]432-each was going to stay with [a friend who had [a house in [Italy]13-italy]434-a house in italy]433-a friend who had a house in italy . It would be true as far as it went — [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins asserted that it would be quite true , but [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot thought it would n’t be quite — and it was the only way , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins said , to keep [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins even approximately quiet . To spend any of [her]64-mrs. wilkins money just on the mere getting to [Italy]13-italy would cause [him]435-him indignation ; what [he]435-him would say if [he]435-him knew [she]64-mrs. wilkins was renting part of [a mediaeval castle]436-a mediaeval castle on [her]64-mrs. wilkins own account [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins preferred not to think . It would take [him]435-him days to say it all ; and this although it was [her]64-mrs. wilkins very own money , and not a penny of it had ever been [his]435-him .

“ But [I]64-mrs. wilkins expect , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins said , “ [[your]435-him husband]2730-your husband is just the same . [I]64-mrs. wilkins expect [all husbands]2731-all husbands are alike in the long run . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot said nothing , because [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot reason for not wanting [Frederick]75-frederick to know was the exactly opposite one — [Frederick]75-frederick would be only too pleased for [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot to go , [he]75-frederick would not mind it in the very least ; indeed , [he]75-frederick would hail such a manifestation of self - indulgence and worldliness with an amusement that would hurt , and urge [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot to have a good time and not to hurry [home]222-home with a crushing detachment . Far better , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot thought , to be missed by [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins than to be sped by [Frederick]75-frederick . To be missed , to be needed , from whatever motive , was , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot thought , better than the complete loneliness of not being missed or needed at all .

[She]67-mrs. arbuthnot therefore said nothing , and allowed [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins to leap at [her]64-mrs. wilkins conclusions unchecked . But [they]438-they did , both of [them]438-they , for a whole day feel that the only thing to be done was to renounce [the mediaeval castle]2687-the mediaeval castle ; and it was in arriving at this bitter decision that [they]438-they really realised how acute had been [their]438-they longing for it .

Then [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , whose mind was trained in the finding of ways out of difficulties , found a way out of the reference difficulty ; and simultaneously [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins had a vision revealing to [her]64-mrs. wilkins how to reduce the rent .

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’s plan was simple , and completely successful . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot took the whole of the rent in person to [the owner]440-the owner , drawing it out of [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot Savings Bank]441-her savings bank — again [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot looked furtive and apologetic , as if [the clerk]442-the clerk must know the money was wanted for purposes of self - indulgence — and , going up with the six ten pound notes in [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot hand - bag to [the address near [the Brompton Oratory]444-the brompton oratory where [the owner]440-the owner lived]443-the address near the brompton oratory where the owner lived , presented them to [him]440-the owner , waiving [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot right to pay only half . And when [he]440-the owner saw [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot , and [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot parted hair and soft dark eyes and sober apparel , and heard [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot grave voice , [he]440-the owner told [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot not to bother about writing round for those references .

“ It ’ll be all right , ”[440-the owner] [he]440-the owner said , scribbling a receipt for the rent . “ Do sit down , wo n’t [you]67-mrs. arbuthnot ? Nasty day , is n’t it ? [You]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’ll find [the old castle]2732-the old castle has lots of sunshine , whatever else [it]2732-the old castle has n’t got . [Husband]302-husband going ? ”[440-the owner]

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , unused to anything but candour , looked troubled at this question and began to murmur inarticulately , and [the owner]440-the owner at once concluded that [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was [a widow]447-a widow — [a war one]448-a war one , of course , for [other widows]449-other widows were old — and that [he]440-the owner had been [a fool]284-a fool not to guess it .

“ Oh , [I]440-the owner ’m sorry , ”[440-the owner] [he]440-the owner said , turning red right up to [his]440-the owner fair hair . “ [I]440-the owner did n’t mean — h’m , h’m , h’m — ”[440-the owner]

[He]440-the owner ran [his]440-the owner eye over the receipt [he]440-the owner had written . “ Yes , [I]440-the owner think that ’s all right , ”[440-the owner] [he]440-the owner said , getting up and giving it to [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot . “ Now , ”[440-the owner] [he]440-the owner added , taking the six notes [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot held out and smiling , for [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot was agreeable to look at , “ [I]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’m richer , and [you]440-the owner ’re happier . “ [I]67-mrs. arbuthnot think [you]440-the owner know , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot with [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot sweet smile .

[He]440-the owner laughed and opened the door for [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot . It was a pity the interview was over . [He]440-the owner would have liked to ask [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot to lunch with [him]440-the owner . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot made [him]440-the owner think of [[his]440-the owner mother]451-his mother , of [[his]440-the owner nurse]452-his nurse , of all things kind and comforting , besides having the attraction of not being [[his]440-the owner mother]451-his mother or [[his]440-the owner nurse]452-his nurse .

“ [I]440-the owner hope [you]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’ll like [the old place]2734-the old place , ”[440-the owner] [he]440-the owner said , holding [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot hand a minute at the door . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot smiled and said good - bye and thanked [him]440-the owner . Without the least trouble and at once [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had got [him]440-the owner placed in [his]440-the owner proper category : [he]440-the owner was [an artist]456-an artist and of an effervescent temperament .

[Rose Arbuthnot]80-rose .

[Her]67-mrs. arbuthnot letter , making the appointment , lay on the table .

Pretty name .

That difficulty , then , was overcome . But there still remained the other one , the really annihilating effect of the expense on the nest - eggs , and especially on [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s , which was in size , compared with [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’s , as the egg of the plover to that of the duck ; and this in its turn was overcome by the vision vouchsafed to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , revealing to [her]64-mrs. wilkins the steps to be taken for [its]459-its overcoming . Having got [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore — the beautiful , the religious name , fascinated [them]460-them — [they]460-them in [their]460-them turn would advertise in [the Agony Column of The Times]461-the agony column of the times , and would inquire after [two more ladies]462-two more ladies , of similar desires to [their]462-two more ladies own , to join [them]462-two more ladies and share the expenses .

At once the strain of the nest - eggs would be reduced from half to a quarter . [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was prepared to fling [her]64-mrs. wilkins entire egg into the adventure , but [she]64-mrs. wilkins realised that if it were to cost even sixpence over [her]64-mrs. wilkins ninety pounds [her]64-mrs. wilkins position would be terrible . Imagine going to [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins and saying , “ [I]64-mrs. wilkins owe . ”[64-mrs. wilkins] It would be awful enough if some day circumstances forced [her]64-mrs. wilkins to say , “ [I]64-mrs. wilkins have no nest - egg , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] but at least [she]64-mrs. wilkins would be supported in such a case by the knowledge that the egg had been [her]64-mrs. wilkins own . [She]64-mrs. wilkins therefore , though prepared to fling [her]64-mrs. wilkins last penny into the adventure , was not prepared to fling into it a single farthing that was not demonstrably [her]64-mrs. wilkins own ; and [she]64-mrs. wilkins felt that if [her]64-mrs. wilkins share of the rent was reduced to fifteen pounds only , [she]64-mrs. wilkins would have a safe margin for the other expenses . Also [they]462-two more ladies might economise very much on food — gather olives off [their]462-two more ladies own trees and eat them , for instance , and perhaps catch fish .

Of course , as [they]462-two more ladies pointed out to each other , [they]462-two more ladies could reduce the rent to an almost negligible sum by increasing the number of [sharers]463-sharers ; [they]462-two more ladies could have [six more ladies]464-six more ladies instead of two if [they]462-two more ladies wanted to , seeing that there were eight beds . But supposing the eight beds were distributed in [couples]465-couples in [four rooms]466-four rooms , it would not be altogether what [they]465-couples wanted , to find [themselves]465-couples shut up at night with [a stranger]467-a stranger . Besides , [they]462-two more ladies thought that perhaps having so many would not be quite so peaceful . After all , [they]462-two more ladies were going to [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore for peace and rest and joy , and [six more ladies]464-six more ladies , especially if [they]464-six more ladies got into [[one]235-one ’s bedroom]470-one ’s bedroom , might a little interfere with that .

However , there seemed to be [only two ladies in [England]17-england]471-only two ladies in england at that moment who had any wish to join [them]462-two more ladies , for [they]471-only two ladies in england had only two answers to [their]471-only two ladies in england advertisement .

“ Well , [we]462-two more ladies only want two , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , quickly recovering , for [she]64-mrs. wilkins had imagined a great rush .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was unable to come to [the club]210-the club because , [she]83-mrs. fisher explained by letter , [she]83-mrs. fisher could not walk without a stick ; therefore [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins went to [her]83-mrs. fisher .

“ [We]493-they shall hear that from [her]83-mrs. fisher own lips , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot .

[She]83-mrs. fisher waived references .

[The two]536-the two as [they]536-the two walked to [the station]537-the station in [Kensington High Street]24-kensington high street could not help thinking that this way of putting it was lofty .
