Chapter 4

It had been arranged that [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , travelling together , should arrive at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore on the evening of March 31st — [the owner]440-the owner , who told [them]542-them how to get [there]296-there , appreciated [their]542-them disinclination to begin [their]542-them time in [it]296-there on April 1st — and [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , as yet unacquainted and therefore under no obligations to bore [each other on the journey]544-each other on the journey , for only towards the end would [they]542-them find out by a process of sifting who [they]542-them were , were to arrive on the morning of April 2nd . In this way everything would be got nicely ready for [the two who seemed , in spite of the equality of the sharing , yet to have something about [them]542-them of [guests]546-guests]545-the two who seemed , in spite of the equality of the sharing , yet to have something about them of guests .

There were disagreeable incidents towards the end of March , when [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , [her]64-mrs. wilkins heart in [her]64-mrs. wilkins mouth and [her]64-mrs. wilkins face a mixture of guilt , terror and determination , told [[her]64-mrs. wilkins husband]204-her husband that [she]64-mrs. wilkins had been invited to [Italy]13-italy , and [he]204-her husband declined to believe it . Of course [he]204-her husband declined to believe it . [Nobody]231-nobody had ever invited [[his]204-her husband wife]244-his wife to [Italy]13-italy before . There was no precedent . [He]204-her husband required proofs . The only proof was [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins had produced [her]64-mrs. wilkins ; but after what entreaties , what passionate persuading ! [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot had not imagined [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot would have to face [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins and say things to [him]65-mr. wilkins that were short of the truth , and it brought home to [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot what [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had for some time suspected , that [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was slipping more and more away from [God]73-god .

Indeed , the whole of March was filled with unpleasant , anxious moments . It was an uneasy month . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’s conscience , made super - sensitive by years of pampering , could not reconcile what [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was doing with its own high standard of what was right . It gave [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot little peace . It nudged [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot at [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot prayers . It punctuated [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot entreaties for divine guidance with disconcerting questions , such as , “ Are [you]67-mrs. arbuthnot not [a hypocrite]2754-a hypocrite ? Do [you]67-mrs. arbuthnot really mean that ? Would [you]67-mrs. arbuthnot not , frankly , be disappointed if that prayer were granted ? ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot]

The prolonged wet , raw weather was on the side too of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot conscience , producing far more sickness than usual among [the poor]226-the poor . [They]226-the poor had bronchitis ; [they]226-the poor had fevers ; there was no end to the distress . And here [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was going off , spending precious money on going off , simply and solely to be happy . [One woman]551-one woman . [One woman]551-one woman being happy , and [these piteous multitudes]553-these piteous multitudes . . .

[She]67-mrs. arbuthnot was unable to look [the vicar]2707-the vicar in the face . [He]2707-the vicar did not know , [nobody]231-nobody knew , what [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was going to do , and from the very beginning [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was unable to look [anybody]202-anybody in the face . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot excused [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot from making speeches appealing for money . How could [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot stand up and ask [people]278-people for money when [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot was spending so much on [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot own selfish pleasure ? Nor did it help [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot or quiet [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot that , having actually told [Frederick]75-frederick , in [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot desire to make up for what [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was squandering , that [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot would be grateful if [he]75-frederick would let [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot have some money , [he]75-frederick instantly gave [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot a cheque for £ 100 . [He]75-frederick asked no questions . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot was scarlet . [He]75-frederick looked at [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot a moment and then looked away . It was a relief to [Frederick]75-frederick that [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot should take some money . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot gave it all immediately to [the organisation [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot worked with]558-the organisation she worked with , and found [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot more tangled in doubts than ever .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , on the contrary , had no doubts . [She]64-mrs. wilkins was quite certain that it was a most proper thing to have a holiday , and altogether right and beautiful to spend [one]235-one ’s own hard - collected savings on being happy .

“ Think how much nicer [we]2755-we shall be when [we]2755-we come back , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins said to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , encouraging [that pale lady]560-that pale lady .

No , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins had no doubts , but [she]64-mrs. wilkins had fears ; and March was for [her]64-mrs. wilkins too an anxious month , with [the unconscious Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins coming back daily to [his]65-mr. wilkins dinner and eating [his]65-mr. wilkins fish in the silence of imagined security .

Also things happen so awkwardly . It really is astonishing , how awkwardly they happen . [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , who was very careful all this month to give [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins only the food [he]65-mr. wilkins liked , buying it and hovering over its cooking with a zeal more than common , succeeded so well that [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins was pleased ; definitely pleased ; so much pleased that [he]65-mr. wilkins began to think that [he]65-mr. wilkins might , after all , have married [the right wife]561-the right wife instead of , as [he]65-mr. wilkins had frequently suspected , [the wrong one]562-the wrong one . The result was that on the third Sunday in the month — [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins had made up [her]64-mrs. wilkins trembling mind that on the fourth Sunday , there being five in that March and it being on the fifth of [them]563-them that [she]64-mrs. wilkins and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot were to start , [she]64-mrs. wilkins would tell [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins of [her]64-mrs. wilkins invitation — on the third Sunday , then , after a very well - cooked lunch in which the Yorkshire pudding had melted in [his]65-mr. wilkins mouth and the apricot tart had been so perfect that [he]65-mr. wilkins ate it all , [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , smoking [his]65-mr. wilkins cigar by the brightly burning fire the while hail gusts banged on the window , said : “ [I]64-mrs. wilkins am thinking of taking [you]64-mrs. wilkins to [Italy]13-italy for Easter . ”[64-mrs. wilkins] And paused for [her]64-mrs. wilkins astounded and grateful ecstasy .

None came . The silence in [the room]219-the room , except for the hail hitting the windows and the gay roar of the fire , was complete . [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins could not speak . [She]64-mrs. wilkins was dumbfounded . The next Sunday was the day [she]64-mrs. wilkins had meant to break [her]64-mrs. wilkins news to [him]65-mr. wilkins , and [she]64-mrs. wilkins had not yet even prepared the form of words in which [she]64-mrs. wilkins would break it .

[Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , who had not been abroad since before the war , and was noticing with increasing disgust , as week followed week of wind and rain , the peculiar persistent vileness of the weather , had slowly conceived a desire to get away from [England]17-england for Easter . [He]65-mr. wilkins was doing very well in [his]65-mr. wilkins business . [He]65-mr. wilkins could afford a trip . [Switzerland]25-switzerland was useless in April . There was a familiar sound about Easter in [Italy]13-italy . To [Italy]13-italy [he]65-mr. wilkins would go ; and as it would cause comment if [he]65-mr. wilkins did not take [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife , take [her]244-his wife [he]65-mr. wilkins must — besides , [she]244-his wife would be useful ; [a second person]566-a second person was always useful in [a country whose language [one]235-one did not speak for holding things , for waiting with the luggage]567-a country whose language one did not speak for holding things , for waiting with the luggage .

[He]65-mr. wilkins had expected an explosion of gratitude and excitement . The absence of it was incredible . [She]244-his wife could not , [he]65-mr. wilkins concluded , have heard . Probably [she]244-his wife was absorbed in some foolish day - dream . It was regrettable how childish [she]244-his wife remained .

[He]65-mr. wilkins turned [his]65-mr. wilkins head — [their]569-their chairs were in front of the fire — and looked at [her]244-his wife . [She]244-his wife was staring straight into the fire , and it was no doubt the fire that made [her]244-his wife face so red .

“ [I]65-mr. wilkins am thinking , ”[65-mr. wilkins] [he]65-mr. wilkins repeated , raising [his]65-mr. wilkins clear , cultivated voice and speaking with acerbity , for inattention at such a moment was deplorable , “ of taking [you]244-his wife to [Italy]13-italy for Easter . Did [you]244-his wife not hear [me]65-mr. wilkins ? ”[65-mr. wilkins]

Yes , [she]244-his wife had heard [him]65-mr. wilkins , and [she]244-his wife had been wondering at the extraordinary coincidence — really most extraordinary — [she]244-his wife was just going to tell [him]65-mr. wilkins how — how [she]244-his wife had been invited — [a friend]570-a friend had invited [her]244-his wife — [Easter]92-easter , too — Easter was in April , was n’t [it?—her friend]571-it?—her friend had a — had [a house]572-a house [there]296-there .

In fact [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , driven by terror , guilt and surprise , had been more incoherent if possible than usual .

It was a dreadful afternoon . [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , profoundly indignant , besides having [his]65-mr. wilkins intended treat coming back on [him]65-mr. wilkins like a blessing to roost , cross - examined [her]244-his wife with the utmost severity . [He]65-mr. wilkins demanded that [she]244-his wife refuse the invitation . [He]65-mr. wilkins demanded that , since [she]244-his wife had so outrageously accepted it without consulting [him]65-mr. wilkins , [she]244-his wife should write and cancel [her]244-his wife acceptance . Finding [himself]65-mr. wilkins up against an unsuspected , shocking rock of obstinacy in [her]244-his wife , [he]65-mr. wilkins then declined to believe [she]244-his wife had been invited to [Italy]13-italy at all . [He]65-mr. wilkins declined to believe in [this Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , of whom till that moment [he]65-mr. wilkins had never heard ; and it was only when [the gentle creature]574-the gentle creature was brought round — with such difficulty , with such a desire on [her]244-his wife part to throw the whole thing up rather than tell [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins less than the truth — and [herself]244-his wife endorsed [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife ’s statements that [he]65-mr. wilkins was able to give [them]576-them credence . [He]65-mr. wilkins could not but believe [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot . [She]244-his wife produced the precise effect on [him]65-mr. wilkins that [she]244-his wife did on [Tube officials]533-tube officials . [She]244-his wife hardly needed to say anything . But that made no difference to [her]244-his wife conscience , which knew and would not let [her]244-his wife forget that [she]244-his wife had given [him]65-mr. wilkins an incomplete impression . “ Do [you]65-mr. wilkins , ”[244-his wife] asked [her]244-his wife conscience , “ see any real difference between an incomplete impression and a completely stated lie ? [God]73-god sees none . ”[244-his wife]

The remainder of [March]93-march was a confused bad dream . Both [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins were shattered ; try as [they]578-we would not to , [both]579-both felt extraordinarily guilty ; and when on the morning of the 30th [they]578-we did finally get off there was no exhilaration about the departure , no holiday feeling at all .

“ [We]578-we ’ve been too good — much too good , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins kept on murmuring as [they]578-we walked up and down the platform at [Victoria]26-victoria , having arrived [there]296-there an hour before [they]578-we need have , “ and that ’s why [we]578-we feel as though [we]578-we ’re doing wrong . [We]578-we ’re brow - beaten — [we’re]578-we not any longer [real human beings]2756-real human beings . [Real human beings]2756-real human beings are n’t ever as good as [we]578-we ’ve been . [Oh”—she]94-oh”—she[64-mrs. wilkins] clenched [her]64-mrs. wilkins thin hands—“to think that [we]578-we ought to be so happy now , here on [the very station]2758-the very station , actually starting , and [we]578-we ’re not , and it ’s being spoilt for [us]578-we just simply because [we]578-we ’ve spoilt [them]581-them ! What have [we]578-we done — what have [we]578-we done , [I]64-mrs. wilkins should like to know , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins inquired of [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot indignantly , “ except for once want to go away by [ourselves]578-we and have a little rest from [them]581-them ? ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , patiently pacing , did not ask who [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot meant by [them]581-them , because [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot knew . [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins meant [[their]581-them husbands]582-their husbands , persisting in [her]64-mrs. wilkins assumption that [Frederick]75-frederick was as indignant as [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins over the departure of [[his]75-frederick wife]244-his wife , whereas [Frederick]75-frederick did not even know [[his]75-frederick wife]244-his wife had gone .

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , always silent about [him]75-frederick , had said nothing of this to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins . [Frederick]75-frederick went too deep into [her]64-mrs. wilkins heart for [her]64-mrs. wilkins to talk about [him]75-frederick . [He]75-frederick was having an extra bout of work finishing another of those dreadful books , and had been away practically continually the last few weeks , and was away when [she]64-mrs. wilkins left . Why should [she]64-mrs. wilkins tell [him]75-frederick beforehand ? Sure as [she]64-mrs. wilkins so miserably was that [he]75-frederick would have no objection to anything [she]64-mrs. wilkins did , [she]64-mrs. wilkins merely wrote [him]75-frederick a note and put it on the hall - table ready for [him]75-frederick if and when [he]75-frederick should come [home]222-home . [She]64-mrs. wilkins said [she]64-mrs. wilkins was going for a month ’s holiday as [she]64-mrs. wilkins needed a rest and [she]64-mrs. wilkins had not had one for so long , and that [Gladys]95-gladys , [the efficient parlourmaid]586-the efficient parlourmaid , had orders to see to [his]75-frederick comforts . [She]64-mrs. wilkins did not say where [she]64-mrs. wilkins was going ; there was no reason why [she]64-mrs. wilkins should ; [he]75-frederick would not be interested , [he]75-frederick would not care .

The day was wretched , blustering and wet ; the crossing was atrocious , and [they]587-they were very sick . But after having been very sick , just to arrive at [Calais]27-calais and not be sick was happiness , and it was there that the real splendour of what [they]587-they were doing first began to warm [their]587-they benumbed spirits . It got hold of [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins first , and spread from [her]64-mrs. wilkins like a rose - coloured flame over [[her]64-mrs. wilkins pale companion]588-her pale companion . [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins at [Calais]27-calais , where [they]587-they restored [themselves]587-they with soles because of [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s desire to eat a sole [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins was n’t having — [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins at [Calais]27-calais had already begun to dwindle and seem less important . [None of [the French porters]590-the french porters]589-none of the french porters knew [him]75-frederick ; [not a single official at [Calais]27-calais]591-not a single official at calais cared a fig for [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins . In [Paris]28-paris there was no time to think of [him]75-frederick because [[their]587-they train]592-their train was late and [they]587-they only just caught [the Turin train]593-the turin train at [the Gare de [Lyons]29-lyons]594-the gare de lyons ; and by the afternoon of the next day when [they]587-they got into [Italy]13-italy , [England]17-england , [Frederick]75-frederick , [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , [the vicar]2707-the vicar , [the poor]226-the poor , [Hampstead]3-hampstead , [the club]210-the club , [Shoolbred]91-shoolbred , [everybody]2701-everybody and everything , the whole inflamed sore dreariness , had faded to the dimness of a dream .

Chapter 5

It was cloudy in [Italy]13-italy , which surprised [them]587-they . [They]587-they had expected brilliant sunshine . But never mind : it was [Italy]13-italy , and the very clouds looked fat . Neither of [them]587-they had ever been [there]296-there before . [Both]579-both gazed out of the windows with rapt faces . The hours flew as long as it was daylight , and after that there was the excitement of getting nearer , getting quite near , getting there . At [Genoa]30-genoa it had begun to rain — [Genoa]30-genoa ! Imagine actually being at [Genoa]30-genoa , seeing its name written up in [the station]537-the station just like any other name — at [Nervi]31-nervi it was pouring , and when at last towards midnight , for again [the train]540-the train was late , [they]587-they got to [Mezzago]32-mezzago , the rain was coming down in what seemed solid sheets . But it was [Italy]13-italy . Nothing it did could be bad . The very rain was different — straight rain , falling properly on to one ’s umbrella ; not that violently blowing English stuff that got in everywhere . And it did leave off ; and when it did , behold [the earth]603-the earth would be strewn with roses .

[Mr. Briggs]79-briggs , [[San Salvatore]16-san salvatore ’s owner]604-san salvatore ’s owner , had said , “ [You]2759-you get out at [Mezzago]32-mezzago , and then [you]2759-you drive . ”[79-briggs] But [he]79-briggs had forgotten what [he]79-briggs amply knew , that trains in [Italy]13-italy are sometimes late , and [he]79-briggs had imagined [[his]79-briggs tenants]605-his tenants arriving at [Mezzago]32-mezzago at eight o’clock and finding a string of flys to choose from .

[The train]540-the train was four hours late , and when [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins scrambled down the ladder - like high steps of [[their]587-they carriage]607-their carriage into the black downpour , [their]587-they skirts sweeping off great pools of sooty wet because [their]587-they hands were full of suit - cases , if it had not been for the vigilance of [Domenico]96-domenico , [the gardener at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore]608-the gardener at san salvatore , [they]587-they would have found nothing for [them]587-they to drive in . [All ordinary flys]609-all ordinary flys had long since gone [home]222-home . [Domenico]96-domenico , foreseeing this , had sent [[his]96-domenico aunt]611-his aunt ’s fly , driven by [[her]611-his aunt son]612-her son [[his]612-her son cousin]613-his cousin ; and [[his]96-domenico aunt]611-his aunt and [her]611-his aunt fly lived in [Castagneto]33-castagneto , [the village]615-the village crouching at the feet of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , and therefore , however late [the train]540-the train was , the fly would not dare come [home]222-home without containing that which it had been sent to fetch .

[[Domenico]96-domenico ’s cousin]618-domenico ’s cousin ’s name was [Beppo]97-beppo , and [he]96-domenico presently emerged out of the dark where [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins stood , uncertain what to do next after [the train]540-the train had gone on , for [they]620-they could see [no porter]621-no porter and [they]620-they thought from the feel of it that [they]620-they were standing not so much on [a platform]622-a platform as in the middle of the permanent way .

[Beppo]97-beppo , who had been searching for [them]620-they , emerged from the dark with a kind of pounce and talked Italian to [them]620-they vociferously . [Beppo]97-beppo was [a most respectable young man]623-a most respectable young man , but [he]97-beppo did not look as if [he]97-beppo were , especially not in the dark , and [he]97-beppo had a dripping hat slouched over one eye . [They]620-they did not like the way [he]97-beppo seized [their]620-they suit - cases . [He]97-beppo could not be , [they]620-they thought , [a porter]624-a porter . However , [they]620-they presently from out of [his]97-beppo streaming talk discerned the words [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , and after that [they]620-they kept on saying them to [him]97-beppo , for it was the only Italian [they]620-they knew , as [they]620-they hurried after [him]97-beppo , unwilling to lose sight of [their]620-they suit - cases , stumbling across rails and through puddles out to where in [the road]2745-the road a small , high fly stood .

Its hood was up , and its horse was in an attitude of thought . [They]620-they climbed in , and the minute [they]620-they were in — [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , indeed , could hardly be called in — the horse awoke with a start from [its]626-its reverie and immediately began going [home]222-home rapidly ; without [Beppo]97-beppo ; without the suit - cases .

[Beppo]97-beppo darted after [him]97-beppo , making the night ring with [his]97-beppo shouts , and caught the hanging reins just in time . [He]97-beppo explained proudly , and as it seemed to [him]97-beppo with perfect clearness , that the horse always did that , being a fine animal full of corn and blood , and cared for by [him]97-beppo , [Beppo]97-beppo , as if [he]97-beppo were [[his]97-beppo own son]628-his own son , and [the ladies]629-the ladies must not be alarmed — [he]97-beppo had noticed [they]629-the ladies were clutching each other ; but clear , and loud , and profuse of words though [he]97-beppo was , [they]629-the ladies only looked at [him]97-beppo blankly .

[He]97-beppo went on talking , however , while [he]97-beppo piled the suit - cases up round them , sure that sooner or later [they]629-the ladies must understand [him]97-beppo , especially as [he]97-beppo was careful to talk very loud and illustrate everything [he]97-beppo said with the simplest elucidatory gestures , but [they]629-the ladies both continued only to look at [him]97-beppo . [They]629-the ladies both , [he]97-beppo noticed sympathetically , had white faces , fatigued faces , and [they]629-the ladies both had big eyes , fatigued eyes . [They]629-the ladies were [beautiful ladies]630-beautiful ladies , [he]97-beppo thought , and [their]629-the ladies eyes , looking at [him]97-beppo over the tops of the suit - cases watching [his]97-beppo every movement — there were no trunks , only numbers of suit - cases — were like the eyes of [the Mother of [God]73-god]631-the mother of god . The only thing [the ladies]629-the ladies said , and [they]629-the ladies repeated it at regular intervals , even after [they]629-the ladies had started , gently prodding [him]97-beppo as [he]97-beppo sat on [his]97-beppo box to call [his]97-beppo attention to it , was , “ [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore ? ”[629-the ladies]

And each time [he]97-beppo answered vociferously , encouragingly , “ Sì , sì — [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore . ”[97-beppo]

“ [We]633-they do n’t know of course if [he]97-beppo ’s taking [us]633-they [there]296-there , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot at last in a low voice , after [they]633-they had been driving as it seemed to [them]633-they a long while , and had got off the paving - stones of [the sleep - shrouded town]634-the sleep - shrouded town and were out on [a winding road]635-a winding road with what [they]633-they could just see was a low wall on [their]633-they left beyond which was a great black emptiness and the sound of [the sea]2735-the sea . On [their]633-they right was something close and steep and high and black — rocks , [they]633-they whispered to [each other]207-each other ; huge rocks .

“ No — [we]633-they do n’t know , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] agreed [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , a slight coldness passing down [her]64-mrs. wilkins spine .

[They]633-they felt very uncomfortable . It was so late . It was so dark . [The road]2745-the road was so lonely . Suppose a wheel came off . Suppose [they]633-they met [Fascisti]98-fascisti , or the opposite of [Fascisti]98-fascisti . How sorry [they]633-they were now that [they]633-they had not slept at [Genoa]30-genoa and come on the next morning in daylight .

“ But that would have been the first of [April]99-april , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , in a low voice .

“ It is that now , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot beneath [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot breath .

“ So it is , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] murmured [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins .

[They]633-they were silent .

[Beppo]97-beppo turned round on [his]97-beppo box — a disquieting habit already noticed , for surely [his]97-beppo horse ought to be carefully watched — and again addressed [them]633-they with what [he]97-beppo was convinced was lucidity — no patois , and the clearest explanatory movements .

How much [they]633-they wished [[their]633-they mothers]639-their mothers had made [them]633-they learn Italian when [they]633-they were little . If only now [they]633-they could have said , “ Please sit round the right way and look after the horse . ”[633-they] [They]633-they did not even know what horse was in Italian . It was contemptible to be so ignorant .

In [their]633-they anxiety , for [the road]2745-the road twisted round great jutting rocks , and on [their]633-they left was only the low wall to keep [them]633-they out of [the sea]2735-the sea should anything happen , [they]633-they too began to gesticulate , waving [their]633-they hands at [Beppo]97-beppo , pointing ahead . [They]633-they wanted [him]97-beppo to turn round again and face [his]97-beppo horse , that was all . [He]97-beppo thought [they]633-they wanted [him]97-beppo to drive faster ; and there followed a terrifying ten minutes during which , as [he]97-beppo supposed , [he]97-beppo was gratifying [them]633-they . [He]97-beppo was proud of [his]97-beppo horse , and it could go very fast . [He]97-beppo rose in [his]97-beppo seat , the whip cracked , the horse rushed forward , the rocks leaped towards [them]633-they , the little fly swayed , the suit - cases heaved , [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins clung . In this way [they]633-they continued , swaying , heaving , clattering , clinging , till at a point near [Castagneto]33-castagneto there was a rise in [the road]2745-the road , and on reaching the foot of the rise the horse , who knew every inch of the way , stopped suddenly , throwing everything in the fly into a heap , and then proceeded up at the slowest of walks .

[Beppo]97-beppo twisted [himself]97-beppo round to receive [their]633-they admiration , laughing with pride in [his]97-beppo horse .

There was no answering laugh from [the beautiful ladies]643-the beautiful ladies . [Their]643-the beautiful ladies eyes , fixed on [him]97-beppo , seemed bigger than ever , and [their]643-the beautiful ladies faces against the black of the night showed milky .

But here at least , once [they]633-they were up [the slope]644-the slope , were [houses]645-houses . [The rocks]646-the rocks left off , and there were [houses]645-houses ; the low wall left off , and there were [houses]645-houses ; [the sea]2735-the sea shrunk away , and the sound of it ceased , and the loneliness of [the road]2745-the road was finished . No lights anywhere , of course , [nobody]231-nobody to see [them]633-they pass ; and yet [Beppo]97-beppo , when [the houses]652-the houses began , after looking over [his]97-beppo shoulder and shouting “ Castagneto ”[97-beppo] at [the ladies]629-the ladies , once more stood up and cracked [his]97-beppo whip and once more made [his]97-beppo horse dash forward .

“ [We]654-they shall be [there]296-there in a minute , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot said to [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot , holding on .

“ [We]654-they shall soon stop now , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins said to [herself]64-mrs. wilkins , holding on . [They]654-they said nothing aloud , because nothing would have been heard above the whip - cracking and the wheel - clattering and the boisterous inciting noises [Beppo]97-beppo was making at [his]97-beppo horse .

Anxiously [they]654-they strained [their]654-they eyes for any sight of [the beginning of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore]655-the beginning of san salvatore .

[They]654-they had supposed and hoped that after a reasonable amount of [village]656-village a mediaeval archway would loom upon [them]654-they , and through [it]657-it [they]654-they would drive into [a garden]658-a garden and draw up at an open , welcoming door , with light streaming from [it]657-it and [those servants standing in [it]657-it who , according to the advertisement , remained]659-those servants standing in it who , according to the advertisement , remained .

Instead the fly suddenly stopped .

Peering out [they]654-they could see [they]654-they were still in [the village street]660-the village street , with [small dark houses each side]661-small dark houses each side ; and [Beppo]97-beppo , throwing the reins over the horse ’s back as if completely confident this time that [he]97-beppo would not go any farther , got down off [his]97-beppo box . At the same moment , springing as it seemed out of nothing , [a man]662-a man and [several half - grown boys]663-several half - grown boys appeared on each side of the fly and began dragging out the suit - cases .

“ No , no — [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , [San Salvatore”—exclaimed[664-she] Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , trying to hold on to what suit - cases [she]664-she could .

“ Sì , sì — [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , ”[654-they] [they]654-they all shouted , pulling .

“ This ca n’t be [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , turning to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , who sat quite still watching [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot suit - cases being taken from [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot with the same patience [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot applied to lesser evils . [She]64-mrs. wilkins knew [she]64-mrs. wilkins could do nothing if [these men]665-these men were [wicked men determined to have [her]64-mrs. wilkins suit - cases]666-wicked men determined to have her suit - cases .

“ [I]64-mrs. wilkins do n’t think it can be , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins admitted , and could not refrain from a moment ’s wonder at the ways of [God]73-god . Had [she]64-mrs. wilkins really been brought [here]478-here , [she]64-mrs. wilkins and poor [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , after so much trouble in arranging it , so much difficulty and worry , along such devious paths of prevarication and deceit , only to be —

[She]64-mrs. wilkins checked [her]64-mrs. wilkins thoughts , and gently said to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , while [the ragged youths]668-the ragged youths disappeared with the suit - cases into the night and [the man with the lantern]669-the man with the lantern helped [Beppo]97-beppo pull the rug off [her]64-mrs. wilkins , that [they]670-they were both in [God]73-god ’s hands ; and for the first time on hearing this , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was afraid .

There was nothing for it but to get out . Useless to try to go on sitting in the fly repeating [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore . Every time [they]670-they said it , and [their]670-they voices each time were fainter , [Beppo]97-beppo and [the other man]671-the other man merely echoed it in a series of loud shouts . If only [they]670-they had learned Italian when [they]670-they were little . If only [they]670-they could have said , “ [We]670-they wish to be driven to the door . ”[670-they] But [they]670-they did not even know what door was in Italian . Such ignorance was not only contemptible , it was , [they]670-they now saw , definitely dangerous . Useless , however , to lament it now . Useless to put off whatever it was that was going to happen to [them]670-they by trying to go on sitting in the fly . [They]670-they therefore got out .

[The two men]672-the two men opened [their]672-the two men umbrellas for [them]672-the two men and handed [them]673-them to [them]672-the two men . From this [they]672-the two men received a faint encouragement , because [they]672-the two men could not believe that if [these men]665-these men were wicked [they]672-the two men would pause to open umbrellas . [The man with the lantern]669-the man with the lantern then made signs to [them]672-the two men to follow [him]669-the man with the lantern , talking loud and quickly , and [Beppo]97-beppo , [they]672-the two men noticed , remained behind . Ought [they]672-the two men to pay [him]97-beppo ? Not , [they]672-the two men thought , if [they]672-the two men were going to be robbed and perhaps murdered . Surely on such an occasion [one]235-one did not pay . Besides , [he]97-beppo had not after all brought [them]672-the two men to [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore . Where [they]672-the two men had got to was evidently somewhere else . Also , [he]97-beppo did not show the least wish to be paid ; [he]97-beppo let [them]672-the two men go away into the night with no clamour at all . This , [they]672-the two men could not help thinking , was a bad sign . [He]97-beppo asked for nothing because presently [he]97-beppo was to get so much .

[They]672-the two men came to some steps . [The road]2745-the road ended abruptly in [a church]678-a church and some descending steps . [The man]679-the man held the lantern low for [them]672-the two men to see the steps .

“ [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore ? ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins once again , very faintly , before committing [herself]64-mrs. wilkins to the steps . It was useless to mention it now , of course , but [she]64-mrs. wilkins could not go down steps in complete silence . [No mediaeval castle]680-no mediaeval castle , [she]64-mrs. wilkins was sure , was ever built at [the bottom of steps]681-the bottom of steps .

Again , however , came the echoing shout—“Sì , sì — [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore . ”[672-the two men]

[They]672-the two men descended gingerly , holding up [their]672-the two men skirts just as if [they]672-the two men would be wanting [them]672-the two men another time and had not in all probability finished with skirts for ever .

[The steps]682-the steps ended in a steeply sloping path with flat stone slabs down the middle . [They]672-the two men slipped a good deal on these wet slabs , and [the man with the lantern]669-the man with the lantern , talking loud and quickly , held them up . [His]679-the man way of holding [them]672-the two men up was polite .

“ Perhaps , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins in a low voice to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , “ It is all right after all . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

“ [We]672-the two men ’re in [God]73-god ’s hands , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot again ; and again [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was afraid .

[They]672-the two men reached the bottom of [the sloping path]684-the sloping path , and the light of the lantern flickered over an open space with [houses round three sides]685-houses round three sides . [The sea]2735-the sea was the fourth side , lazily washing backwards and forwards on pebbles .

“ [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , ”[679-the man] said [the man]679-the man pointing with [his]679-the man lantern to a black mass curved round the water like an arm flung about it .

[They]672-the two men strained [their]672-the two men eyes . [They]672-the two men saw the black mass , and on the top of it a light .

“ [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore ? ”[672-the two men] [they]672-the two men both repeated incredulously , for where were the suit - cases , and why had [they]672-the two men been forced to get out of the fly ?

“ Sì , sì — [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore . ”[672-the two men]

[They]672-the two men went along what seemed to be [a quay]688-a quay , right on [the edge of [the water]690-the water]689-the edge of the water . There was not even a low wall here — nothing to prevent [the man with the lantern]669-the man with the lantern tipping [them]672-the two men in if [he]679-the man wanted to . [He]679-the man did not , however , tip [them]672-the two men in . Perhaps it was all right after all , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins again suggested to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot on noticing this , who this time was [herself]64-mrs. wilkins beginning to think that it might be , and said no more about [God]73-god ’s hands .

The flicker of the lantern danced along , reflected in the wet pavement of [the quay]692-the quay . Out to the left , in the darkness and evidently at the end of [a jetty]693-a jetty , was a red light . [They]672-the two men came to an archway with a heavy iron gate . [The man with the lantern]669-the man with the lantern pushed the gate open . This time [they]672-the two men went up steps instead of down , and at the top of [them]672-the two men was a little path that wound upwards among flowers . [They]672-the two men could not see the flowers , but [the whole place]695-the whole place was evidently full of them .

It here dawned on [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins that perhaps the reason why the fly had not driven [them]672-the two men up to the door was that there was [no road]696-no road , only a footpath . That also would explain the disappearance of the suit - cases . [She]64-mrs. wilkins began to feel confident that [they]672-the two men would find [their]672-the two men suit - cases waiting for [them]672-the two men when [they]672-the two men got up to the top . [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore was , it seemed , on [the top of [a hill]698-a hill]697-the top of a hill , as [a mediaeval castle]436-a mediaeval castle should be . At a turn of the path [they]672-the two men saw above [them]672-the two men , much nearer now and shining more brightly , the light [they]672-the two men had seen from [the quay]692-the quay . [She]64-mrs. wilkins told [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot of [her]64-mrs. wilkins dawning belief , and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot agreed that it was very likely a true one .

Once more , but this time in a tone of real hopefulness , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins said , pointing upwards at the black outline against the only slightly less black sky , “ [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore ? ”[64-mrs. wilkins] And once more , but this time comfortingly , encouragingly , came back the assurance , “ Sì , sì — [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

[They]672-the two men crossed [a little bridge]701-a little bridge , over what was apparently [a ravine]702-a ravine , and then came a flat bit with long grass at the sides and more flowers . [They]672-the two men felt the grass flicking wet against [their]672-the two men stockings , and the invisible flowers were everywhere . Then up again through trees , along a zigzag path with the smell all the way of the flowers [they]672-the two men could not see . The warm rain was bringing out all the sweetness . Higher and higher [they]672-the two men went in this sweet darkness , and the red light on [the jetty]703-the jetty dropped farther and farther below [them]672-the two men .

[The path]704-the path wound round to the other side of what appeared to be [a little peninsula]705-a little peninsula ; [the jetty]703-the jetty and the red light disappeared ; across the emptiness on [their]672-the two men left were distant lights .

“ [Mezzago]32-mezzago , ”[679-the man] said [the man]679-the man , waving [his]679-the man lantern at the lights .

“ Sì , sì , ”[672-the two men] [they]672-the two men answered , for [they]672-the two men had by now learned “ sì , sì ”[679-the man] . Upon which [the man]679-the man congratulated [them]672-the two men in a great flow of polite words , not one of which [they]672-the two men understood , on [their]672-the two men magnificent Italian ; for this was [Domenico]96-domenico , [the vigilant and accomplished gardener of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore]709-the vigilant and accomplished gardener of san salvatore , [the prop and stay of the establishment]710-the prop and stay of the establishment , the resourceful , [the gifted]711-the gifted , [the eloquent]712-the eloquent , [the courteous]713-the courteous , [the intelligent Domenico]96-domenico . Only [they]672-the two men did not know that yet ; and [he]96-domenico did in the dark , and even sometimes in the light , look , with [his]96-domenico knife - sharp swarthy features and swift , panther movements , very like [somebody wicked]714-somebody wicked .

[They]672-the two men passed along [another flat bit of path]715-another flat bit of path , with a black shape like a high wall towering above [them]672-the two men on [their]672-the two men right , and then [the path]704-the path went up again under trellises , and trailing sprays of scented things caught at [them]672-the two men and shook raindrops on [them]672-the two men , and the light of the lantern flickered over lilies , and then came a flight of ancient steps worn with centuries , and then another iron gate , and then [they]672-the two men were inside , though still climbing a twisting flight of stone steps with old walls on either side like the walls of [dungeons]422-dungeons , and with a vaulted roof .

At the top was a wrought - iron door , and through it shone a flood of electric light .

“ Ecco , ”[96-domenico] said [Domenico]96-domenico , lithely running up the last few steps ahead and pushing the door open .

And there [they]672-the two men were , arrived ; and it was [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore ; and [their]672-the two men suit - cases were waiting for [them]672-the two men ; and [they]672-the two men had not been murdered .

[They]672-the two men looked at [each other]207-each other ’s white faces and blinking eyes very solemnly .

It was a great , a wonderful moment . Here [they]672-the two men were , in [[their]672-the two men mediaeval castle]719-their mediaeval castle at last . [Their]672-the two men feet touched [its]719-their mediaeval castle stones .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins put [her]64-mrs. wilkins arm round [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’s neck and kissed [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot .

“ The first thing to happen in [this house]2762-this house , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins said softly , solemnly , “ shall be a kiss . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

“ [Dear Lotty]149-lotty , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot .

“ [Dear Rose]103-rose , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , [her]64-mrs. wilkins eyes brimming with gladness .

[Domenico]96-domenico was delighted . [He]96-domenico liked to see [beautiful ladies]630-beautiful ladies kiss . [He]96-domenico made [them]630-beautiful ladies a most appreciative speech of welcome , and [they]630-beautiful ladies stood arm in arm , holding [each other]207-each other up , for [they]630-beautiful ladies were very tired , blinking smilingly at [him]96-domenico , and not understanding a word .

Chapter 6

When [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins woke next morning [she]64-mrs. wilkins lay in bed a few minutes before getting up and opening the shutters . What would [she]64-mrs. wilkins see out of [her]64-mrs. wilkins window ? A shining world , or [a world of rain]722-a world of rain ? But it would be beautiful ; whatever it was would be beautiful .

[She]64-mrs. wilkins was in [a little bedroom]723-a little bedroom with bare white walls and a stone floor and sparse old furniture . The beds — there were two — were made of iron , enamelled black and painted with bunches of gay flowers . [She]64-mrs. wilkins lay putting off the great moment of going to the window as one puts off opening a precious letter , gloating over it . [She]64-mrs. wilkins had no idea what time it was ; [she]64-mrs. wilkins had forgotten to wind up [her]64-mrs. wilkins watch ever since , centuries ago , [she]64-mrs. wilkins last went to bed in [Hampstead]3-hampstead . No sounds were to be heard in [the house]410-the house , so [she]64-mrs. wilkins supposed it was very early , yet [she]64-mrs. wilkins felt as if [she]64-mrs. wilkins had slept a long while — so completely rested , so perfectly content . [She]64-mrs. wilkins lay with [her]64-mrs. wilkins arms clasped round [her]64-mrs. wilkins head thinking how happy [she]64-mrs. wilkins was , [her]64-mrs. wilkins lips curved upwards in a delighted smile . In bed by [herself]64-mrs. wilkins : adorable condition . [She]64-mrs. wilkins had not been in a bed without [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins once now for five whole years ; and the cool roominess of it , the freedom of [one]235-one ’s movements , the sense of recklessness , of audacity , in giving the blankets a pull if [one]235-one wanted to , or twitching the pillows more comfortably ! It was like the discovery of an entirely new joy .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins longed to get up and open the shutters , but where [she]64-mrs. wilkins was was really so very delicious . [She]64-mrs. wilkins gave a sigh of contentment , and went on lying there looking round [her]64-mrs. wilkins , taking in everything in [[her]64-mrs. wilkins room]727-her room , [[her]64-mrs. wilkins own little room]728-her own little room , [her]64-mrs. wilkins very own to arrange just as [she]64-mrs. wilkins pleased for this one blessed month , [[her]64-mrs. wilkins room]727-her room bought with [her]64-mrs. wilkins own savings , the fruit of [her]64-mrs. wilkins careful denials , whose door [she]64-mrs. wilkins could bolt if [she]64-mrs. wilkins wanted to , and [nobody]231-nobody had the right to come in . It was such [a strange little room]731-a strange little room , so different from any [she]64-mrs. wilkins had known , and so sweet . [It]731-a strange little room was like [a cell]732-a cell . Except for the two beds , [it]731-a strange little room suggested a happy austerity . “ And the name of [the chamber]2763-the chamber , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins thought , quoting and smiling round at it , “ was Peace . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

Well , this was delicious , to lie there thinking how happy [she]64-mrs. wilkins was , but outside those shutters it was more delicious still . [She]64-mrs. wilkins jumped up , pulled on [her]64-mrs. wilkins slippers , for there was nothing on the stone floor but one small rug , ran to the window and threw open the shutters .

“ Oh ! ”[64-mrs. wilkins] cried [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins .

All the radiance of April in [Italy]13-italy lay gathered together at [her]64-mrs. wilkins feet . The sun poured in on [her]64-mrs. wilkins . [The sea]2735-the sea lay asleep in [it]734-it , hardly stirring . Across [the bay]735-the bay the lovely mountains , exquisitely different in colour , were asleep too in the light ; and underneath [her]64-mrs. wilkins window , at the bottom of the flower - starred grass slope from which the wall of [the castle]216-the castle rose up , was a great cypress , cutting through the delicate blues and violets and rose - colours of [the mountains]737-the mountains and [the sea]2735-the sea like a great black sword .

[She]64-mrs. wilkins stared . Such beauty ; and [she]64-mrs. wilkins there to see it . Such beauty ; and [she]64-mrs. wilkins alive to feel it . [Her]64-mrs. wilkins face was bathed in light . Lovely scents came up to the window and caressed [her]64-mrs. wilkins . A tiny breeze gently lifted [her]64-mrs. wilkins hair . Far out in [the bay]735-the bay a cluster of [almost motionless fishing boats]740-almost motionless fishing boats hovered like a flock of white birds on [the tranquil sea]741-the tranquil sea . How beautiful , how beautiful . Not to have died before this . . . to have been allowed to see , breathe , feel this . . . . [She]64-mrs. wilkins stared , [her]64-mrs. wilkins lips parted . Happy ? Poor , ordinary , everyday word . But what could [one]235-one say , how could [one]235-one describe it ? It was as though [she]64-mrs. wilkins could hardly stay inside [herself]64-mrs. wilkins , it was as though [she]64-mrs. wilkins were too small to hold so much of joy , it was as though [she]64-mrs. wilkins were washed through with light . And how astonishing to feel this sheer bliss , for here [she]64-mrs. wilkins was , not doing and not going to do a single unselfish thing , not going to do a thing [she]64-mrs. wilkins did n’t want to do . According to [everybody]2701-everybody [she]64-mrs. wilkins had ever come across [she]64-mrs. wilkins ought at least to have twinges . [She]64-mrs. wilkins had not one twinge . Something was wrong somewhere . Wonderful that at [home]222-home [she]64-mrs. wilkins should have been so good , so terribly good , and merely felt tormented . Twinges of every sort had there been [her]64-mrs. wilkins portion ; aches , hurts , discouragements , and [she]64-mrs. wilkins the whole time being steadily unselfish . Now [she]64-mrs. wilkins had taken off all [her]64-mrs. wilkins goodness and left it behind [her]64-mrs. wilkins like a heap of rain - sodden clothes , and [she]64-mrs. wilkins only felt joy . [She]64-mrs. wilkins was naked of goodness , and was rejoicing in being naked . [She]64-mrs. wilkins was stripped , and exulting . And there , away in the dim mugginess of [Hampstead]3-hampstead , was [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins being angry .

[She]64-mrs. wilkins tried to visualise [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , [she]64-mrs. wilkins tried to see [him]746-him having breakfast and thinking bitter things about [her]64-mrs. wilkins ; and lo , [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins [himself]64-mrs. wilkins began to shimmer , became rose - colour , became delicate violet , became an enchanting blue , became formless , became iridescent . Actually [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , after quivering a minute , was lost in light .

“ Well , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] thought [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , staring , as it were , after [him]746-him . How extraordinary not to be able to visualise [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins ; and [she]64-mrs. wilkins who used to know every feature , every expression of [his]746-him by heart . [She]64-mrs. wilkins simply could not see [him]746-him as [he]746-him was . [She]64-mrs. wilkins could only see [him]746-him resolved into beauty , melted into harmony with everything else . The familiar words of [the General Thanksgiving]747-the general thanksgiving came quite naturally into [her]64-mrs. wilkins mind , and [she]64-mrs. wilkins found [herself]64-mrs. wilkins blessing [God]73-god for [her]64-mrs. wilkins creation , preservation , and all the blessings of this life , but above all for [His]746-him inestimable Love ; out loud ; in a burst of acknowledgment . While [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , at that moment angrily pulling on [his]746-him boots before going out into [the dripping streets]339-the dripping streets , was indeed thinking bitter things about [her]64-mrs. wilkins .

[She]64-mrs. wilkins began to dress , choosing clean white clothes in honour of the summer ’s day , unpacking [her]64-mrs. wilkins suit - cases , tidying [[her]64-mrs. wilkins adorable little room]749-her adorable little room . [She]64-mrs. wilkins moved about with quick , purposeful steps , [her]64-mrs. wilkins long thin body held up straight , [her]64-mrs. wilkins small face , so much puckered at [home]222-home with effort and fear , smoothed out . All [she]64-mrs. wilkins had been and done before this morning , all [she]64-mrs. wilkins had felt and worried about , was gone . Each of [her]64-mrs. wilkins worries behaved as the image of [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins had behaved , and dissolved into colour and light . And [she]64-mrs. wilkins noticed things [she]64-mrs. wilkins had not noticed for years — when [she]64-mrs. wilkins was doing [her]64-mrs. wilkins hair in front of the glass [she]64-mrs. wilkins noticed it , and thought , “ Why , what pretty stuff . ”[64-mrs. wilkins] For years [she]64-mrs. wilkins had forgotten [she]64-mrs. wilkins had such a thing as hair , plaiting it in the evening and unplaiting it in the morning with the same hurry and indifference with which [she]64-mrs. wilkins laced and unlaced [her]64-mrs. wilkins shoes . Now [she]64-mrs. wilkins suddenly saw it , and [she]64-mrs. wilkins twisted it round [her]64-mrs. wilkins fingers before the glass , and was glad it was so pretty . [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins could n’t have seen it either , for [he]751-he had never said a word about it . Well , when [she]64-mrs. wilkins got [home]222-home [she]64-mrs. wilkins would draw [his]751-he attention to it . “ [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins would say , “ look at [my]64-mrs. wilkins hair . Are n’t [you]64-mrs. wilkins pleased [you]64-mrs. wilkins ’ve got [a wife with hair like curly honey]2764-a wife with hair like curly honey ? ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

[She]64-mrs. wilkins laughed . [She]64-mrs. wilkins had never said anything like that to [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins yet , and the idea of it amused [her]64-mrs. wilkins . But why had [she]64-mrs. wilkins not ? Oh yes — [she]64-mrs. wilkins used to be afraid of [him]751-he . Funny to be afraid of [anybody]202-anybody ; and especially of [[one]235-one ’s husband]755-one ’s husband , whom [one]235-one saw in [his]755-one ’s husband more simplified moments , such as asleep , and not breathing properly through [his]755-one ’s husband nose .

When [she]64-mrs. wilkins was ready [she]64-mrs. wilkins opened [her]64-mrs. wilkins door to go across to see if [Rose]103-rose , who had been put the night before by [a sleepy maidservant]757-a sleepy maidservant into [a cell opposite]758-a cell opposite , were awake . [She]64-mrs. wilkins would say good - morning to [her]103-rose , and then [she]64-mrs. wilkins would run down and stay with that cypress tree till breakfast was ready , and after breakfast [she]64-mrs. wilkins would n’t so much as look out of a window till [she]64-mrs. wilkins had helped [Rose]103-rose get everything ready for [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . There was much to be done that day , settling in , arranging [the rooms]759-the rooms ; [she]64-mrs. wilkins must n’t leave [Rose]103-rose to do it alone . [They]760-they would make it all so lovely for [the two]536-the two to come , have such an entrancing vision ready for [them]760-they of little cells bright with flowers . [She]64-mrs. wilkins remembered [she]64-mrs. wilkins had wanted [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline not to come ; fancy wanting to shut some one out of [heaven]2706-heaven because [she]64-mrs. wilkins thought [she]64-mrs. wilkins would be shy of [her]64-mrs. wilkins ! And as though it mattered if [she]64-mrs. wilkins were , and as though [she]64-mrs. wilkins would be anything so self - conscious as shy . Besides , what a reason . [She]64-mrs. wilkins could not accuse [herself]64-mrs. wilkins of goodness over that . And [she]64-mrs. wilkins remembered [she]64-mrs. wilkins had wanted not to have [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher either , because [she]83-mrs. fisher had seemed lofty . How funny of [her]64-mrs. wilkins . So funny to worry about such little things , making them important .

[The bedrooms]763-the bedrooms and two of [the sitting - rooms at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore]764-the sitting - rooms at san salvatore were on the top floor , and opened into [a roomy hall]765-a roomy hall with a wide glass window at the north end . [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore was rich in [small gardens]766-small gardens in different parts and on different levels . [The garden]519-the garden this window looked down on was made on the highest part of the walls , and could only be reached through [the corresponding spacious hall on the floor below]768-the corresponding spacious hall on the floor below . When [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins came out of [[her]64-mrs. wilkins room]727-her room this window stood wide open , and beyond it in the sun was a Judas tree in full flower . There was no sign of [anybody]202-anybody , no sound of voices or feet . Tubs of arum lilies stood about on the stone floor , and on a table flamed a huge bunch of fierce nasturtiums . Spacious , flowery , silent , with the wide window at the end opening into [the garden]519-the garden , and the Judas tree absurdly beautiful in the sunshine , it seemed to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , arrested on [her]64-mrs. wilkins way across to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , too good to be true . Was [she]64-mrs. wilkins really going to live in this for a whole month ? Up to now [she]64-mrs. wilkins had had to take what beauty [she]64-mrs. wilkins could as [she]64-mrs. wilkins went along , snatching at little bits of it when [she]64-mrs. wilkins came across it — a patch of daisies on a fine day in [a Hampstead field]772-a hampstead field , a flash of sunset between two chimney pots . [She]64-mrs. wilkins had never been in [definitely , completely beautiful places]773-definitely , completely beautiful places . [She]64-mrs. wilkins had never been even in [a venerable house]774-a venerable house ; and such a thing as a profusion of flowers in [[her]64-mrs. wilkins rooms]775-her rooms was unattainable to [her]64-mrs. wilkins . Sometimes in the spring [she]64-mrs. wilkins had bought six tulips at [Shoolbred]91-shoolbred ’s , unable to resist them , conscious that [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins if [he]776-he knew what [they]777-they had cost would think it inexcusable ; but [they]777-they had soon died , and then there were no more . As for the Judas tree , [she]64-mrs. wilkins had n’t an idea what it was , and gazed at it out there against the sky with the rapt expression of [one who sees a heavenly vision]778-one who sees a heavenly vision .

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , coming out of [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot room]727-her room , found [her]64-mrs. wilkins there like that , standing in the middle of [the hall]337-the hall staring .

“ Now what does [she]64-mrs. wilkins think [she]64-mrs. wilkins sees now ? ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] thought [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot .

“ [We]2765-we are in [God]73-god ’s hands , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , turning to [her]64-mrs. wilkins , speaking with extreme conviction .

“ Oh ! ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot quickly , [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot face , which had been covered with smiles when [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot came out of [[her]67-mrs. arbuthnot room]727-her room , falling . “ Why , what has happened ? ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot]

For [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot had woken up with such a delightful feeling of security , of relief , and [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot did not want to find [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had not after all escaped from the need of refuge . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot had not even dreamed of [Frederick]75-frederick . For the first time for years [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had been spared the nightly dream that [he]75-frederick was with [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot , that [they]782-we were heart to heart , and its miserable awakening . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot had slept like [a baby]783-a baby , and had woken up confident ; [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had found there was nothing [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot wished to say in [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot morning prayer except Thank [you]784-you . It was disconcerting to be told [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was after all in [God]73-god ’s hands .

“ [I]67-mrs. arbuthnot hope nothing has happened ? ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot asked anxiously .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins looked at [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot a moment , and laughed . “ How funny , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins said , kissing [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot .

“ What is funny ? ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] asked [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot face clearing because [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins laughed .

“ [We]782-we are . This is . Everything . It ’s all so wonderful . It ’s so funny and so adorable that [we]782-we should be in it . [I]64-mrs. wilkins daresay when [we]782-we finally reach [heaven]2706-heaven — the one [they]2767-they talk about so much — [we]782-we sha n’t find it a bit more beautiful . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot relaxed to smiling security again . “ Is n’t it divine ? ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot said .

“ Were [you]67-mrs. arbuthnot ever , ever in [your]67-mrs. arbuthnot life so happy ? ”[64-mrs. wilkins] asked [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , catching [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot by the arm .

“ No , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot . “ Let ’s go and look at that tree close , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins . “ [I]64-mrs. wilkins do n’t believe it can only be a tree . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

And arm in arm [they]785-they went along [the hall]337-the hall , and [[their]785-they husbands]582-their husbands would not have known [them]785-they [their]785-they faces were so young with eagerness , and together [they]785-they stood at the open window , and when [their]785-they eyes , having feasted on the marvellous pink thing , wandered farther among the beauties of [the garden]519-the garden , [they]785-they saw sitting on the low wall at the east edge of [it]519-the garden , gazing out over [the bay]735-the bay , [her]790-her feet in lilies , [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline .

[They]785-they were astonished . [They]785-they said nothing in [their]785-they astonishment , but stood quite still , arm in arm , staring down at [her]790-her .

[She]790-her too had on a white frock , and [her]790-her head was bare . [They]785-they had had no idea that day in [London]2-london , when [her]790-her hat was down to [her]790-her nose and [her]790-her furs were up to [her]790-her ears , that [she]790-her was so pretty . [She]790-her was exceedingly pretty . Everything about [her]790-her was very much that which it was . [Her]790-her fair hair was very fair , [her]790-her lovely grey eyes were very lovely and grey , [her]790-her dark eyelashes were very dark , [her]790-her white skin was very white , [her]790-her red mouth was very red . [She]790-her was looking out across [the bay]735-the bay , and was sharply defined against the background of empty blue . [She]790-her was full in the sun . [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline turned [her]82-lady caroline head . Then [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline began to be afraid [these two]814-these two were originals . If so , [she]82-lady caroline would be bored . Besides , there was [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . [She]83-mrs. fisher too must be checked . Yes , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher would have to be checked . And so would [these two]814-these two up at the window . [She]83-mrs. fisher had better begin at once . So [she]83-mrs. fisher ignored [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’s remark and raised forefinger , and said with marked coldness — at least , [she]83-mrs. fisher tried to make it sound marked — that [she]83-mrs. fisher supposed [they]814-these two would be going to breakfast , and that [she]83-mrs. fisher had had [hers]845-hers ; but it was [her]83-mrs. fisher fate that however coldly [she]83-mrs. fisher sent forth [her]83-mrs. fisher words they came out sounding quite warm and agreeable . That was because [she]83-mrs. fisher had a sympathetic and delightful voice , due entirely to some special formation of [her]83-mrs. fisher throat and the roof of [her]83-mrs. fisher mouth , and having nothing whatever to do with what [she]83-mrs. fisher was feeling . [Nobody in consequence]846-nobody in consequence ever believed [they]814-these two were being snubbed . It was most tiresome . And if [she]83-mrs. fisher stared icily it did not look icy at all , because [her]83-mrs. fisher eyes , lovely to begin with , had the added loveliness of very long , soft , dark eyelashes . No icy stare could come out of eyes like that ; it got caught and lost in the soft eyelashes , and [the persons stared at merely]847-the persons stared at merely thought [they]847-the persons stared at merely were being regarded with a flattering and exquisite attentiveness . And if ever [she]83-mrs. fisher was out of humour or definitely cross — and who would not be sometimes in such a world?—she only looked so pathetic that [people]278-people all rushed to comfort [her]83-mrs. fisher , if possible by means of kissing . It was more than tiresome , it was maddening . [Nature]105-nature was determined that [she]83-mrs. fisher should look and sound angelic . [She]83-mrs. fisher could never be disagreeable or rude without being completely misunderstood .

Chapter 7

[Their]278-people eyes followed [her]83-mrs. fisher admiringly . [They]278-people had no idea [they]278-people had been snubbed . It was a disappointment , of course , to find [she]83-mrs. fisher had forestalled [them]278-people and that [they]278-people were not to have the happiness of preparing for [her]83-mrs. fisher , of watching [her]83-mrs. fisher face when [she]83-mrs. fisher arrived and first saw everything , but there was still [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . [They]278-people would concentrate on [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , and would watch [her]83-mrs. fisher face instead ; only , like [everybody else]849-everybody else , [they]278-people would have preferred to watch [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline ’s .

Perhaps , then , as [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline had talked of breakfast , [they]278-people had better begin by going and having it , for there was too much to be done that day to spend any more time gazing at the scenery — [servants]419-servants to be interviewed , [the house]410-the house to be gone through and examined , and finally [[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s room]852-mrs. fisher ’s room to be got ready and adorned .

[They]278-people waved [their]278-people hands gaily at [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , who seemed absorbed in what [she]82-lady caroline saw and took no notice , and turning away found [the maidservant of the night before]853-the maidservant of the night before had come up silently behind [them]278-people in cloth slippers with string soles .

[She]853-the maidservant of the night before was [Francesca]106-francesca , [the elderly parlour - maid]854-the elderly parlour - maid , who had been with [the owner]440-the owner , [he]440-the owner had said , for years , and whose presence made inventories unnecessary ; and after wishing [them]278-people good - morning and hoping [they]278-people had slept well , [she]853-the maidservant of the night before told [them]278-people breakfast was ready in [the dining - room]856-the dining - room on [the floor below]857-the floor below , and if [they]278-people would follow [her]853-the maidservant of the night before [she]853-the maidservant of the night before would lead .

“ How do [you]64-mrs. wilkins do , ”[83-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . “ [I]83-mrs. fisher ca n’t get up because of [my]83-mrs. fisher stick . ”[83-mrs. fisher] And [she]83-mrs. fisher stretched out [her]83-mrs. fisher hand across the table .

“ [We]278-people had no idea [you]83-mrs. fisher were [here]478-here , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot .

“ Yes , ”[83-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , resuming [her]83-mrs. fisher breakfast . “ Yes . [I]83-mrs. fisher am here . ”[83-mrs. fisher] And with composure [she]83-mrs. fisher removed the top of [her]83-mrs. fisher egg .

“ It ’s a great disappointment , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins . “ [We]278-people had meant to give [you]83-mrs. fisher such a welcome . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

This was the one , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher remembered , briefly glancing at [her]83-mrs. fisher , who when [she]83-mrs. fisher came to [Prince of [Wales]37-wales Terrace]36-prince of wales terrace said [she]83-mrs. fisher had seen [Keats]88-keats . [She]83-mrs. fisher must be careful with [this one]861-this one — curb [her]83-mrs. fisher from the beginning .

[She]83-mrs. fisher therefore ignored [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins and said gravely , with a downward face of impenetrable calm bent on [her]83-mrs. fisher egg , “ Yes . [I]83-mrs. fisher arrived yesterday with [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

“ It ’s really dreadful , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , exactly as if [she]64-mrs. wilkins had not been ignored . “ There ’s [nobody]231-nobody left to get anything ready for now . “ Where will [you]67-mrs. arbuthnot sit ? ”[83-mrs. fisher] asked [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher of [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot — markedly of [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot ; the comparison with the bread seemed to [her]83-mrs. fisher most unpleasant .

“ Oh , thank [you]67-mrs. arbuthnot — ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , sitting down rather suddenly next to [her]83-mrs. fisher .

There were only two places [she]83-mrs. fisher could sit down in , the places laid on either side of [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . [She]83-mrs. fisher therefore sat down in one , and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins sat down opposite [her]83-mrs. fisher in the other .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was at the head of the table . Round [her]83-mrs. fisher was grouped the coffee and the tea . Of course [they]862-they were all sharing [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore equally , but it was [she]83-mrs. fisher [herself]83-mrs. fisher and [Lotty]149-lotty , [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot mildly reflected , who had found it , who had had the work of getting it , who had chosen to admit [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher into it . Without [them]862-they , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot could not help thinking , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher would not have been [there]296-there . [Morally Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was [a guest]864-a guest . [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins noticed it too , but it only made [her]64-mrs. wilkins discursive brain think of cuckoos . [She]64-mrs. wilkins would no doubt immediately have begun to talk of cuckoos , incoherently , unrestrainably and deplorably , if [she]64-mrs. wilkins had been in the condition of nerves and shyness [she]64-mrs. wilkins was in last time [she]64-mrs. wilkins saw [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . The delicate and delicious fragrance of the freesias came in through the door and floated round [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s enraptured nostrils . Freesias in [London]2-london were quite beyond [her]64-mrs. wilkins . Occasionally [she]64-mrs. wilkins went into [a shop]876-a shop and asked what they cost , so as just to have an excuse for lifting up a bunch and smelling them , well knowing that it was something awful like a shilling for about three flowers . Here they were everywhere — bursting out of every corner and carpeting the rose beds .
