Chapter 8

Presently , when [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , unhampered by any duties , wandered out and down [the worn stone steps]925-the worn stone steps and under [the pergola]926-the pergola into [the lower garden]927-the lower garden , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins said to [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , who seemed pensive , “ Do n’t [you]67-mrs. arbuthnot see that if [somebody else]2808-somebody else does the ordering it frees [us]928-us ? ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot said [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot did see , but nevertheless [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot thought it rather silly to have everything taken out of [their]928-us hands .

“ [I]64-mrs. wilkins love things to be taken out of [my]64-mrs. wilkins hands , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins .

“ But [we]928-us found [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , “ and it is rather silly that [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher should behave as if it belonged only to [her]83-mrs. fisher . ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot]

“ What is rather silly , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins with much serenity , “ is to mind . [I]64-mrs. wilkins ca n’t see the least point in being in authority at the price of one ’s liberty . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot said nothing to that for two reasons — first , because [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was struck by the remarkable and growing calm of [the hitherto incoherent and excited Lotty]929-the hitherto incoherent and excited lotty , and secondly because what [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was looking at was so very beautiful .

All down the stone steps on either side were periwinkles in full flower , and [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot could now see what it was that had caught at [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot the night before and brushed , wet and scented , across [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot face . It was wistaria . [Wistaria]4-wistaria and sunshine . . . [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot remembered the advertisement . Here indeed were both in profusion . The wistaria was tumbling over itself in its excess of life , its prodigality of flowering ; and where the pergola ended the sun blazed on scarlet geraniums , bushes of them , and nasturtiums in great heaps , and marigolds so brilliant that they seemed to be burning , and red and pink snapdragons , all outdoing each other in bright , fierce colour . The ground behind these flaming things dropped away in terraces to [the sea]2735-the sea , [each terrace]931-each terrace [a little orchard]932-a little orchard , where among the olives grew vines on trellises , and fig - trees , and peach - trees , and cherry - trees . The cherry - trees and peach - trees were in blossom — lovely showers of white and deep rose - colour among the trembling delicacy of the olives ; the fig - leaves were just big enough to smell of figs , the vine - buds were only beginning to show . And beneath these trees were groups of blue and purple irises , and bushes of lavender , and grey , sharp cactuses , and the grass was thick with dandelions and daisies , and right down at the bottom was [the sea]2735-the sea . Colour seemed flung down anyhow , anywhere ; every sort of colour , piled up in heaps , pouring along in rivers — the periwinkles looked exactly as if they were being poured down each side of [the steps]682-the steps — and flowers that grow only in borders in [England]17-england , proud flowers keeping themselves to themselves over there , such as the great blue irises and the lavender , were being jostled by small , shining common things like dandelions and daisies and the white bells of the wild onion , and only seemed the better and the more exuberant for it .

[They]935-they stood looking at [this crowd of loveliness]936-this crowd of loveliness , this happy jumble , in silence . No , it did n’t matter what [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher did ; not here ; not in such beauty . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’s discomposure melted out of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot . In the warmth and light of what [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was looking at , of what to [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot was a manifestation , an entirely new side of [God]73-god , how could [one]235-one be discomposed ? If only [Frederick]75-frederick were with [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot , seeing it too , seeing as [he]75-frederick would have seen it when first [they]938-they were [lovers]939-lovers , in the days when [he]75-frederick saw what [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot saw and loved what [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot loved . . .

[She]67-mrs. arbuthnot sighed .

“ [You]64-mrs. wilkins must n’t sigh in [heaven]2706-heaven , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins . “ [One]235-one does n’t . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

“ [I]67-mrs. arbuthnot was thinking how one longs to share this with those [one]235-one loves , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot .

“ [You]64-mrs. wilkins must n’t long in [heaven]2706-heaven , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins . “ [You]64-mrs. wilkins ’re supposed to be quite complete there . And it is [heaven]2706-heaven , is n’t it , [Rose]103-rose ? See how everything has been let in together — the dandelions and the irises , the vulgar and the superior , [me]64-mrs. wilkins and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher — all welcome , all mixed up anyhow , and all so visibly happy and enjoying [ourselves]2813-we . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

“ [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher does n’t seem happy — not visibly , anyhow , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , smiling .

“ [She]83-mrs. fisher ’ll begin soon , [you]64-mrs. wilkins ’ll see . ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot]

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot said [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot did n’t believe that after a certain age [people]278-people began anything .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins said [she]64-mrs. wilkins was sure [no one]310-no one , however old and tough , could resist the effects of perfect beauty . Before many days , perhaps only hours , [they]942-they would see [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher bursting out into every kind of exuberance . “ [I]64-mrs. wilkins ’m quite sure , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , “ that [we]2813-we ’ve got to [heaven]2706-heaven , and once [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher realises that that ’s where [she]83-mrs. fisher is , [she]83-mrs. fisher ’s bound to be different . [You]2815-you ’ll see . [She]83-mrs. fisher ’ll leave off being ossified , and go all soft and able to stretch , and [we]2813-we shall get quite — why , [I]64-mrs. wilkins should n’t be surprised if [we]2813-we get quite fond of [her]83-mrs. fisher . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

The idea of [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher bursting out into anything , [she]83-mrs. fisher who seemed so particularly firmly fixed inside [her]83-mrs. fisher buttons , made [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot laugh . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot condoned [Lotty]149-lotty ’s loose way of talking of [heaven]2706-heaven , because in such a place , on such a morning , condonation was in the very air . Besides , what an excuse there was .

And [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , sitting where [they]944-they had left [her]82-lady caroline before breakfast on the wall , peeped over when [she]82-lady caroline heard laughter , and saw [them]944-they standing on [the path below]945-the path below , and thought what a mercy it was [they]944-they were laughing down there and had not come up and done it round [her]82-lady caroline . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot disliked jokes at all times , but in the morning [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot hated them ; especially close up ; especially crowding in [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot ears . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot hoped [the originals]946-the originals were on [their]946-the originals way out for a walk , and not on [their]946-the originals way back from one . [They]944-they were laughing more and more . What could [they]944-they possibly find to laugh at ?

[She]67-mrs. arbuthnot looked down on the tops of [their]944-they heads with a very serious face , for the thought of spending a month with [laughers]947-laughers was a grave one , and [they]944-they , as though [they]944-they felt [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot eyes , turned suddenly and looked up .

The dreadful geniality of [those women]948-those women . . .

[She]67-mrs. arbuthnot shrank away from [their]944-they smiles and wavings , but [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot could not shrink out of sight without falling into the lilies . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot neither smiled nor waved back , and turning [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot eyes to [the more distant mountains]949-the more distant mountains surveyed [them]944-they carefully till [the two]536-the two , tired of waving , moved away along [the path]704-the path and turned the corner and disappeared .

This time [they]536-the two both did notice that [they]536-the two had been met with , at least , unresponsiveness .

“ If [we]536-the two were n’t in [heaven]2706-heaven , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins serenely , “ [I]64-mrs. wilkins should say [we]536-the two had been snubbed , but as [nobody snubs]2817-nobody snubs [anybody]202-anybody there of course [we]536-the two ca n’t have been . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

“ Perhaps [she]2819-she is unhappy , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot .

“ Whatever it is [she]2819-she is [she]2819-she ’ll get over it here , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins with conviction .

“ [We]536-the two must try and help [her]2819-she , ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] said [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot .

“ Oh , but [nobody]231-nobody helps [anybody]202-anybody in [heaven]2706-heaven . That ’s finished with . [You]67-mrs. arbuthnot do n’t try to be , or do . [You]67-mrs. arbuthnot simply are . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

Well , [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot would n’t go into that — not here , not to - day . [The vicar]2707-the vicar , [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot knew , would have called [Lotty]149-lotty ’s talk levity , if not profanity . How old [he]2707-the vicar seemed from [here]478-here ; [an old , old vicar]954-an old , old vicar .

[They]955-they left [the path]704-the path , and clambered down [the olive terraces]957-the olive terraces , down and down , to where at the bottom [the warm , sleepy sea]958-the warm , sleepy sea heaved gently among the rocks . There a pine - tree grew close to [the water]690-the water , and [they]955-they sat under [it]690-the water , and a few yards away was [a fishing - boat]960-a fishing - boat lying motionless and green - bellied on [the water]690-the water . The ripples of [the sea]2735-the sea made little gurgling noises at [their]955-they feet . [They]955-they screwed up [their]955-they eyes to be able to look into the blaze of light beyond the shade of [their]955-they tree . The hot smell from the pine - needles and from the cushions of wild thyme that padded the spaces between [the rocks]646-the rocks , and sometimes a smell of pure honey from a clump of warm irises up behind [them]955-they in the sun , puffed across [their]955-they faces . Very soon [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins took [her]64-mrs. wilkins shoes and stockings off , and let [her]64-mrs. wilkins feet hang in [the water]690-the water . After watching [her]64-mrs. wilkins a minute [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot did the same . [Their]955-they happiness was then complete . [[Their]955-they husbands]582-their husbands would not have known [them]955-they . [They]955-they left off talking . [They]955-they ceased to mention heaven . [They]955-they were just cups of acceptance .

Meanwhile [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , on [her]82-lady caroline wall , was considering [her]82-lady caroline position . [The garden on the top of the wall]966-the garden on the top of the wall was [a delicious garden]967-a delicious garden , but [its]966-the garden on the top of the wall situation made [it]966-the garden on the top of the wall insecure and exposed to interruptions . At any moment [the others]822-the others might come and want to use [it]966-the garden on the top of the wall , because both [the hall]337-the hall and [the dining - room]856-the dining - room had doors opening straight into [it]966-the garden on the top of the wall . Perhaps , thought [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , [she]82-lady caroline could arrange that [it]966-the garden on the top of the wall should be solely [hers]82-lady caroline . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had the battlements , delightful with flowers , and [a watch - tower]971-a watch - tower all to [herself]83-mrs. fisher , besides having snatched [the one really nice room in [the house]410-the house]972-the one really nice room in the house . There were plenty of places [the originals]946-the originals could go to — [she]83-mrs. fisher had [herself]83-mrs. fisher seen at least [two other little gardens]975-two other little gardens , while [the hill [the castle]216-the castle stood on]976-the hill the castle stood on was itself [a garden , with walks and seats]978-a garden , with walks and seats . Why should not this one spot be kept exclusively for [her]83-mrs. fisher ? [She]83-mrs. fisher liked it ; [she]83-mrs. fisher liked it best of all . It had the Judas tree and an umbrella pine , it had the freesias and the lilies , it had a tamarisk beginning to flush pink , it had the convenient low wall to sit on , it had from each of [its]966-the garden on the top of the wall three sides the most amazing views — to the east [the bay and mountains]979-the bay and mountains , to the north [the village]615-the village across [the tranquil clear green water of [the little harbour]982-the little harbour]981-the tranquil clear green water of the little harbour and the hills dotted with [white houses and orange groves]983-white houses and orange groves , and to the west was the thin thread of land by which [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore was tied to [the mainland]984-the mainland , and then [the open sea]985-the open sea and [the coast line beyond [Genoa]30-genoa]986-the coast line beyond genoa reaching away into [the blue dimness of [France]39-france]987-the blue dimness of france . Yes , [she]83-mrs. fisher would say [she]83-mrs. fisher wanted to have this entirely to [herself]83-mrs. fisher . How obviously sensible if each of [them]988-them had [their]988-them own special place to sit in apart . It was essential to [her]83-mrs. fisher comfort that [she]83-mrs. fisher should be able to be apart , left alone , not talked to . [The others]822-the others ought to like it best too . Why herd ? [One]235-one had enough of that in [England]17-england , with [[one]235-one ’s relations]992-one ’s relations and [friends]2712-friends — oh , the numbers of them!—pressing on one continually . Having successfully escaped [them]988-them for four weeks why continue , and with [persons having no earthly claim on one]994-persons having no earthly claim on one , to herd ?

[She]83-mrs. fisher lit a cigarette . [She]83-mrs. fisher began to feel secure . [Those two]995-those two had gone for a walk . There was no sign of [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . How very pleasant this was .

[Somebody]996-somebody came out through the glass doors , just as [she]83-mrs. fisher was drawing a deep breath of security . Surely it could n’t be [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , wanting to sit with [her]83-mrs. fisher ? [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had [her]83-mrs. fisher battlements . [She]83-mrs. fisher ought to stay on them , having snatched them . It would be too tiresome if [she]83-mrs. fisher would n’t , and wanted not only to have [them]995-those two and [[her]83-mrs. fisher sitting - room]997-her sitting - room but to establish [herself]83-mrs. fisher in [this garden]998-this garden as well .

No ; it was n’t [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , it was [the cook]2803-the cook .

[She]83-mrs. fisher frowned . Was [she]83-mrs. fisher going to have to go on ordering the food ? Surely [one or other of [those two waving women]1001-those two waving women]1000-one or other of those two waving women would do that now .

[The cook , who had been waiting in increasing agitation in [the kitchen]2806-the kitchen , watching the clock getting nearer to lunch - time while [she]83-mrs. fisher still was without knowledge of what lunch was to consist of]1002-the cook , who had been waiting in increasing agitation in the kitchen , watching the clock getting nearer to lunch - time while she still was without knowledge of what lunch was to consist of , had gone at last to [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , who had immediately waved [her]83-mrs. fisher away . [Domenico]96-domenico had provided [this cook]1008-this cook . [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline scowled at [the cook]2803-the cook . [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline asked [her]112-costanza crossly what [she]112-costanza wanted , and [Costanza]112-costanza ’s head went on one side with delight at the sheer music of [her]112-costanza voice . [Costanza]112-costanza poured forth pity . [She]82-lady caroline too , [she]112-costanza explained , had [no mother]1032-no mother —

[Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline interrupted with the curt information that [[her]82-lady caroline mother]1033-her mother was alive and in [London]2-london .

[Costanza]112-costanza praised [God]73-god and [the saints]1034-the saints that [the young lady]1035-the young lady did not yet know what it was like to be without [a mother]1036-a mother . Quickly enough did misfortunes overtake one ; no doubt [the young lady]1035-the young lady already had [a husband]286-a husband .

“ No , ”[82-lady caroline] said [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline icily . Worse than jokes in the morning did [she]82-lady caroline hate the idea of [husbands]2800-husbands . And [everybody]2701-everybody was always trying to press [them]2701-everybody on [her]82-lady caroline — [all [her]82-lady caroline relations]1041-all her relations , all [[her]82-lady caroline friends]490-her friends , all the evening papers . [Her]82-lady caroline soft , pathetic “ No ”[112-costanza] made [Costanza]112-costanza , who was standing close to [her]82-lady caroline , well with sympathy .

“ For lunch , ”[82-lady caroline] said [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline freezingly , marvelling as [she]82-lady caroline spoke that [she]82-lady caroline should be patted , [she]82-lady caroline who had taken so much trouble to come to a place , remote and hidden , where [she]82-lady caroline could be sure that among other things of [a like oppressive nature pattings also were not]1049-a like oppressive nature pattings also were not , “ [we]2825-we will have — ”[82-lady caroline]

[Costanza]112-costanza became business - like . [She]112-costanza interrupted with suggestions , and [her]112-costanza suggestions were all admirable and all expensive .

[Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline did not know they were expensive , and fell in with [them]1050-they at once . They sounded very nice . Every sort of young vegetables and fruits came into [them]1050-they , and much butter and a great deal of cream and incredible numbers of eggs . [Costanza]112-costanza said enthusiastically at the end , as a tribute to this acquiescence , that of [the many ladies and [gentlemen]1052-gentlemen [she]112-costanza had worked for]1051-the many ladies and gentlemen she had worked for on temporary jobs such as this [she]112-costanza preferred [the English ladies]1053-the english ladies and [gentlemen]1052-gentlemen . [She]112-costanza more than preferred [them]1050-they — [they]1050-they roused devotion in [her]112-costanza . For [they]1050-they knew what to order ; [they]1050-they did not skimp ; [they]1050-they refrained from grinding down the faces of [the poor]226-the poor .

From this [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline concluded that [she]112-costanza had been extravagant , and promptly countermanded the cream .

[Costanza]112-costanza ’s face fell , for [she]112-costanza had [a cousin who had a cow]1056-a cousin who had a cow , and the cream was to have come from [them]1057-them both .

“ And perhaps [we]1057-them had better not have chickens , ”[82-lady caroline] said [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline .

[Costanza]112-costanza ’s face fell more , for [[her]112-costanza brother]1013-her brother at [the restaurant]1015-the restaurant kept chickens in [[his]1013-her brother back - yard]1060-his back - yard , and many of [them]1061-them were ready for killing .

“ Also do not order strawberries till [I]82-lady caroline have consulted with [the other ladies]2826-the other ladies , ”[82-lady caroline] said [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , remembering that it was only the first of [April]99-april , and that perhaps [people who lived in]1062-people who lived in [Hampstead]3-hampstead might be poor ; indeed , must be poor , or why live in [Hampstead]3-hampstead ? “ It is not [I]112-costanza who am [mistress here]2827-mistress here . ”[112-costanza]

“ Is it [the old one]2828-the old one ? ”[112-costanza] asked [Costanza]112-costanza , [her]112-costanza face very long .

“ No , ”[82-lady caroline] said [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline .

“ Which of [the other two ladies]2829-the other two ladies is it ? ”[112-costanza]

“ Neither , ”[82-lady caroline] said [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline .

Then [Costanza]112-costanza ’s smiles returned , for [the young lady]1035-the young lady was having fun with [her]112-costanza and making jokes . [She]112-costanza told [her]112-costanza so , in [her]112-costanza friendly Italian way , and was genuinely delighted .

“ [I]82-lady caroline never make jokes , ”[82-lady caroline] said [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline briefly . “ [You]112-costanza had better go , or lunch will certainly not be ready by half - past twelve . ”[82-lady caroline]

And these curt words came out sounding so sweet that [Costanza]112-costanza felt as if kind compliments were being paid [her]112-costanza , and forgot [her]112-costanza disappointment about the cream and the chickens , and went away all gratitude and smiles .

“ This , ”[82-lady caroline] thought [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , “ will never do . [I]82-lady caroline have n’t come here to housekeep , and [I]82-lady caroline wo n’t . ”[82-lady caroline]

[She]82-lady caroline called [Costanza]112-costanza back . [Costanza]112-costanza came running . The sound of [her]112-costanza name in that voice enchanted [her]82-lady caroline .

“ [I]82-lady caroline have ordered the lunch for to - day , ”[82-lady caroline] said [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , with the serious angel face that was [hers]82-lady caroline when [she]82-lady caroline was annoyed , “ and [I]82-lady caroline have also ordered the dinner , but from now on [you]112-costanza will go to one of [the other ladies]2826-the other ladies for orders . [I]82-lady caroline give no more . ”[82-lady caroline]

The idea that [she]82-lady caroline would go on giving orders was too absurd . [She]82-lady caroline never gave orders at [home]222-home . [Nobody there]1065-nobody there dreamed of asking [her]82-lady caroline to do anything . That such a very tiresome activity should be thrust upon [her]82-lady caroline here , simply because [she]82-lady caroline happened to be able to talk Italian , was ridiculous . Let [the originals]946-the originals give orders if [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher refused to . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , of course , was [the one Nature intended for such a purpose]1067-the one nature intended for such a purpose . [She]83-mrs. fisher had the very air of [a competent housekeeper]1068-a competent housekeeper . [Her]83-mrs. fisher clothes were the clothes of [a housekeeper]1069-a housekeeper , and so was the way [she]83-mrs. fisher did [her]83-mrs. fisher hair .

Having delivered [herself]83-mrs. fisher of [her]83-mrs. fisher ultimatum with an acerbity that turned sweet on the way , and accompanied it by a peremptory gesture of dismissal that had the grace and loving - kindness of a benediction , it was annoying that [Costanza]112-costanza should only stand still with [her]112-costanza head on one side gazing at [her]82-lady caroline in obvious delight .

“ Oh , go away ! ”[82-lady caroline] exclaimed [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline in English , suddenly exasperated .

There had been a fly in [[her]82-lady caroline bedroom]1070-her bedroom that morning which had stuck just as [Costanza]112-costanza was sticking ; only one , but it might have been a myriad it was so tiresome from daylight on . It was determined to settle on [her]82-lady caroline face , and [she]82-lady caroline was determined it should not . [Its]1071-its persistence was uncanny . [It]1071-its woke [her]82-lady caroline , and would not let [her]82-lady caroline go to sleep again . [She]82-lady caroline hit at it , and it eluded [her]82-lady caroline without fuss or effort and with an almost visible blandness , and [she]82-lady caroline had only hit [herself]82-lady caroline . It came back again instantly , and with a loud buzz alighted on [her]82-lady caroline cheek . [She]82-lady caroline hit at it again and hurt [herself]82-lady caroline , while it skimmed gracefully away . [She]82-lady caroline lost [her]82-lady caroline temper , and sat up in bed and waited , watching to hit at it and kill it . [She]82-lady caroline kept on hitting at it at last with fury and with all [her]82-lady caroline strength , as if it were [a real enemy]1072-a real enemy deliberately trying to madden [her]82-lady caroline ; and it elegantly skimmed in and out of [her]82-lady caroline blows , not even angry , to be back again the next instant . It succeeded every time in getting on to [her]82-lady caroline face , and was quite indifferent how often it was driven away . That was why [she]82-lady caroline had dressed and come out so early . [Francesca]106-francesca had already been told to put a net over [her]106-francesca bed , for [she]106-francesca was not going to allow [herself]106-francesca to be annoyed twice like that . [People]278-people were exactly like flies . [She]82-lady caroline wished there were nets for keeping them off too . [She]82-lady caroline hit at [them]278-people with words and frowns , and like the fly they slipped between [her]82-lady caroline blows and were untouched . Worse than the fly , [they]278-people seemed unaware that [she]82-lady caroline had even tried to hit [them]278-people . The fly at least did for a moment go away . With [human beings]1074-human beings the only way to get rid of [them]278-people was to go away [herself]82-lady caroline . That was what , so tired , [she]82-lady caroline had done this [April]99-april ; and having got [here]478-here , having got close up to the details of life at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , it appeared that here , too , [she]82-lady caroline was not to be let alone .

Viewed from [London]2-london there had seemed to be no details . [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore from there seemed to be an empty , a delicious blank . Yet , after only twenty - four hours of it , [she]82-lady caroline was discovering that it was not a blank at all , and that [she]82-lady caroline was having to ward off as actively as ever . Already [she]82-lady caroline had been much stuck to . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had stuck nearly the whole of the day before , and this morning there had been no peace , not ten minutes uninterruptedly alone .

[Costanza]112-costanza of course had finally to go because [she]112-costanza had to cook , but hardly had [she]112-costanza gone before [Domenico]96-domenico came . [He]96-domenico came to water and tie up . That was natural , since [he]96-domenico was [the gardener]2775-the gardener , but [he]96-domenico watered and tied up all the things that were nearest to [her]82-lady caroline ; [he]96-domenico hovered closer and closer ; [he]96-domenico watered to excess ; [he]96-domenico tied plants that were as straight and steady as arrows . Well , at least [he]96-domenico was [a man]662-a man , and therefore not quite so annoying , and [his]96-domenico smiling good - morning was received with an answering smile ; upon which [Domenico]96-domenico forgot [[his]96-domenico family]1078-his family , [[his]96-domenico wife]244-his wife , [[his]96-domenico mother]451-his mother , [[his]96-domenico grown - up children]1081-his grown - up children and all [his]96-domenico duties , and only wanted to kiss [the young lady]1035-the young lady ’s feet .

[He]96-domenico could not do that , unfortunately , but [he]96-domenico could talk while [he]96-domenico worked , and talk [he]96-domenico did ; voluminously ; pouring out every kind of information , illustrating what [he]96-domenico said with gestures so lively that [he]96-domenico had to put down the watering - pot , and thus delay the end of the watering .

[Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline bore it for a time but presently was unable to bear it , and as [he]96-domenico would not go , and [she]82-lady caroline could not tell [him]96-domenico to , seeing that [he]96-domenico was engaged in [his]96-domenico proper work , once again it was [she]82-lady caroline who had to .

[She]82-lady caroline got off the wall and moved to the other side of [the garden]519-the garden , where in [a wooden shed]1084-a wooden shed were some comfortable low cane chairs . All [she]82-lady caroline wanted was to turn one of these round with its back to [Domenico]96-domenico and its front to [the sea]2735-the sea towards [Genoa]30-genoa . Such a little thing to want . [One]235-one would have thought [she]82-lady caroline might have been allowed to do that unmolested . But [he]96-domenico , who watched [her]82-lady caroline every movement , when [he]96-domenico saw [her]82-lady caroline approaching the chairs darted after [her]82-lady caroline and seized one and asked to be told where to put it .

Would [she]82-lady caroline never get away from being waited on , being made comfortable , being asked where [she]82-lady caroline wanted things put , having to say thank [you]1087-you ? [She]82-lady caroline was short with [Domenico]96-domenico , who instantly concluded the sun had given [her]82-lady caroline a headache , and ran in and fetched [her]82-lady caroline a sunshade and a cushion and a footstool , and was skilful , and was wonderful , and was one of [[Nature]105-nature ’s gentlemen]1088-nature ’s gentlemen .

[She]82-lady caroline shut [her]82-lady caroline eyes in a heavy resignation . [She]82-lady caroline could not be unkind to [Domenico]96-domenico . [She]82-lady caroline could not get up and walk indoors as [she]82-lady caroline would have done if it had been one of [the others]822-the others . [Domenico]96-domenico was intelligent and very competent . [She]82-lady caroline had at once discovered that it was [he]96-domenico who really ran [the house]410-the house , who really did everything . And [his]96-domenico manners were definitely delightful , and [he]96-domenico undoubtedly was [a charming person]1091-a charming person . It was only that [she]82-lady caroline did so much long to be let alone . If only , only [she]82-lady caroline could be left quite quiet for this one month , [she]82-lady caroline felt that [she]82-lady caroline might perhaps make something of [herself]82-lady caroline after all .

[She]82-lady caroline kept [her]82-lady caroline eyes shut , because then [he]96-domenico would think [she]82-lady caroline wanted to sleep and would go away .

[Domenico]96-domenico ’s romantic Italian soul melted within [him]96-domenico at the sight , for having [her]82-lady caroline eyes shut was extraordinarily becoming to [her]82-lady caroline . [He]96-domenico stood entranced , quite still , and [she]82-lady caroline thought [he]96-domenico had stolen away , so [she]82-lady caroline opened them again .

No ; there [he]96-domenico was , staring at [her]82-lady caroline . Even [he]96-domenico . There was no getting away from being stared at .

“ [I]82-lady caroline have a headache , ”[82-lady caroline] [she]82-lady caroline said , shutting them again .

“ It is the sun , ”[96-domenico] said [Domenico]96-domenico , “ and sitting on the wall without a hat . ”[96-domenico]

“ [I]82-lady caroline wish to sleep . ”[82-lady caroline]

“ Sì signorina , ”[96-domenico] [he]96-domenico said sympathetically ; and went softly away .

[She]82-lady caroline opened [her]82-lady caroline eyes with a sigh of relief . The gentle closing of the glass doors showed [her]82-lady caroline that [he]96-domenico had not only gone quite away but had shut [her]82-lady caroline out in [the garden]519-the garden so that [she]82-lady caroline should be undisturbed . Now perhaps [she]82-lady caroline would be alone till lunch - time .

It was very curious , and [no one in [the world]186-the world]1093-no one in the world could have been more surprised than [she]82-lady caroline [herself]82-lady caroline , but [she]82-lady caroline wanted to think . [She]82-lady caroline had never wanted to do that before . Everything else that it is possible to do without too much inconvenience [she]82-lady caroline had either wanted to do or had done at one period or another of [her]82-lady caroline life , but not before had [she]82-lady caroline wanted to think . [She]82-lady caroline had come to [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore with the single intention of lying comatose for four weeks in the sun , somewhere where [[her]82-lady caroline parents]1095-her parents and [friends]2712-friends were not , lapped in forgetfulness , stirring [herself]82-lady caroline only to be fed , and [she]82-lady caroline had not been there more than a few hours when this strange new desire took hold of [her]82-lady caroline .

There had been wonderful stars the evening before , and [she]82-lady caroline had gone out into [the top garden]1097-the top garden after dinner , leaving [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher alone over [her]83-mrs. fisher nuts and wine , and , sitting on the wall at the place where the lilies crowded [their]1098-their ghost heads , [she]82-lady caroline had looked out into the gulf of the night , and it had suddenly seemed as if [her]82-lady caroline life had been a noise all about nothing .

[She]82-lady caroline had been intensely surprised . [She]82-lady caroline knew stars and darkness did produce unusual emotions because , in others , [she]82-lady caroline had seen them being produced , but [they]1098-their had not before done it in [herself]82-lady caroline . A noise all about nothing . Could [she]82-lady caroline be quite well ? [She]82-lady caroline had wondered . For a long while past [she]82-lady caroline had been aware that [her]82-lady caroline life was a noise , but it had seemed to be very much about something ; a noise , indeed , about so much that [she]82-lady caroline felt [she]82-lady caroline must get out of earshot for a little or [she]82-lady caroline would be completely , and perhaps permanently , deafened . But suppose it was only a noise about nothing ?

[She]82-lady caroline had not had a question like that in [her]82-lady caroline mind before . It had made [her]82-lady caroline feel lonely . [She]82-lady caroline wanted to be alone , but not lonely . That was very different ; that was something that ached and hurt dreadfully right inside one . It was what [one]235-one dreaded most . It was what made [one]235-one go to so many parties ; and lately even the parties had seemed once or twice not to be a perfectly certain protection . Was it possible that loneliness had nothing to do with circumstances , but only with the way [one]235-one met [them]1102-them ? Perhaps , [she]82-lady caroline had thought , [she]82-lady caroline had better go to bed . [She]82-lady caroline could n’t be very well .

[She]82-lady caroline went to bed ; and in the morning , after [she]82-lady caroline had escaped the fly and had [her]82-lady caroline breakfast and got out again into [the garden]519-the garden , there was this same feeling again , and in broad daylight . Once more [she]82-lady caroline had that really rather disgusting suspicion that [her]82-lady caroline life till now had not only been loud but empty . Well , if that were so , and if [her]82-lady caroline first twenty - eight years — [the best ones]1104-the best ones — had gone just in meaningless noise , [she]82-lady caroline had better stop a moment and look round [her]82-lady caroline ; pause , as [they]1105-they said in tiresome novels , and consider . [She]82-lady caroline had n’t got many sets of twenty - eight years . [One more]1106-one more would see [her]82-lady caroline growing very like [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . Two more — [She]82-lady caroline averted [her]82-lady caroline eyes .

[[Her]82-lady caroline mother]1033-her mother would have been concerned if [she]1033-her mother had known . [[Her]82-lady caroline mother]1033-her mother doted . [[Her]82-lady caroline father]205-her father would have been concerned too , for [he]205-her father also doted . [Everybody]2701-everybody doted . And when , melodiously obstinate , [she]82-lady caroline had insisted on going off to entomb [herself]82-lady caroline in [Italy]13-italy for a whole month with [queer people [she]82-lady caroline had got out of an advertisement]1111-queer people she had got out of an advertisement , refusing even to take [[her]82-lady caroline maid]1112-her maid , the only explanation [[her]82-lady caroline friends]490-her friends could imagine was that poor [Scrap]115-scrap — such was [her]115-scrap name among [them]490-her friends — had overdone it and was feeling a little nervy .

[[Her]82-lady caroline mother]1033-her mother had been distressed at [her]82-lady caroline departure . It was such an odd thing to do , such a sign of disappointment . [She]82-lady caroline encouraged the general idea of the verge of a nervous breakdown . If [she]82-lady caroline could have seen [her]82-lady caroline adored [Scrap]115-scrap , more delightful to look upon than [[any other mother]1115-any other mother ’s daughter]1116-any other mother ’s daughter had ever yet been , the object of [her]82-lady caroline utmost pride , the source of all [her]82-lady caroline fondest hopes , sitting staring at the empty noonday Mediterranean considering [her]82-lady caroline three possible sets of twenty - eight years , [she]82-lady caroline would have been miserable . To go away alone was bad ; to think was worse . No good could come out of the thinking of [a beautiful young woman]1117-a beautiful young woman . [Complications]116-complications could come out of it in profusion , but no good . The thinking of [the beautiful]1118-the beautiful was bound to result in hesitations , in reluctances , in unhappiness all round . And here , if [she]82-lady caroline could have seen [her]1117-a beautiful young woman , sat [her]82-lady caroline Scrap thinking quite hard . And such things . Such old things . Things [nobody]231-nobody ever began to think till [they]231-nobody were at least forty .

Chapter 9

That one of [the two sitting - rooms which [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had taken for [her]83-mrs. fisher own]1120-the two sitting - rooms which mrs. fisher had taken for her own was [a room of charm and character]1121-a room of charm and character . [She]83-mrs. fisher surveyed [it]1121-a room of charm and character with satisfaction on going into [it]1121-a room of charm and character after breakfast , and was glad [it]1121-a room of charm and character was [hers]83-mrs. fisher . [It]1121-a room of charm and character had a tiled floor , and walls the colour of pale honey , and inlaid furniture the colour of amber , and mellow books , many in ivory or lemon - coloured covers . There was a big window overlooking [the sea]2735-the sea towards [Genoa]30-genoa , and a glass door through which [she]83-mrs. fisher could proceed out on to [the battlements]889-the battlements and walk along past [the quaint and attractive watch - tower]1124-the quaint and attractive watch - tower , in [itself]1124-the quaint and attractive watch - tower [a room with chairs and a writing table]1125-a room with chairs and a writing table , to where on the other side of [the tower]909-the tower [the battlements]889-the battlements ended in a marble seat , and one could see [the western bay]1128-the western bay and [the point round which began [the Gulf of Spezia]40-the gulf of spezia]1129-the point round which began the gulf of spezia . Yes , [she]83-mrs. fisher was very comfortably established [here]478-here ; and receptacles — [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher did not examine [their]1136-their nature closely , but [they]1136-their seemed to be small stone troughs , or perhaps little sarcophagi — ringed round the battlements with flowers .

[These battlements]1137-these battlements , [she]83-mrs. fisher thought , considering them , would have been a perfect place for [her]83-mrs. fisher to pace up and down gently in moments when [she]83-mrs. fisher least felt the need of [her]83-mrs. fisher stick , or to sit in on the marble seat , having first put a cushion on it , if there had not unfortunately been a second glass door opening on to [them]1137-these battlements , destroying [their]1137-these battlements complete privacy , spoiling [her]83-mrs. fisher feeling that [the place]428-the place was only for [her]83-mrs. fisher . This would ruin the battlements . [No one]310-no one could be perfectly at ease if [they]310-no one were being watched and knew it . What [she]83-mrs. fisher wanted , what [she]83-mrs. fisher surely had a right to , was privacy . [She]83-mrs. fisher had no wish to intrude on [the others]822-the others ; why then should [they]822-the others intrude on [her]83-mrs. fisher ? And [she]83-mrs. fisher could always relax [her]83-mrs. fisher privacy if , when [she]83-mrs. fisher became better acquainted with [[her]83-mrs. fisher companions]1146-her companions , [she]83-mrs. fisher should think it worth while , but [she]83-mrs. fisher doubted whether any of [the three]1147-the three would so develop as to make [her]83-mrs. fisher think it worth while .

Hardly anything was really worth while , reflected [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , except the past . It was astonishing , it was simply amazing , the superiority of the past to the present . [Those friends of [hers]83-mrs. fisher in [London]2-london]1148-those friends of hers in london , [solid persons of [her]83-mrs. fisher own age]1149-solid persons of her own age , knew the same past that [she]83-mrs. fisher knew , could talk about it with [her]83-mrs. fisher , could compare it as [she]83-mrs. fisher did with the tinkling present , and in remembering [great men]1150-great men forget for a moment [the trivial and barren young people who still , in spite of the war]1151-the trivial and barren young people who still , in spite of the war , seemed to litter [the world]186-the world in such numbers . [She]83-mrs. fisher had not come away from [these friends]1153-these friends , [these conversable ripe friends]1154-these conversable ripe friends , in order to spend [her]83-mrs. fisher time in [Italy]13-italy chatting with [three persons of another generation and defective experience]1155-three persons of another generation and defective experience ; [she]83-mrs. fisher had come away merely to avoid the treacheries of a [London]2-london April . It was true what [she]83-mrs. fisher had told [the two who came to [Prince of Wales Terrace]36-prince of wales terrace]1156-the two who came to prince of wales terrace , that all [she]83-mrs. fisher wished to do at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore was to sit by [herself]83-mrs. fisher in the sun and remember . [They]1156-the two who came to prince of wales terrace knew this , for [she]83-mrs. fisher had told [them]1156-the two who came to prince of wales terrace . Therefore [she]83-mrs. fisher had a right to expect [them]1156-the two who came to prince of wales terrace to stay inside [the round drawing - room]1139-the round drawing - room and not to emerge interruptingly on to [her]83-mrs. fisher battlements .

But would [they]1156-the two who came to prince of wales terrace ? The doubt spoilt [her]83-mrs. fisher morning . It was only towards lunch - time that [she]83-mrs. fisher saw a way to be quite safe , and ringing for [Francesca]106-francesca , bade [her]83-mrs. fisher , in slow and majestic Italian , shut the shutters of the glass door of [the round drawing - room]1139-the round drawing - room , and then , going with [her]83-mrs. fisher into [the room]219-the room , which had become darker than ever in consequence , but also , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher observed to [Francesca]106-francesca , who was being voluble , would because of this very darkness remain agreeably cool , and after all there were the numerous slit - windows in the walls to let in light and it was nothing to do with [her]106-francesca if [they]1156-the two who came to prince of wales terrace did not let it in , [she]83-mrs. fisher directed the placing of a cabinet of curios across the door on its inside .

This would discourage egress .

Then [she]83-mrs. fisher rang for [Domenico]96-domenico , and caused [him]96-domenico to move one of the flower - filled sarcophagi across the door on [its]1160-its outside .

This would discourage ingress .

“ [No one]310-no one , ”[96-domenico] said [Domenico]96-domenico , hesitating , “ will be able to use the door . ”[96-domenico]

“ [No one]310-no one , ”[83-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher firmly , “ will wish to . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

[She]83-mrs. fisher then retired to [[her]83-mrs. fisher sitting - room]997-her sitting - room , and from a chair placed where [she]83-mrs. fisher could look straight on to [them]1156-the two who came to prince of wales terrace , gazed at [her]83-mrs. fisher battlements , secured to [her]83-mrs. fisher now completely , with calm pleasure .

Being [here]478-here , [she]83-mrs. fisher reflected placidly , was much cheaper than being in [an hotel]1163-an hotel and , if [she]83-mrs. fisher could keep off the others , immeasurably more agreeable . [She]83-mrs. fisher was paying for [[her]83-mrs. fisher rooms]775-her rooms — [extremely pleasant rooms]1165-extremely pleasant rooms , now that [she]83-mrs. fisher was arranged in them—£3 a week , which came to about eight shillings a day , battlements , watch - tower and all . Where else abroad could [she]83-mrs. fisher live as well for so little , and have as many baths as [she]83-mrs. fisher liked , for eight shillings a day ? Of course [she]83-mrs. fisher did not yet know what [her]83-mrs. fisher food would cost , but [she]83-mrs. fisher would insist on carefulness over that , though [she]83-mrs. fisher would also insist on its being carefulness combined with excellence . The two were perfectly compatible if [the caterer]1166-the caterer took pains . [The servants]423-the servants ’ wages , [she]83-mrs. fisher had ascertained , were negligible , owing to the advantageous exchange , so that there was only the food to cause [her]83-mrs. fisher anxiety . If [she]83-mrs. fisher saw signs of extravagance [she]83-mrs. fisher would propose that [they]1168-they each hand over a reasonable sum every week to [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline which should cover the bills , any of it that was not used to be returned , and if it were exceeded the loss to be borne by [the caterer]1166-the caterer .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was well off and had the desire for comforts proper to [her]83-mrs. fisher age , but [she]83-mrs. fisher disliked expenses . So well off was [she]83-mrs. fisher that , had [she]83-mrs. fisher so chosen , [she]83-mrs. fisher could have lived in [an opulent part of [London]2-london]1170-an opulent part of london and driven from [it]1170-an opulent part of london and to [it]1170-an opulent part of london in [a Rolls - Royce]41-a rolls - royce . [She]83-mrs. fisher had no such wish . It needed more vitality than went with true comfort to deal with [a house in [an opulent spot]1172-an opulent spot and [a Rolls - Royce]1173-a rolls - royce]1171-a house in an opulent spot and a rolls - royce . Worries attended such possessions , worries of every kind , crowned by bills . In the sober gloom of [Prince of [Wales Terrace]19-wales terrace]36-prince of wales terrace [she]83-mrs. fisher could obscurely enjoy inexpensive yet real comfort , without being snatched at by [predatory men]1174-predatory men - [servants]419-servants or [collectors for charities]1176-collectors for charities , and [a taxi stand]1177-a taxi stand was at the end of [the road]2745-the road . [Her]83-mrs. fisher annual outlay was small . [The house]410-the house was inherited . [Death]117-death had furnished [it]410-the house for [her]83-mrs. fisher . [She]83-mrs. fisher trod in [the dining - room]856-the dining - room on the Turkey carpet of [[her]83-mrs. fisher fathers]1181-her fathers ; [she]83-mrs. fisher regulated [her]83-mrs. fisher day by the excellent black marble clock on the mantelpiece which [she]83-mrs. fisher remembered from childhood ; [her]83-mrs. fisher walls were entirely covered by the photographs [[her]83-mrs. fisher illustrious deceased friends]1182-her illustrious deceased friends had given either [herself]83-mrs. fisher or [[her]83-mrs. fisher father]205-her father , with [their]1182-her illustrious deceased friends own handwriting across the lower parts of [their]1182-her illustrious deceased friends bodies , and the windows , shrouded by the maroon curtains of all [her]83-mrs. fisher life , were decorated besides with the selfsame aquariums to which [she]83-mrs. fisher owed [her]83-mrs. fisher first lessons in sealore , and in which still swam slowly the goldfishes of [her]83-mrs. fisher youth .

Were [they]1184-they the same goldfish ? [She]83-mrs. fisher did not know . Perhaps , like carp , [they]1184-they outlived [everybody]2701-everybody . Perhaps , on the other hand , behind [the deep - sea vegetation provided for [them]1184-they at the bottom]1186-the deep - sea vegetation provided for them at the bottom , [they]1184-they had from time to time as the years went by withdrawn and replaced [themselves]1184-they . Were [they]1184-they or were [they]1184-they not , [she]83-mrs. fisher sometimes wondered , contemplating them between the courses of [her]83-mrs. fisher solitary meals , the same goldfish that had that day been there when [Carlyle]84-carlyle — how well [she]83-mrs. fisher remembered it — angrily strode up to [them]1184-they in the middle of some argument with [[her]83-mrs. fisher father]205-her father that had grown heated , and striking the glass smartly with [his]205-her father fist had put [them]1184-they to flight , shouting as [they]1184-they fled , “ Och , [ye deaf deevils]2833-ye deaf deevils ! Och , [[ye]2833-ye deaf deevils lucky deaf deevils]2834-ye lucky deaf deevils ! [Ye]2833-ye deaf deevils ca n’t hear anything of the blasted , blethering , doddering , glaikit fool - stuff [[yer]2833-ye deaf deevils maister]2835-yer maister talks , can [ye]2833-ye deaf deevils ? ”[205-her father] Or words to that effect .

Dear , great - souled [Carlyle]84-carlyle . Such natural gushings forth ; such true freshness ; such real grandeur . Rugged , if [you]1188-you will — yes , undoubtedly sometimes rugged , and startling in [a drawing - room]1189-a drawing - room , but magnificent . Who was there now to put beside [him]205-her father ? Who was there to mention in the same breath ? [[Her]83-mrs. fisher father]205-her father , than whom [no one]310-no one had had more flair , said : “ [Thomas]118-thomas briggs is immortal . ”[205-her father] And here was [this generation]1192-this generation , [this generation of puniness]1193-this generation of puniness , raising its little voice in doubts , or , still worse , not giving [itself]1193-this generation of puniness the trouble to raise it at all , not — it was incredible , but it had been thus reported to [her]83-mrs. fisher — even reading [him]205-her father . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher did not read [him]205-her father either , but that was different . [She]83-mrs. fisher had read [him]205-her father ; [she]83-mrs. fisher had certainly read [him]205-her father . Of course [she]83-mrs. fisher had read [him]205-her father . So like [Carlyle]84-carlyle to call [him]205-her father that . Yes , [she]83-mrs. fisher must have read [him]205-her father , though naturally details escaped [her]83-mrs. fisher .

The gong sounded . Lost in reminiscence [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had forgotten time , and hastened to [[her]83-mrs. fisher bedroom]1070-her bedroom to wash [her]83-mrs. fisher hands and smoothe [her]83-mrs. fisher hair . [She]83-mrs. fisher did not wish to be late and set a bad example , and perhaps find [her]83-mrs. fisher seat at the head of the table taken . [One]235-one could put no trust in the manners of [the younger generation]1197-the younger generation ; especially not in those of that [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins .

[She]83-mrs. fisher was , however , the first to arrive in [the dining - room]856-the dining - room . [Francesca]106-francesca in a white apron stood ready with an enormous dish of smoking hot , glistening maccaroni , but [nobody]231-nobody was there to eat it .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher sat down , looking stern . [Lax]120-lax , lax .

“ Serve [me]83-mrs. fisher , ”[83-mrs. fisher] [she]83-mrs. fisher said to [Francesca]106-francesca , who showed a disposition to wait for [the others]822-the others .

[Francesca]106-francesca served [her]106-francesca . Of the party [she]83-mrs. fisher liked [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher least , in fact [she]83-mrs. fisher did not like [her]83-mrs. fisher at all . [She]83-mrs. fisher was [the only one of [the four ladies who had not yet smiled]1202-the four ladies who had not yet smiled]1201-the only one of the four ladies who had not yet smiled . True [she]83-mrs. fisher was old , true [she]83-mrs. fisher was unbeautiful , true [she]83-mrs. fisher therefore had no reason to smile , but [kind ladies]1203-kind ladies smiled , reason or no . [They]1203-kind ladies smiled , not because [they]1203-kind ladies were happy but because [they]1203-kind ladies wished to make happy . [This one of [the four ladies]1205-the four ladies]1204-this one of the four ladies could not then , [Francesca]106-francesca decided , be kind ; so [she]106-francesca handed [her]83-mrs. fisher the maccaroni , being unable to hide any of [her]106-francesca feelings , morosely .

It was very well cooked , but [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had never cared for maccaroni , especially not this long , worm - shaped variety . [She]83-mrs. fisher found it difficult to eat — slippery , wriggling off [her]83-mrs. fisher fork , making [her]83-mrs. fisher look , [she]83-mrs. fisher felt , undignified when , having got it as [she]83-mrs. fisher supposed into [her]83-mrs. fisher mouth , ends of it yet hung out . [He]90-mr. fisher had during [their]1206-their married life behaved very much like [maccaroni]1207-maccaroni . [He]90-mr. fisher had slipped , [he]90-mr. fisher had wriggled , [he]90-mr. fisher had made [her]83-mrs. fisher feel undignified , and when at last [she]83-mrs. fisher had got [him]90-mr. fisher safe , as [she]83-mrs. fisher thought , there had invariably been little bits of [him]90-mr. fisher that still , as it were , hung out .

[Francesca]106-francesca from the sideboard watched [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s way with [maccaroni]121-maccaroni gloomily , and [her]106-francesca gloom deepened when [she]106-francesca saw [her]83-mrs. fisher at last take [her]83-mrs. fisher knife to it and chop it small .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher really did not know how else to get hold of the stuff . [She]83-mrs. fisher was aware that knives in this connection were improper , but [one]235-one did finally lose patience . [Maccaroni]121-maccaroni was never allowed to appear on [her]83-mrs. fisher table in [London]2-london . Years of practice , reflected [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , chopping it up , years of actual living in [Italy]13-italy , would be necessary to learn the exact trick . [Browning]108-browning managed [maccaroni]121-maccaroni wonderfully . [She]83-mrs. fisher remembered watching [him]108-browning one day when [he]108-browning came to lunch with [[her]83-mrs. fisher father]205-her father , and a dish of it had been ordered as a compliment to [his]108-browning connection with [Italy]13-italy . Fascinating , the way it went in . No chasing round the plate , no slidings off the fork , no subsequent protrusions of loose ends — just one dig , one whisk , one thrust , one gulp , and lo , yet [another poet]1210-another poet had been nourished .

What manners , [she]83-mrs. fisher thought ; what , what manners . It was not [an hotel]1163-an hotel , and considerations were due . [Francesca]106-francesca did not recognise the liquid flow as invective ; how was [she]106-francesca to , when it came out sounding like that ? Like pure flax ; like the hair of [northern babes]1216-northern babes . On such a little head only blessing could rest , on such a little head the nimbus of [the holiest saints]1217-the holiest saints could fitly be placed .

[Scrap]115-scrap shut [her]115-scrap eyes and refused to answer . [She]106-francesca kept [her]106-francesca eyes tight shut this time . Why should [she]106-francesca go in to lunch if [she]106-francesca did n’t want to ? But [the unfortunate Scrap]115-scrap could not just sit still and close [her]106-francesca eyes without rousing that desire to stroke and pet in [her]106-francesca beholders with which [she]106-francesca was only too familiar . [Even the cook]1225-even the cook had patted [her]106-francesca . [It]1228-i was [the freckled original]1229-the freckled original . [The dark one]819-the dark one , then , was [the one with the hand]1231-the one with the hand . [The freckled one]1232-the freckled one rose in [her]115-scrap esteem .

And [Francesca]106-francesca — it must have been wilful — offered [her]83-mrs. fisher the maccaroni again .

Chapter 10

There was no way of getting into or out of [the top garden at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore]1238-the top garden at san salvatore except through the two glass doors , unfortunately side by side , of [the dining - room]856-the dining - room and [the hall]337-the hall . [A person in the garden who wished to escape unseen]1241-a person in the garden who wished to escape unseen could not , for [the person to be escaped from]1242-the person to be escaped from would be met on the way . It was [a small , oblong garden]1243-a small , oblong garden , and concealment was impossible . What trees there were — the Judas tree , the tamarisk , the umbrella - pine — grew close to the low parapets . Rose bushes gave no real cover ; one step to right or left of them , and [the person wishing to be private]1244-the person wishing to be private was discovered . Only [the north - west corner]1245-the north - west corner was a little place jutting out from the great wall , a kind of excrescence or loop , no doubt used in the old distrustful days for observation , where it was possible to sit really unseen , because between [it]1245-the north - west corner and [the house]410-the house was a thick clump of daphne .

[Scrap]115-scrap , after glancing round to see that [no one]310-no one was looking , got up and carried [her]115-scrap chair into [this place]2843-this place , stealing away as carefully on tiptoe as those steal whose purpose is sin . There was another excrescence on the walls just like it at [the north - east corner]1249-the north - east corner , but this , though the view from [it]1245-the north - west corner was almost more beautiful , for from [it]1245-the north - west corner [you]1250-you could see [the bay]735-the bay and [the lovely mountains behind [Mezzago]32-mezzago]1252-the lovely mountains behind mezzago , was exposed . No bushes grew near [it]1245-the north - west corner , nor had [it]1245-the north - west corner any shade . The north - west loop then was where [she]115-scrap would sit , and [she]115-scrap settled into [it]1245-the north - west corner , and nestling [her]115-scrap head in [her]115-scrap cushion and putting [her]115-scrap feet comfortably on the parapet , from whence [they]1253-they appeared to [the villagers]1254-the villagers on [the piazza]835-the piazza below as two white doves , thought that now indeed [she]115-scrap would be safe .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher found [her]115-scrap [there]296-there , guided by the smell of [her]83-mrs. fisher cigarette . [The incautious Scrap]115-scrap had not thought of that . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher did not smoke [herself]83-mrs. fisher , and all the more distinctly could [she]83-mrs. fisher smell the smoke of [others]309-others . The virile smell met [her]83-mrs. fisher directly [she]83-mrs. fisher went out into [the garden]519-the garden from [the dining - room]856-the dining - room after lunch in order to have [her]83-mrs. fisher coffee . [She]83-mrs. fisher had bidden [Francesca]106-francesca set the coffee in the shade of [the house]410-the house just outside the glass door , and when [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , seeing a table being carried [there]296-there , reminded [her]83-mrs. fisher , very officiously and tactlessly [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher considered , that [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline wanted to be alone , [she]83-mrs. fisher retorted — and with what propriety — that [the garden]519-the garden was for [everybody]2701-everybody .

Into it accordingly [she]83-mrs. fisher went , and was immediately aware that [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline was smoking . [She]83-mrs. fisher said to [herself]83-mrs. fisher , “ [These modern young women]2844-these modern young women , ”[83-mrs. fisher] and proceeded to find [her]82-lady caroline ; [her]83-mrs. fisher stick , now that lunch was over , being no longer the hindrance to action that it was before [her]83-mrs. fisher meal had been securely , as [Browning]108-browning once said — surely it was [Browning]108-browning ? Yes , [she]83-mrs. fisher remembered how much diverted [she]83-mrs. fisher had been — roped in .

[Nobody]231-nobody diverted [her]83-mrs. fisher now , reflected [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , making straight for the clump of daphne ; [the world]186-the world had grown very dull , and had entirely lost its sense of humour . Probably [they]1266-they still had [their]1266-they jokes , [these people]2728-these people — in fact [she]83-mrs. fisher knew [they]1266-they did , for [Punch]122-punch still went on ; but how differently it went on , and what jokes . [Thackeray]123-thackeray , in [his]123-thackeray inimitable way , would have made mincemeat of [this generation]1192-this generation . Of how much it needed the tonic properties of that astringent pen it was of course unaware . It no longer even held [him]123-thackeray — at least , so [she]83-mrs. fisher had been informed — in any particular esteem . Well , [she]83-mrs. fisher could not give [it]1269-it eyes to see and ears to hear and a heart to understand , but [she]83-mrs. fisher could and would give it , represented and united in the form of [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , a good dose of honest medicine .

“ [I]83-mrs. fisher hear [you]115-scrap are not well , ”[83-mrs. fisher] [she]83-mrs. fisher said , standing in the narrow entrance of [the loop]1270-the loop and looking down with the inflexible face of one who is determined to do good at the motionless and apparently sleeping [Scrap]115-scrap .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had a deep voice , very like [a man]662-a man ’s , for [she]83-mrs. fisher had been overtaken by that strange masculinity that sometimes pursues [a woman]804-a woman during the last laps of [her]804-a woman life .

[Scrap]115-scrap tried to pretend that [she]115-scrap was asleep , but if [she]115-scrap had been [her]115-scrap cigarette would not have been held in [her]115-scrap fingers but would have been lying on the ground .

[She]83-mrs. fisher forgot this . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher did not , and coming inside [the loop]1270-the loop , sat down on a narrow stone seat built out of the wall . For a little [she]83-mrs. fisher could sit on it ; for a little , till the chill began to penetrate .

[She]83-mrs. fisher contemplated the figure before [her]83-mrs. fisher . Undoubtedly [a pretty creature]892-a pretty creature , and one that would have had a success at [Farringford]42-farringford . Strange how easily even [the greatest men]1275-the greatest men were moved by exteriors . [She]83-mrs. fisher had seen with [her]83-mrs. fisher own eyes [Tennyson]86-tennyson turn away from [everybody]2701-everybody — turn , positively , [his]86-tennyson back on [a crowd of [eminent people]1278-eminent people assembled to do [him]86-tennyson honour , and withdraw to the window with [a young person]1279-a young person [nobody]231-nobody had ever heard of , who had been brought [there]296-there by accident and whose one and only merit — if it be a merit , that which is conferred by chance]1277-a crowd of eminent people assembled to do him honour , and withdraw to the window with a young person nobody had ever heard of , who had been brought there by accident and whose one and only merit — if it be a merit , that which is conferred by chance — was beauty . Beauty ! All over before [you]1282-you can turn round . An affair , [one]235-one might almost say , of minutes . Well , while it lasted it did seem able to do what it liked with [men]807-men . Even [husbands]2800-husbands were not immune . There had been passages in the life of [Mr. Fisher]90-mr. fisher . . .

“ [I]83-mrs. fisher expect the journey has upset [you]90-mr. fisher , ”[83-mrs. fisher] [she]83-mrs. fisher said in [her]83-mrs. fisher deep voice . “ What [you]90-mr. fisher want is a good dose of some simple medicine . [Scrap]115-scrap opened [her]115-scrap eyes and looked straight at [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher .

[Scrap]115-scrap threw the cigarette over the parapet .

“ What does [one]235-one do with [people]278-people like this ? ”[115-scrap] [Scrap]115-scrap asked [herself]115-scrap , [her]115-scrap eyes fixed on [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher in what felt to [her]115-scrap an indignant stare but appeared to [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher as really charming docility .

“ [I]115-scrap never go to bed , ”[115-scrap] snapped [Scrap]115-scrap ; and it sounded as moving , as forlorn , as that line spoken years and years ago by [an actress playing the part of [Poor Jo]124-poor jo in dramatised version of Bleak House—“I’m]2851-an actress playing the part of poor jo in dramatised version of bleak house—“i’m always moving on , ”[124-poor jo] said [Poor Jo]124-poor jo in this play , urged to do so by [a policeman]1286-a policeman ; and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , then [a girl]2717-a girl , had laid [her]83-mrs. fisher head on the red velvet parapet of the front row of the dress circle and wept aloud .

It was wonderful , [Scrap]115-scrap ’s voice . It had given [her]83-mrs. fisher , in the ten years since [she]83-mrs. fisher came out , all the triumphs that intelligence and wit can have , because it made whatever [she]83-mrs. fisher said seem memorable . [She]83-mrs. fisher ought , with a throat formation like that , to have been [a singer]1288-a singer , but in every kind of music [Scrap]115-scrap was dumb except this one music of the speaking voice ; and what a fascination , what a spell lay in that . Such was the loveliness of [her]83-mrs. fisher face and the beauty of [her]83-mrs. fisher colouring that there was not [a man into whose eyes at the sight of [her]83-mrs. fisher]1289-a man into whose eyes at the sight of her there did not leap a flame of intensest interest ; but , when [he]1289-a man into whose eyes at the sight of her heard [her]83-mrs. fisher voice , the flame in [that man]1290-that man ’s eyes was caught and fixed . [Scrap]115-scrap had had enough of this look . It only led to difficulties . At first it had delighted [her]115-scrap . [She]115-scrap had been excited , triumphant . To be apparently incapable of doing or saying the wrong thing , to be applauded , listened to , petted , adored wherever [she]115-scrap went , and when [she]115-scrap came [home]222-home to find nothing there either but the most indulgent proud fondness — why , how extremely pleasant . And so easy , too . No preparation necessary for this achievement , no hard work , nothing to learn . [She]115-scrap need take no trouble . [She]115-scrap had only to appear , and presently say something .

But gradually experiences gathered round [her]115-scrap . After all , [she]115-scrap had to take trouble , [she]115-scrap had to make efforts , because , [she]115-scrap discovered with astonishment and rage , [she]115-scrap had to defend [herself]115-scrap . That look , that leaping look , meant that [she]115-scrap was going to be grabbed at . Some of [those who had it]1300-those who had it were more humble than [others]309-others , especially if [they]1302-they were young , but [they]1302-they all , according to [their]1302-they several ability , grabbed ; and [she]115-scrap who had entered [the world]186-the world so jauntily , with [her]115-scrap head in the air and the completest confidence in [anybody whose hair was grey]1304-anybody whose hair was grey , began to distrust , and then to dislike , and soon to shrink away from , and presently to be indignant . Sometimes it was just as if [she]115-scrap did n’t belong to [herself]115-scrap , was n’t [her]115-scrap own at all , but was regarded as a universal thing , a sort of beauty - of - all - work . Really [men]807-men . . . And [she]115-scrap found [herself]115-scrap involved in , vague quarrels , being curiously hated . Really [women]2846-women . . . And when the war came , and [she]115-scrap flung [herself]115-scrap into it along with [everybody else]849-everybody else , it finished [her]115-scrap . [Really generals]1308-really generals . . .

The war finished [Scrap]115-scrap . It killed [the one man [she]115-scrap felt safe with , whom [she]115-scrap would have married]1309-the one man she felt safe with , whom she would have married , and it finally disgusted [her]115-scrap with love . Since then [she]115-scrap had been embittered . [She]115-scrap was struggling as angrily in the sweet stuff of life as a wasp got caught in honey . Just as desperately did [she]115-scrap try to unstick [her]115-scrap wings . It gave [her]115-scrap no pleasure to outdo [other women]1310-other women ; [she]115-scrap did n’t want [[their]1310-other women tiresome men]1311-their tiresome men . What could one do with [men]807-men when one had got [them]807-men ? [None of [them]807-men]1313-none of them would talk to [her]115-scrap of anything but the things of love , and how foolish and fatiguing that became after a bit . It was as though [a healthy person with a normal hunger]1314-a healthy person with a normal hunger was given nothing whatever to eat but sugar . Love , love . . . the very word made [her]115-scrap want to slap [somebody]996-somebody . “ Why should [I]115-scrap love [you]996-somebody ? Why should [I]115-scrap ? ”[115-scrap] [she]115-scrap would ask amazed sometimes when [somebody]996-somebody was trying — [somebody]996-somebody was always trying — to propose to [her]115-scrap . But [she]115-scrap never got a real answer , only further incoherence .

A deep cynicism took hold of [the unhappy Scrap]115-scrap . [Her]115-scrap inside grew hoary with disillusionment , while [her]115-scrap gracious and charming outside continued to make [the world]186-the world more beautiful . What had the future in it for [her]115-scrap ? [She]115-scrap would not be able , after such a preparation , to take hold of it . [She]115-scrap was fit for nothing ; [she]115-scrap had wasted all this time being beautiful . Presently [she]115-scrap would n’t be beautiful , and what then ? [Scrap]115-scrap did n’t know what then , it appalled [her]115-scrap to wonder even . Tired as [she]115-scrap was of being conspicuous [she]115-scrap was at least used to that , [she]115-scrap had never known anything else ; and to become inconspicuous , to fade , to grow shabby and dim , would probably be most painful . And once [she]115-scrap began , what years and years of it there would be ! Imagine , thought [Scrap]115-scrap , having most of [one]235-one ’s life at the wrong end . Imagine being old for two or three times as long as being young . Stupid , stupid . Everything was stupid . There was n’t a thing [she]115-scrap wanted to do . There were thousands of things [she]115-scrap did n’t want to do . Avoidance , silence , invisibility , if possible unconsciousness — these negations were all [she]115-scrap asked for at the moment ; and here , even here , [she]115-scrap was not allowed a minute ’s peace , and [this absurd woman]1320-this absurd woman must come pretending , merely because [she]1320-this absurd woman wanted to exercise power and make [her]115-scrap go to bed and make [her]115-scrap — hideous — drink castor oil , that [she]1320-this absurd woman thought [she]115-scrap was ill .

Chapter 11

The sweet smells that were everywhere in [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore were alone enough to produce concord . [They]1353-they came into [the sitting - room]1354-the sitting - room from the flowers on the battlements , and met the ones from the flowers inside [the room]219-the room , and almost , thought [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , could be seen greeting each other with a holy kiss . Who could be angry in the middle of such gentlenesses ? Who could be acquisitive , selfish , in the old rasped [London]2-london way , in the presence of this bounteous beauty ?

Yet [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher seemed to be all three of these things .

There was so much beauty , so much more than enough for every one , that it did appear to be a vain activity to try and make a corner in it .

Yet [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was trying to make a corner in it , and had railed off a portion for [her]83-mrs. fisher exclusive use .

Well , [she]83-mrs. fisher would get over that presently ; [she]83-mrs. fisher would get over it inevitably , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was sure , after a day or two in the extraordinary atmosphere of peace in [that place]1356-that place .

Meanwhile [she]83-mrs. fisher obviously had n’t even begun to get over it . [She]83-mrs. fisher stood looking at [her]83-mrs. fisher and [Rose]103-rose with an expression that appeared to be one of anger . Anger . Fancy . Silly old nerve - racked [London]2-london feelings , thought [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , whose eyes saw [the room full of kisses]1357-the room full of kisses , and everybody in [it]1357-the room full of kisses being kissed , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher as copiously as [she]83-mrs. fisher [herself]83-mrs. fisher and [Rose]103-rose .

“ [You]83-mrs. fisher do n’t like [us]2868-us being in [here]478-here , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , getting up and at once , after [her]83-mrs. fisher manner , fixing on the truth . “ Why ? ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

“ [I]83-mrs. fisher should have thought , ”[83-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher leaning on [her]83-mrs. fisher stick , “ [you]83-mrs. fisher could have seen that it is [[my]83-mrs. fisher room]2780-my room . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

“ [You]83-mrs. fisher mean because of the photographs , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins .

“ And the notepaper , ”[83-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . “ Notepaper with [my]83-mrs. fisher London address on it . That pen — ”[83-mrs. fisher]

[She]83-mrs. fisher pointed . It was still in [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s hand .

“ Is [yours]83-mrs. fisher . [I]64-mrs. wilkins ’m very sorry , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , laying it on the table . And [she]64-mrs. wilkins added smiling , that it had just been writing some very amiable things .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was moved almost beyond control by this speech . [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins must certainly be curbed . But how ? There was a curious imperviousness about [her]64-mrs. wilkins . A great desire to love and be [friends]2712-friends , to love [everybody]2701-everybody , to be friends with [everybody]2701-everybody , seemed to be invading [Lotty]149-lotty — a desire for sheer goodness . [Rose]103-rose ’s own experience was that goodness , the state of being good , was only reached with difficulty and pain . It took a long time to get to it ; in fact [one]235-one never did get to it , or , if for a flashing instant one did , it was only for a flashing instant . Desperate perseverance was needed to struggle along its path , and all the way was dotted with doubts . [Lotty]149-lotty simply flew along . [She]149-lotty had certainly , thought [Rose]103-rose , not got rid of [her]149-lotty impetuousness . It had merely taken another direction . [She]149-lotty was now impetuously becoming [a saint]1378-a saint . Could one really attain goodness so violently ? Would n’t there be an equally violent reaction ?

[Rose]103-rose said nothing . [She]103-rose was bewildered by [Lotty]149-lotty . One odd effect of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore on [[her]149-lotty rapidly developing friend]1392-her rapidly developing friend was [her]149-lotty sudden free use of robust words . But how [she]149-lotty wished , oh how [Rose]103-rose wished , that [she]149-lotty too could write to [[her]149-lotty husband]204-her husband and say “ Come . ”[149-lotty] [The Wilkins ménage]65-mr. wilkins , however pompous [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins might be , and [he]65-mr. wilkins had seemed to [Rose]103-rose pompous , was on a healthier , more natural footing than [hers]103-rose . [Lotty]149-lotty could write to [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins and would get an answer . To see apparently one of these very same letters arrive , and open it and find :

— no , it could n’t be borne .

“ [I]149-lotty do n’t think [I]149-lotty ’ll come down to [the village]615-the village with [you]149-lotty to - day , ”[149-lotty] [she]149-lotty said , looking up at [Lotty]149-lotty with eyes suddenly gone dim . “ [I]149-lotty think [I]149-lotty want to think . ”[149-lotty]

“ Invite whom ? ”[103-rose] asked [Rose]103-rose , startled .

“ [[Your]149-lotty husband]2730-your husband . ”[149-lotty]

Chapter 12

At the evening meal , which was the first time [the whole four]1396-the whole four sat round the dining - room table together , [Scrap]115-scrap appeared .

[She]115-scrap appeared quite punctually , and in one of those wrappers or tea - gowns which are sometimes described as ravishing . [This one]861-this one really was ravishing . It certainly ravished [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , who could not take [her]64-mrs. wilkins eyes off [the enchanting figure opposite]1398-the enchanting figure opposite . [Whereupon Scrap]115-scrap stared at [her]83-mrs. fisher .

The dinner was very good . Succulence succeeded succulence .
