“ There are [six bedrooms]2950-six bedrooms , ”[83-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ; for both [she]83-mrs. fisher and [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline had thoroughly searched [the house]410-the house on arriving , in order to see which part of it [they]1468-we would be most comfortable in , and [they]1468-we both knew that there were [six bedrooms , two of which]1469-six bedrooms , two of which were very small , and in one of these small ones [Francesca]106-francesca slept in the company of a chair and a chest of drawers , and the other , similarly furnished , was empty .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot had hardly looked at [the house]410-the house , having spent most of [their]1468-we time out - of - doors gaping at the scenery , and had , in the agitated inattentiveness of [their]1468-we minds when first [they]1468-we began negotiating for [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , got into [their]1468-we heads that the eight beds of which [the owner]440-the owner spoke were the same as [eight bedrooms]1472-eight bedrooms ; which [they]1468-we were not . “ There are [six bedrooms]2950-six bedrooms , ”[83-mrs. fisher] repeated [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . “ [We]1468-we have four , [Francesca]106-francesca has the fifth , and the sixth is empty . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

“ So that , ”[115-scrap] said [Scrap]115-scrap , “ however kind [we]1468-we feel [we]1468-we would be if [we]1468-we could , [we]1468-we ca n’t . Is n’t it fortunate ? ”[115-scrap]

“ But then there ’s only room for one ? ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , looking round at the three faces .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was taken aback . This question of the beds was unexpected . In [inviting Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins [she]64-mrs. wilkins had intended to put [him]1474-him in [one of [the four spare - rooms that [she]64-mrs. wilkins imagined were [there]296-there]1476-the four spare - rooms that she imagined were there]1475-one of the four spare - rooms that she imagined were there . [She]64-mrs. wilkins was sure [she]64-mrs. wilkins would be much fonder of [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , and [he]1474-him not mind [her]64-mrs. wilkins nearly so much , if [they]1480-they were not shut up together at night , if in the morning [they]1480-they could meet with the cheery affection of [friends between whom lies no shadow of differences about the window or the washing arrangements]1484-friends between whom lies no shadow of differences about the window or the washing arrangements , or of absurd little choked - down resentments at something that had seemed to one of [them]1480-they unfair . But [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , as impervious to rebuke as [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had feared , immediately repeated the tiresome formula and launched out into a long and excessively indelicate speech about the best place for [the person [she]83-mrs. fisher called [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins to sleep in]1490-the person she called mellersh to sleep in .

[Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins — [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , remembering [the Thomases]134-the thomases and [Johns]135-johns and Alfreds and [Roberts]136-roberts of [her]83-mrs. fisher day , plain names that yet had all become glorious , thought it sheer affectation to be christened [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins — was , it seemed , [[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s husband]1491-mrs. wilkins ’s husband , and therefore [his]1491-mrs. wilkins ’s husband place was clearly indicated . Why this talk ? [She]83-mrs. fisher [herself]83-mrs. fisher , as if foreseeing [his]1491-mrs. wilkins ’s husband arrival , had had a second bed put in [[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s room]1492-mrs. wilkins ’s room . There were certain things in life which were never talked about but only done . Most things connected with [husbands]2800-husbands were not talked about ; and to have a whole dinner - table taken up with a discussion as to where one of [them]2800-husbands should sleep was an affront to the decencies . How and where [husbands]2800-husbands slept should be known only to [[their]2800-husbands wives]1495-their wives . Sometimes it was not known to [them]2800-husbands , and then the marriage had less happy moments ; but these moments were not talked about either ; the decencies continued to be preserved . At least , it was so in [her]83-mrs. fisher day . To have to hear whether [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins should or should not sleep with [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , and the reasons why [he]65-mr. wilkins should and the reasons why [he]65-mr. wilkins should n’t , was both uninteresting and indelicate .

[She]83-mrs. fisher might have succeeded in imposing propriety and changing the conversation if it had not been for [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline . [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline encouraged [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , and threw [herself]82-lady caroline into the discussion with every bit as much unreserve as [Mrs. Wilkins]1496-mrs. wilkins [herself]82-lady caroline . No doubt [she]82-lady caroline was impelled on this occasion by [Chianti]129-the chianti , but whatever the reason there it was . And , characteristically , [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline was all for [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins being given [the solitary spare - room]1497-the solitary spare - room . [She]82-lady caroline took that for granted . Any other arrangement would be impossible , [she]82-lady caroline said ; [her]82-lady caroline expression was , “ Barbarous . ”[82-lady caroline] Had [she]82-lady caroline never read [her]82-lady caroline Bible , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was tempted to inquire — And [they]1498-they two shall be [one flesh]1499-one flesh ? Clearly also , then , [one room]2801-one room . But [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher did not inquire . [She]83-mrs. fisher did not care even to allude to such texts to [some one unmarried]1501-some one unmarried .

However , there was one way [she]83-mrs. fisher could force [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins into [his]65-mr. wilkins proper place and save the situation : [she]83-mrs. fisher could say [she]83-mrs. fisher [herself]83-mrs. fisher intended to invite [a friend]570-a friend . It was [her]83-mrs. fisher right . [They]1503-they had all said so . Apart from propriety , it was monstrous that [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins should want to monopolise [the one spare - room]2954-the one spare - room , when in [[her]64-mrs. wilkins own room]1505-her own room was everything necessary for [[her]64-mrs. wilkins husband]204-her husband . Perhaps [she]83-mrs. fisher really would invite [somebody]996-somebody — not invite , but suggest coming . There was [Kate Lumley]137-kate , for instance . [Kate]137-kate could perfectly afford to come and pay [her]137-kate share ; and [she]137-kate was of [her]137-kate own period and knew , and had known , most of [the people [she]137-kate [herself]137-kate knew and had known]1508-the people she herself knew and had known . [Kate]137-kate , of course , had only been on the fringe ; [she]137-kate used to be asked only to the big parties , not to the small ones , and [she]137-kate still was only on the fringe . There were [some people who never got off the fringe]1509-some people who never got off the fringe , and [Kate]137-kate was one . Often , however , [such people]1510-such people were more permanently agreeable to be with than [the others]822-the others , in that [they]1510-such people remained grateful .

Yes ; [she]83-mrs. fisher might really consider [Kate]137-kate . [The poor soul]1512-the poor soul had never married , but then [everybody]2701-everybody could not expect to marry , and [she]137-kate was quite comfortably off — not too comfortably , but just comfortably enough to pay [her]137-kate own expenses if [she]137-kate came and yet be grateful . Yes ; [Kate]137-kate was the solution . If [she]137-kate came , at one stroke , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher saw , would [the Wilkinses]127-the wilkinses be regularised and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins be prevented from having more than [[her]64-mrs. wilkins share of [the rooms]759-the rooms]1514-her share of the rooms . Also , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher would save [herself]83-mrs. fisher from isolation ; spiritual isolation . [She]83-mrs. fisher desired physical isolation between meals , but [she]83-mrs. fisher disliked that isolation which is of the spirit . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher said nothing at the moment ; but presently in [the drawing - room]1518-the drawing - room , when [they]1519-they were gathered round the wood fire — [she]83-mrs. fisher had discovered there was no fireplace in [[her]83-mrs. fisher own sitting - room]886-her own sitting - room , and therefore [she]83-mrs. fisher would after all be forced , so long as the evenings remained cool , to spend them in [the other room]1521-the other room — presently , while [Francesca]106-francesca was handing coffee round and [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline was poisoning the air with smoke , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , looking relieved and pleased , said : “ Well , if [nobody]231-nobody really wants [that room]1140-that room , and would n’t use [it]1140-that room anyhow , [I]64-mrs. wilkins shall be very glad if [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins may have it . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

Chapter 13

The uneventful days — only outwardly uneventful — slipped by in floods of sunshine , and [the servants]423-the servants , watching [the four ladies]1205-the four ladies , came to the conclusion there was very little life in [them]423-the servants .

To [the servants [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore]1528-the servants san salvatore seemed asleep . [No one]310-no one came to tea , nor did [the ladies]629-the ladies go anywhere to tea . [Other tenants]1531-other tenants in [other springs]1532-other springs had been far more active . There had been stir and enterprise ; [the boat]1533-the boat had been used ; excursions had been made ; [Beppo]97-beppo ’s fly was ordered ; [[people]278-people from [Mezzago]32-mezzago]1535-people from mezzago came over and spent the day ; [the house]410-the house rang with voices ; even sometimes champagne had been drunk . Life was varied , life was interesting . But this ? What was this ? [The servants]423-the servants were not even scolded . [They]423-the servants were left completely to [themselves]423-the servants . [They]423-the servants yawned .

Perplexing , too , was the entire absence of [gentlemen]1052-gentlemen . How could [gentlemen]1052-gentlemen keep away from so much beauty ? For , added up , and even after the subtraction of [the old one]2828-the old one , [the three younger ladies]1541-the three younger ladies produced a formidable total of that which [gentlemen]1052-gentlemen usually sought .

Also the evident desire of [each lady]1543-each lady to spend long hours separated from [the other ladies puzzled [the servants]423-the servants]1544-the other ladies puzzled the servants . The result was a deathly stillness in [the house]410-the house , except at meal - times . [It]410-the house might have been as empty as [it]410-the house had been all the winter , for any sounds of life there were . [The old lady]1547-the old lady sat in [[her]1547-the old lady room]727-her room , alone ; [the dark - eyed lady]1549-the dark - eyed lady wandered off alone , loitering , so [Domenico]96-domenico told [them]423-the servants , who sometimes came across [her]1549-the dark - eyed lady in the course of [his]96-domenico duties , incomprehensibly among [the rocks]646-the rocks ; [the very beautiful fair lady]1551-the very beautiful fair lady lay in [her]1551-the very beautiful fair lady low chair in [the top garden]1097-the top garden , alone ; [the less , but still beautiful fair lady]1553-the less , but still beautiful fair lady went up [the hills]1554-the hills and stayed up them for hours , alone ; and every day the sun blazed slowly round [the house]410-the house , and disappeared at evening into [the sea]2735-the sea , and nothing at all had happened .

[The servants]423-the servants yawned .

Yet [the four visitors]1558-the four visitors , while [their]1558-the four visitors bodies sat — that was [Mrs. Fisher’s]138-mrs. fisher’s — or lay — that was [Lady Caroline’s]139-lady caroline’s — or loitered — that was [Mrs. Arbuthnot’s]140-mrs. arbuthnot’s — or went in solitude up into [the hills]1554-the hills — that was [Mrs. Wilkins’s]141-mrs. wilkins’s — were anything but torpid really . [Their]1558-the four visitors minds were unusually busy . Even at night [their]1558-the four visitors minds were busy , and the dreams [they]1558-the four visitors had were clear , thin , quick things , entirely different from the heavy dreams of [home]222-home . There was that in the atmosphere of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore which produced active - mindedness in all except [the natives]1561-the natives . [They]1558-the four visitors , as before , whatever the beauty around [them]1558-the four visitors , whatever the prodigal seasons did , remained immune from thoughts other than those [they]1558-the four visitors were accustomed to . All [their]1558-the four visitors lives [they]1558-the four visitors had seen , year by year , the amazing recurrent spectacle of April in [the gardens]1562-the gardens , and custom had made it invisible to [them]1558-the four visitors . [They]1558-the four visitors were as blind to it , as unconscious of it , as [Domenico]96-domenico ’s dog asleep in the sun .

[The visitors]1563-the visitors could not be blind to it — it was too arresting after [London]2-london in a particularly wet and gloomy March . Suddenly to be transported to [that place where the air was so still that it held its breath , where the light was so golden that the most ordinary things were transfigured]1564-that place where the air was so still that it held its breath , where the light was so golden that the most ordinary things were transfigured — to be transported into that delicate warmth , that caressing fragrance , and to have [the old grey castle]1565-the old grey castle as the setting , and , in the distance , [the serene clear hills of [Perugini]142-perugini ’s backgrounds]1566-the serene clear hills of perugini ’s backgrounds , was an astonishing contrast . [Even Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , used all [her]82-lady caroline life to beauty , who had been everywhere and seen everything , felt the surprise of it . It was , that year , a particularly wonderful spring , and of all the months at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore [April]99-april , if the weather was fine , was best . May scorched and withered ; March was restless , and could be hard and cold in its brightness ; but [April]99-april came along softly like a blessing , and if it were a fine April it was so beautiful that it was impossible not to feel different , not to feel stirred and touched .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , [we]1567-we have seen , responded to it instantly . [She]64-mrs. wilkins , so to speak , at once flung off all [her]64-mrs. wilkins garments and dived straight into glory , unhesitatingly , with a cry of rapture .

[Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot was stirred and touched , but differently . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot had odd sensations — presently to be described .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , being old , was of a closer , more impermeable texture , and offered more resistance ; but [she]83-mrs. fisher too had odd sensations , also in [their]1568-their place to be described .

[Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , already amply acquainted with [beautiful houses]1569-beautiful houses and climates , to whom [they]1568-their could not come quite with the same surprise , yet was very nearly as quick to react as [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins . [The place]428-the place had an almost instantaneous influence on [her]82-lady caroline as well , and of one part of this influence [she]82-lady caroline was aware : it had made [her]82-lady caroline , beginning on the very first evening , want to think , and acted on [her]82-lady caroline curiously like a conscience . What this conscience seemed to press upon [her]82-lady caroline notice with an insistence that startled [her]82-lady caroline — [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline hesitated to accept the word , but it would keep on coming into [her]82-lady caroline head — was that [she]82-lady caroline was tawdry .

[Tawdry]143-tawdry . [She]82-lady caroline . [Fancy]144-fancy .

[She]82-lady caroline must think that out .

The morning after the first dinner together , [she]82-lady caroline woke up in a condition of regret that [she]82-lady caroline should have been so talkative to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins the night before . What had made [her]82-lady caroline be , [she]82-lady caroline wondered . Now , of course , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins would want to grab , [she]64-mrs. wilkins would want to be inseparable ; and the thought of a grabbing and an inseparableness that should last four weeks made [Scrap]115-scrap ’s spirit swoon within [her]115-scrap . No doubt [the encouraged Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins would be lurking in [the top garden]1097-the top garden waiting to waylay [her]82-lady caroline when [she]82-lady caroline went out , and would hail [her]82-lady caroline with morning cheerfulness . How much [she]82-lady caroline hated being hailed with morning cheerfulness — or indeed , hailed at all . [She]82-lady caroline ought n’t to have encouraged [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins the night before . [Fatal]145-fatal to encourage . It was bad enough not to encourage , for just sitting there and saying nothing seemed usually to involve [her]82-lady caroline , but actively to encourage was suicidal . What on earth had made [her]82-lady caroline ? Now [she]82-lady caroline would have to waste all the precious time , the precious , lovely time for thinking in , for getting square with [herself]82-lady caroline , in shaking [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins off .

With great caution and on the tips of [her]82-lady caroline toes , balancing [herself]82-lady caroline carefully lest the pebbles should scrunch , [she]82-lady caroline stole out when [she]82-lady caroline was dressed to [her]82-lady caroline corner ; but [the garden]519-the garden was empty . No shaking off was necessary . Neither [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins nor [anybody else]1573-anybody else was to be seen . [She]82-lady caroline had it entirely to [herself]82-lady caroline . Except for [Domenico]96-domenico , who presently came and hovered , watering [his]96-domenico plants , again especially all the plants that were nearest [her]82-lady caroline , [no one]310-no one came out at all ; and when , after a long while of following up thoughts which seemed to escape [her]82-lady caroline just as [she]82-lady caroline had got them , and dropping off exhausted to sleep in the intervals of this chase , [she]82-lady caroline felt hungry and looked at [her]82-lady caroline watch and saw that it was past three , [she]82-lady caroline realised that [nobody]231-nobody had even bothered to call [her]82-lady caroline in to lunch . So that , [Scrap]115-scrap could not but remark , if [any one]2719-any one was shaken off it was [she]115-scrap [herself]115-scrap .

Well , but how delightful , and how very new . Now [she]115-scrap would really be able to think , uninterruptedly . Delicious to be forgotten .

Still , [she]82-lady caroline was hungry ; and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , after that excessive friendliness the night before , might at least have told [her]82-lady caroline lunch was ready . And [she]64-mrs. wilkins had really been excessively friendly — so nice about [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins ’s sleeping arrangements , wanting [him]96-domenico to have [the spare - room]1577-the spare - room and all . [She]64-mrs. wilkins was n’t usually interested in arrangements , in fact [she]64-mrs. wilkins was n’t ever interested in them ; so that [Scrap]115-scrap considered [she]82-lady caroline might be said almost to have gone out of [her]82-lady caroline way to be agreeable to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins . And , in return , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins did n’t even bother whether or not [she]64-mrs. wilkins had any lunch .

Fortunately , though [she]64-mrs. wilkins was hungry , [she]64-mrs. wilkins did n’t mind missing a meal . Life was full of meals . [They]1578-they took up an enormous proportion of [one]235-one ’s time ; and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was , [she]83-mrs. fisher was afraid , one of [those persons who at meals]1580-those persons who at meals linger . Twice now had [she]83-mrs. fisher dined with [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , and each time [she]83-mrs. fisher had been difficult at the end to dislodge , lingering on slowly cracking innumerable nuts and slowly drinking a glass of wine that seemed as if it would never be finished . Probably it would be a good thing to make a habit of missing lunch , and as it was quite easy to have tea brought out to [her]83-mrs. fisher , and as [she]83-mrs. fisher breakfasted in [[her]83-mrs. fisher room]727-her room , only once a day would [she]83-mrs. fisher have to sit at the dining - room table and endure the nuts .

[Scrap]115-scrap burrowed [her]115-scrap head comfortably in the cushions , and with [her]115-scrap feet crossed on the low parapet gave [herself]115-scrap up to more thought . [She]115-scrap said to [herself]115-scrap , as [she]115-scrap had said at intervals throughout the morning : Now [I]0-i ’m going to think . But , never having thought out anything in [her]115-scrap life , it was difficult . Extraordinary how [one]235-one ’s attention would n’t stay fixed ; extraordinary how [one]235-one ’s mind slipped sideways . Settling [herself]115-scrap down to a review of [her]115-scrap past as a preliminary to the consideration of [her]115-scrap future , and hunting in it to begin with for any justification of that distressing word tawdry , the next thing [she]115-scrap knew was that [she]115-scrap was n’t thinking about this at all , but had somehow switched on to [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins .

Well , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins was quite easy to think about , though not pleasant . [She]115-scrap viewed [his]65-mr. wilkins approach with misgivings . For not only was it a profound and unexpected bore to have [a man added to the party]1584-a man added to the party , and [a man]662-a man , too , of the kind [she]115-scrap was sure [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins must be , but [she]115-scrap was afraid — and [her]115-scrap fear was the result of a drearily unvarying experience — that [he]65-mr. wilkins might wish to hang about [her]115-scrap .

This possibility had evidently not yet occurred to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , and it was not one to which [she]115-scrap could very well draw [her]115-scrap attention ; not , that is , without being too fatuous to live . [She]115-scrap tried to hope that [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins would be a wonderful exception to the dreadful rule . If only [he]65-mr. wilkins were , [she]115-scrap would be so much obliged to [him]65-mr. wilkins that [she]115-scrap believed [she]115-scrap might really quite like [him]65-mr. wilkins .

But — [she]115-scrap had misgivings . Suppose [he]65-mr. wilkins hung about [her]115-scrap so that [she]115-scrap was driven from [[her]115-scrap lovely top garden]1586-her lovely top garden ; suppose the light in [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s funny , flickering face was blown out . [Scrap]115-scrap felt [she]115-scrap would particularly dislike this to happen to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s face , yet [she]115-scrap had never in [her]115-scrap life met [any wives]1587-any wives , not any at all , who had been able to understand that [she]115-scrap did n’t in the least want [[their]1587-any wives husbands]582-their husbands . Often [she]115-scrap had met wives who did n’t want [[their]1587-any wives husbands]582-their husbands either , but that made [them]1587-any wives none the less indignant if [they]1587-any wives thought [somebody else]2808-somebody else did , and none the less sure , when [they]1587-any wives saw [them]1587-any wives hanging round [Scrap]115-scrap , that [she]115-scrap was trying to get [them]1587-any wives . Trying to get [them]1587-any wives ! The bare thought , the bare recollection of these situations , filled [her]115-scrap with a boredom so extreme that it instantly sent [her]115-scrap to sleep again .

When [she]115-scrap woke up [she]115-scrap went on with [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins .

Now if , thought [Scrap]115-scrap , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins were not an exception and behaved in the usual way , would [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins understand , or would it just simply spoil [her]64-mrs. wilkins holiday ? [She]64-mrs. wilkins seemed quick , but would [she]64-mrs. wilkins be quick about just this ? [She]64-mrs. wilkins seemed to understand and see inside one , but would [she]64-mrs. wilkins understand and see inside one when it came to [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ?

[The experienced Scrap]115-scrap was full of doubts . [She]64-mrs. wilkins shifted [her]64-mrs. wilkins feet on the parapet ; [she]64-mrs. wilkins jerked a cushion straight . Perhaps [she]64-mrs. wilkins had better try and explain to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , during the days still remaining before the arrival — explain in a general way , rather vague and talking at large — [her]64-mrs. wilkins attitude towards such things . [She]64-mrs. wilkins might also expound to [her]115-scrap [her]64-mrs. wilkins peculiar dislike of [[people]278-people ’s husbands]1592-people ’s husbands , and [her]64-mrs. wilkins profound craving to be , at least for this one month , let alone .

But [Scrap]115-scrap had [her]115-scrap doubts about this too . Such talk meant a certain familiarity , meant embarking on a friendship with [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ; and if , after having embarked on it and faced the peril it contained of too much [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins should turn out to be artful — and [people]278-people did get very artful when [they]278-people were set on anything — and manage after all to slip through into [the top garden]1097-the top garden , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins might easily believe [she]64-mrs. wilkins had been taken in , and that [she]64-mrs. wilkins , [Scrap]115-scrap , was deceitful . Deceitful ! And about [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins . [Wives]248-wives were really pathetic .

At half - past four [she]115-scrap heard sounds of saucers on the other side of the daphne bushes . Was tea being sent out to [her]115-scrap ?

No ; the sounds came no closer , [they]1596-they stopped near [the house]410-the house . Tea was to be in [the garden]519-the garden , in [[her]64-mrs. wilkins garden]1599-her garden . [Scrap]115-scrap considered [she]115-scrap might at least have been asked if [she]115-scrap minded being disturbed . [They]1600-they all knew [she]115-scrap sat there .

Perhaps [some one]1601-some one would bring hers to [her]115-scrap in [[her]115-scrap corner]1602-her corner .

No ; [nobody]231-nobody brought anything .

Well , [she]115-scrap was too hungry not to go and have it with [the others]822-the others to - day , but [she]115-scrap would give [Francesca]106-francesca strict orders for the future .

[She]115-scrap got up , and walked with that slow grace which was another of [her]115-scrap outrageous number of attractions towards the sounds of tea . [She]115-scrap was conscious not only of being very hungry but of wanting to talk to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins again . [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins had not grabbed , [she]64-mrs. wilkins had left [her]115-scrap quite free all day in spite of the rapprochement the night before . Of course [she]115-scrap was [an original]1605-an original , and put on a silk jumper for dinner , but [she]115-scrap had n’t grabbed . This was a great thing . [Scrap]115-scrap went towards the tea - table quite looking forward to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ; and when [she]115-scrap came in sight of it [she]115-scrap saw only [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was pouring out the tea , and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot was offering [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher macaroons . Every time [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher offered [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot anything — [her]83-mrs. fisher cup , or milk , or sugar — [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot offered [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot macaroons — pressed them on [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot with an odd assiduousness , almost with obstinacy . Was it a game ? [Scrap]115-scrap wondered , sitting down and seizing a macaroon .

“ Where is [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ? ”[115-scrap] asked [Scrap]115-scrap .

[They]1606-they did not know . At least , [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , on [Scrap]115-scrap ’s inquiry , did not know ; [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s face , at the name , became elaborately uninterested .

It appeared that [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins had not been seen since breakfast . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot thought [she]64-mrs. wilkins had probably gone for a picnic . [Scrap]115-scrap missed [her]64-mrs. wilkins . [She]115-scrap ate the enormous macaroons , the best and biggest [she]115-scrap had ever come across , in silence . Tea without [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was dull ; and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot had that fatal flavour of motherliness about [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot , of wanting to pet one , to make one very comfortable , coaxing one to eat — coaxing [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot , who was already so frankly , so even excessively , eating — that seemed to have dogged [Scrap]115-scrap ’s steps through life . Could n’t [people]278-people leave one alone ? [She]115-scrap was perfectly able to eat what [she]115-scrap wanted unincited . [She]115-scrap tried to quench [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’s zeal by being short with [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot . Useless . The shortness was not apparent . It remained , as all [Scrap]115-scrap ’s evil feelings remained , covered up by the impenetrable veil of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot loveliness .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher sat monumentally , and took no notice of [either of [them]1609-them]1608-either of them . [She]83-mrs. fisher had had a curious day , and was a little worried . [She]83-mrs. fisher had been quite alone , for [none of [the three]1147-the three]1610-none of the three had come to lunch , and [none of [them]1147-the three]1313-none of them had taken the trouble to let [her]83-mrs. fisher know [they]1147-the three were not coming ; and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , drifting casually into tea , had behaved oddly till [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline joined [them]1609-them and distracted [her]83-mrs. fisher attention .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was prepared not to dislike [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , whose parted hair and mild expression seemed very decent and womanly , but [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot certainly had habits that were difficult to like . [Her]83-mrs. fisher habit of instantly echoing any offer made [her]83-mrs. fisher of food or drink , of throwing the offer back on one , as it were , was not somehow what [one]235-one expected of [her]83-mrs. fisher . “ Will [you]83-mrs. fisher have some more tea ? ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] was surely a question to which the answer was simply yes or no ; but [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot persisted in the trick [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had exhibited the day before at breakfast , of adding to [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot yes or no the words , “ Will [you]83-mrs. fisher ? ”[67-mrs. arbuthnot] [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot had done it again that morning at breakfast and here [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was doing it at tea — the two meals at which [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher presided and poured out . Why did [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot do it ? [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher failed to understand .

But this was not what was worrying [her]83-mrs. fisher ; this was merely by the way . What was worrying [her]83-mrs. fisher was that [she]83-mrs. fisher had been quite unable that day to settle to anything , and had done nothing but wander restlessly from [[her]83-mrs. fisher sitting - room]997-her sitting - room to [her]83-mrs. fisher battlements and back again . It had been a wasted day , and how much [she]83-mrs. fisher disliked waste . [She]83-mrs. fisher had tried to read , and [she]83-mrs. fisher had tried to write to [Kate Lumley]137-kate ; but no — a few words read , a few lines written , and up [she]83-mrs. fisher got again and went out on to the battlements and stared at [the sea]2735-the sea .

It did not matter that the letter to [Kate Lumley]137-kate should not be written . There was time enough for that . Let [the others]822-the others suppose [her]83-mrs. fisher coming was definitely fixed . All the better . So would [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins be kept out of [the spare - room]1577-the spare - room and put where [he]65-mr. wilkins belonged . [Kate]137-kate would keep . [She]137-kate could be held in reserve . [Kate]137-kate in [reserve]1618-reserve was just as potent as [Kate]137-kate in actuality , and there were points about [Kate]137-kate in reserve which might be missing from [Kate]137-kate in actuality . For instance , if [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher were going to be restless , [she]83-mrs. fisher would rather [Kate]137-kate were not there to see . There was a want of dignity about restlessness , about trotting backwards and forwards . But it did matter that [she]83-mrs. fisher could not read a sentence of any of [[her]83-mrs. fisher great dead friends]1619-her great dead friends ’ writings ; no , not even of [Browning]108-browning ’s , who had been so much in [Italy]13-italy , nor of [Ruskin]107-ruskin ’s , whose Stones of [Venice]44-venice [she]83-mrs. fisher had brought with [her]83-mrs. fisher to re - read so nearly on the very spot ; nor even a sentence of a really interesting book like the one [she]83-mrs. fisher had found in [[her]83-mrs. fisher sitting - room]997-her sitting - room about the home life of [the German Emperor]1621-the german emperor , [poor man]1622-poor man — written in the nineties , when [he]1622-poor man had not yet begun to be more sinned against than sinning , which was , [she]83-mrs. fisher was firmly convinced , what was the matter with [him]1622-poor man now , and full of exciting things about [his]1622-poor man birth and [his]1622-poor man right arm and accoucheurs — without having to put it down and go and stare at [the sea]2735-the sea .

Reading was very important ; the proper exercise and development of [one]235-one ’s mind was a paramount duty . How could [one]235-one read if [one]235-one were constantly trotting in and out ? Curious , this restlessness . Was [she]83-mrs. fisher going to be ill ? No , [she]83-mrs. fisher felt well ; indeed , unusually well , and [she]83-mrs. fisher went in and out quite quickly — trotted , in fact — and without [her]83-mrs. fisher stick . Very odd that [she]83-mrs. fisher should n’t be able to sit still , [she]83-mrs. fisher thought , frowning across the tops of some purple hyacinths at [the Gulf of [Spezia]45-spezia glittering beyond [a headland]1628-a headland]1627-the gulf of spezia glittering beyond a headland ; very odd that [she]83-mrs. fisher , who walked so slowly , with such dependence on [her]83-mrs. fisher stick , should suddenly trot .

It would be interesting to talk to [some one]1601-some one about it , [she]83-mrs. fisher felt . Not to [Kate]137-kate — to [a stranger]467-a stranger . [Kate]137-kate would only look at [her]137-kate and suggest a cup of tea . [Kate]137-kate always suggested cups of tea . Besides , [Kate]137-kate had a flat face . That [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , now — annoying as [she]64-mrs. wilkins was , loose - tongued as [she]64-mrs. wilkins was , impertinent , objectionable , would probably understand , and perhaps know what was making [her]64-mrs. wilkins be like this . But [she]137-kate could say nothing to [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins . [She]64-mrs. wilkins was [the last person to whom one would admit sensations]1631-the last person to whom one would admit sensations . [Dignity]146-dignity alone forbade it . Confide in [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ? Never .

And [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , while [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot wistfully mothered the obstructive Scrap at tea , felt too that [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had had a curious day . Like [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s , it had been active , but , unlike [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s , only active in mind . [Her]67-mrs. arbuthnot body had been quite still ; [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot mind had not been still at all , it had been excessively active . For years [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had taken care to have no time to think . [Her]67-mrs. arbuthnot scheduled life in [the parish]379-the parish had prevented memories and desires from intruding on [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot . That day [they]1633-they had crowded . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot went back to tea feeling dejected , and that [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot should feel dejected in such a place with everything about [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot to make [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot rejoice , only dejected [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot the more . But how could [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot rejoice alone ? How could [anybody]202-anybody rejoice and enjoy and appreciate , really appreciate , alone ? Except [Lotty]149-lotty . [Lotty]149-lotty seemed able to . [She]149-lotty had gone off down [the hill]1635-the hill directly after breakfast , alone yet obviously rejoicing , for [she]149-lotty had not suggested that [Rose]103-rose should go too , and [she]149-lotty was singing as [she]149-lotty went .

[Rose]103-rose had spent the day by [herself]103-rose , sitting with [her]103-rose hands clasping [her]103-rose knees , staring straight in front of [her]103-rose . What [she]103-rose was staring at were the grey swords of the agaves , and , on their tall stalks , the pale irises that grew in [the remote place [she]103-rose had found]1636-the remote place she had found , while beyond them , between the grey leaves and the blue flowers , [she]103-rose saw [the sea]2735-the sea . [The place [she]103-rose had found]1638-the place she had found was a hidden corner where the sun - baked stones were padded with thyme , and [nobody]231-nobody was likely to come . [It]1638-the place she had found was out of sight and sound of [the house]410-the house ; [it]1638-the place she had found was off any path ; [it]1638-the place she had found was near [the end of [the promontory]1642-the promontory]1641-the end of the promontory . [She]103-rose sat so quiet that presently lizards darted over [her]103-rose feet , and some tiny birds like finches , frightened away at first , came back again and flitted among the bushes round [her]103-rose just as if [she]103-rose had n’t been [there]296-there . How beautiful it was . And what was the good of it with [no one there]1644-no one there , [no one who loved being with one]1645-no one who loved being with one , who belonged to one , to whom [one]235-one could say , “ Look . ”[235-one] And would n’t [one]235-one say , “ Look — dearest ? ”[235-one] Yes , [one]235-one would say dearest and the sweet word , just to say it to [somebody who loved one]1649-somebody who loved one , would make [one happy]1650-one happy .

[She]103-rose sat quite still , staring straight in front of [her]103-rose . Strange that in [this place]2843-this place [she]103-rose did not want to pray . [[She]103-rose who had prayed so constantly at [home]222-home]1652-she who had prayed so constantly at home did n’t seem able to do it here at all . The first morning [she]103-rose had merely thrown up a brief thank you to heaven on getting out of bed , and had gone straight to the window to see what everything looked like — thrown up the thank you as carelessly as a ball , and thought no more about it . That morning , remembering this and ashamed , [she]103-rose had knelt down with determination ; but perhaps determination was bad for prayers , for [she]103-rose had been unable to think of a thing to say . And as for [her]103-rose bedtime prayers , on neither of the nights had [she]103-rose said a single one . [She]103-rose had forgotten them . [She]103-rose had been so much absorbed in other thoughts that [she]103-rose had forgotten them ; and , once in bed , [she]103-rose was asleep and whirling along among bright , thin swift dreams before [she]103-rose had so much time as to stretch [herself]103-rose out .

What had come over [her]103-rose ? Why had [she]103-rose let go the anchor of prayer ? And [she]103-rose had difficulty , too , in remembering [her]103-rose poor , in remembering even that there were such things as poor . Holidays , of course , were good , and were recognised by [everybody]2701-everybody as good , but ought [they]1655-they so completely to blot out , to make such havoc of , the realities ? Perhaps it was healthy to forget [her]103-rose poor ; with all the greater gusto would [she]103-rose go back to [them]1656-them . But it could n’t be healthy to forget [her]103-rose prayers , and still less could it be healthy not to mind .

[Rose]103-rose did not mind . [She]103-rose knew [she]103-rose did not mind . And , even worse , [she]103-rose knew [she]103-rose did not mind not minding . In [this place]2843-this place [she]103-rose was indifferent to both the things that had filled [her]103-rose life and made it seem as if it were happy for years . Well , if only [she]103-rose could rejoice in [her]103-rose wonderful new surroundings , have that much at least to set against the indifference , the letting go — but [she]103-rose could not . [She]103-rose had no work ; [she]103-rose did not pray ; [she]103-rose was left empty .

[Lotty]149-lotty had spoilt [her]149-lotty day that day , as [she]149-lotty had spoilt [her]149-lotty day the day before — [Lotty]149-lotty , with [her]149-lotty invitation to [[her]149-lotty husband]204-her husband , with [her]149-lotty suggestion that [she]149-lotty too should invite [hers]149-lotty . Having flung [Frederick]75-frederick into [her]149-lotty mind again the day before , [Lotty]149-lotty had left [her]149-lotty ; for the whole afternoon [she]149-lotty had left [her]149-lotty alone with [her]149-lotty thoughts . Since then [they]1659-they had been all of [Frederick]75-frederick . Where at Hampstead [he]75-frederick came to [her]149-lotty only in [her]149-lotty dreams , here [he]75-frederick left [her]149-lotty dreams free and was with [her]149-lotty during the day instead . And again that morning , as [she]149-lotty was struggling not to think of [him]75-frederick , [Lotty]149-lotty had asked [her]149-lotty , just before disappearing singing down [the path]704-the path , if [she]149-lotty had written yet and invited [him]75-frederick , and again [he]75-frederick was flung into [her]149-lotty mind and [she]149-lotty was n’t able to get [him]75-frederick out .

How could [she]149-lotty invite [him]75-frederick ? It had gone on so long , [their]1661-their estrangement , such years ; [she]149-lotty would hardly know what words to use ; and besides , [he]75-frederick would not come . Why should [he]75-frederick come ? [He]75-frederick did n’t care about being with [her]149-lotty . What could [they]1661-their talk about ? Between [them]1661-their was the barrier of [his]75-frederick work and [her]149-lotty religion . [She]149-lotty could not — how could [she]149-lotty , believing as [she]149-lotty did in purity , in responsibility for the effect of [one]235-one ’s actions on [others]309-others — bear [his]75-frederick work , bear living by it ; and [he]75-frederick , [she]149-lotty knew , had at first resented and then been merely bored by [her]149-lotty religion . [He]75-frederick had let [her]149-lotty slip away ; [he]75-frederick had given [her]149-lotty up ; [he]75-frederick no longer minded ; [he]75-frederick accepted [her]149-lotty religion indifferently , as a settled fact . Both it and [she]149-lotty — [Rose]103-rose ’s mind , becoming more luminous in the clear light of [April]99-april at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , suddenly saw the truth — bored [him]75-frederick .

Naturally when [she]149-lotty saw this , when that morning it flashed upon [her]149-lotty for the first time , [she]149-lotty did not like it ; [she]149-lotty liked it so little that for a space the whole beauty of [Italy]13-italy was blotted out . What was to be done about it ? [She]149-lotty could not give up believing in good and not liking evil , and it must be evil to live entirely on the proceeds of [adulteries]1664-adulteries , however dead and distinguished [they]1664-adulteries were . Besides , if [she]149-lotty did , if [she]149-lotty sacrificed [her]149-lotty whole past , [her]149-lotty bringing up , [her]149-lotty work for the last ten years , would [she]149-lotty bore [him]75-frederick less ? [Rose]103-rose felt right down at [her]103-rose very roots that if [you]1665-you have once thoroughly bored [somebody]996-somebody it is next to impossible to unbore [him]75-frederick . Once a bore always a bore — certainly , [she]149-lotty thought , to [the person originally bored]1667-the person originally bored .

Then , thought [she]149-lotty , looking out to [sea]1668-sea through eyes grown misty , better cling to [her]149-lotty religion . It was better — [she]149-lotty hardly noticed the reprehensibleness of [her]149-lotty thought — than nothing . But oh , [she]149-lotty wanted to cling to something tangible , to love something living , something that [one]235-one could hold against [one]235-one ’s heart , that [one]235-one could see and touch and do things for . If [[her]149-lotty poor baby]1672-her poor baby had n’t died . . . [babies]1673-babies did n’t get bored with one , it took [them]1673-babies a long while to grow up and find one out . And perhaps [one ’s baby]1674-one ’s baby never did find one out ; perhaps [one]235-one would always be to it , however old and bearded it grew , [somebody special]1676-somebody special , somebody different from [every one else]1677-every one else , and if for no other reason , precious in that one could never be repeated .

Sitting with dim eyes looking out to [sea]1668-sea [she]149-lotty felt an extraordinary yearning to hold something of [her]149-lotty very own tight to [her]149-lotty bosom . [Rose]103-rose was slender , and as reserved in figure as in character , yet [she]149-lotty felt a queer sensation of — how could [she]149-lotty describe it?—bosom . There was something about [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore that made [her]149-lotty feel all bosom . [She]149-lotty wanted to gather to [her]149-lotty bosom , to comfort and protect , soothing the dear head that should lie on it with softest strokings and murmurs of love . [Frederick]75-frederick , [[Frederick]75-frederick ’s child]1679-frederick ’s child — come to [her]149-lotty , pillowed on [her]149-lotty , because [they]1680-they were unhappy , because [they]1680-they had been hurt . . . [They]1680-they would need [her]149-lotty then , if [they]1680-they had been hurt ; [they]1680-they would let [themselves]1680-they be loved then , if [they]1680-they were unhappy .

Well , [the child]1681-the child was gone , would never come now ; but perhaps [Frederick]75-frederick — some day — when [he]75-frederick was old and tired . . .

Such were [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot ’s reflections and emotions that first day at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore by [herself]67-mrs. arbuthnot . [She]67-mrs. arbuthnot went back to tea dejected as [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot had not been for years . [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore had taken [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot carefully built - up semblance of happiness away from [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot , and given [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot nothing in exchange . Yes — it had given [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot yearnings in exchange , this ache and longing , this queer feeling of bosom ; but that was worse than nothing . And [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot who had learned balance , who never at [home]222-home was irritated but always able to be kind , could not , even in [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot dejection , that afternoon endure [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s assumption of the position as [hostess at tea]1683-hostess at tea .

[One]235-one would have supposed that such a little thing would not have touched [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot , but it did . Was [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot nature changing ? Was [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot to be not only thrown back on long - stifled yearnings after [Frederick]75-frederick , but also turned into [somebody who wanted to fight over little things]1685-somebody who wanted to fight over little things ? After tea , when both [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher and [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline had disappeared again — it was quite evident that [nobody]231-nobody wanted [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot — [she]67-mrs. arbuthnot was more dejected than ever , overwhelmed by the discrepancy between the splendour outside [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot , the warm , teeming beauty and self - sufficiency of nature , and the blank emptiness of [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot heart .

Then came [Lotty]149-lotty , back to dinner , incredibly more freckled , exuding the sunshine [she]149-lotty had been collecting all day , talking , laughing , being tactless , being unwise , being without reticence ; and [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , so quiet at tea , woke up to animation , and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was not so noticeable , and [Rose]103-rose was beginning to revive a little , for [Lotty]149-lotty ’s spirits were contagious as [she]149-lotty described the delights of [her]149-lotty day , a day which might easily to [any one else have had nothing in it but a very long and very hot walk and sandwiches]1687-any one else have had nothing in it but a very long and very hot walk and sandwiches , when [she]149-lotty suddenly said catching [Rose]103-rose ’s eye , “ Letter gone ? ”[149-lotty]

[Rose]103-rose flushed . This tactlessness . . .

“ What letter ? ”[115-scrap] asked [Scrap]115-scrap , interested . Both [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot elbows were on the table and [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot chin was supported in [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot hands , for the nut - stage had been reached , and there was nothing for it but to wait in as comfortable as position as possible till [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had finished cracking .

“ Asking [[her]83-mrs. fisher husband]204-her husband here , ”[149-lotty] said [Lotty]149-lotty .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher looked up . [Another husband]1688-another husband ? Was there to be no end to [them]1689-them ? Nor was [this one]861-this one , then , [a widow]447-a widow either ; but [[her]83-mrs. fisher husband]204-her husband was no doubt [a decent , respectable man , following a decent , respectable calling]1693-a decent , respectable man , following a decent , respectable calling . [She]83-mrs. fisher had little hope of [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ; so little , that [she]83-mrs. fisher had refrained from inquiring what [he]65-mr. wilkins did .

“ Has it ? ”[149-lotty] persisted [Lotty]149-lotty , as [Rose]103-rose said nothing .

“ No , ”[103-rose] said [Rose]103-rose .

“ Oh , well — to - morrow then , ”[149-lotty] said [Lotty]149-lotty .

[Rose]103-rose wanted to say No again to this . [Lotty]149-lotty would have in [her]149-lotty place , and would , besides , have expounded all [her]149-lotty reasons . But [she]149-lotty could not turn [herself]149-lotty inside out like that and invite any and [everybody]2701-everybody to come and look . How was it that [Lotty]149-lotty , who saw so many things , did n’t see stuck on [her]149-lotty heart , and seeing keep quiet about it , the sore place that was [Frederick]75-frederick ?

“ Who is [[your]83-mrs. fisher husband]2730-your husband ? ”[83-mrs. fisher] asked [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , carefully adjusting another nut between the crackers .

“ Who should [he]2730-your husband be , ”[103-rose] said [Rose]103-rose quickly , roused at once by [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher to irritation , “ except [Mr. Arbuthnot]147-mr. arbuthnot ? ”[103-rose]

“ [I]83-mrs. fisher mean , of course , what is [Mr. Arbuthnot]147-mr. arbuthnot ? ”[83-mrs. fisher]

And [Rose]103-rose , gone painfully red at this , said after a tiny pause , “ [[My]103-rose husband]2697-my husband . ”[103-rose]

Naturally , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was incensed . [She]83-mrs. fisher could n’t have believed it of [this one]861-this one , with [her]83-mrs. fisher decent hair and gentle voice , that [she]83-mrs. fisher too should be impertinent .

Chapter 14

That first week the wistaria began to fade , and the flowers of the Judas - tree and peach - trees fell off and carpeted the ground with rose - colour . Then all the freesias disappeared , and the irises grew scarce . And then , while these were clearing [themselves]1696-themselves away , the double banksia roses came out , and the big summer roses suddenly flaunted gorgeously on the walls and trellises . [Fortune]148-fortune ’s Yellow was one of them ; a very beautiful rose . Presently [the tamarisk and the daphnes]1697-the tamarisk and the daphnes were at [their]1697-the tamarisk and the daphnes best , and the lilies at [their]1697-the tamarisk and the daphnes tallest . By the end of the week the fig - trees were giving shade , the plum - blossom was out among the olives , [the modest weigelias]1698-the modest weigelias appeared in [their]1698-the modest weigelias fresh pink clothes , and on the rocks sprawled masses of thick - leaved , star - shaped flowers , some vivid purple and some a clear , pale lemon .

By the end of the week , too , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins arrived ; even as [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife had foreseen [he]65-mr. wilkins would , so [he]65-mr. wilkins did . And there were signs almost of eagerness about [his]65-mr. wilkins acceptance of [her]244-his wife suggestion , for [he]65-mr. wilkins had not waited to write a letter in answer to [hers]244-his wife , but had telegraphed .

That , surely , was eager . It showed , [Scrap]115-scrap thought , a definite wish for reunion ; and watching [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife ’s happy face , and aware of [her]244-his wife desire that [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins should enjoy [his]65-mr. wilkins holiday , [she]244-his wife told [herself]244-his wife that [he]65-mr. wilkins would be [a very unusual fool]1701-a very unusual fool should [he]65-mr. wilkins waste [his]65-mr. wilkins time bothering about [anybody else]1573-anybody else . “ If [he]65-mr. wilkins is n’t nice to [her]244-his wife , ”[115-scrap] [Scrap]115-scrap thought , “ [he]65-mr. wilkins shall be taken to the battlements and tipped over . ”[115-scrap] For , by the end of the week , [she]244-his wife and [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins had become [Caroline]82-lady caroline and [Lotty]149-lotty to [each other]207-each other , and were [friends]2712-friends .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins had always been [friends]2712-friends , but [Scrap]115-scrap had struggled not to be . [She]244-his wife had tried hard to be cautious , but how difficult was caution with [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ! Free [herself]244-his wife from every vestige of it , [she]244-his wife was so entirely unreserved , so completely expansive , that soon [Scrap]115-scrap , almost before [she]244-his wife knew what [she]244-his wife was doing , was being unreserved too . And [nobody]231-nobody could be more unreserved than [Scrap]115-scrap , once [she]244-his wife let [herself]244-his wife go .

The only difficulty about [Lotty]149-lotty was that [she]149-lotty was nearly always somewhere else . [You]1707-you could n’t catch [her]149-lotty ; [you]1707-you could n’t pin [her]149-lotty down to come and talk . [Scrap]115-scrap ’s fears that [she]149-lotty would grab seemed grotesque in retrospect . Why , there was no grab in [her]149-lotty . At dinner and after dinner were the only times [one]235-one really saw [her]149-lotty . All day long [she]149-lotty was invisible , and would come back in the late afternoon looking a perfect sight , [her]149-lotty hair full of bits of moss , and [her]149-lotty freckles worse than ever . Perhaps [she]149-lotty was making the most of [her]149-lotty time before [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins arrived to do all the things [she]149-lotty wanted to do , and meant to devote [herself]149-lotty afterwards to going about with [him]1709-him , tidy and in [her]149-lotty best clothes .

[Scrap]115-scrap watched [her]149-lotty , interested in spite of [herself]115-scrap , because it seemed so extraordinary to be as happy as all that on so little . [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore was beautiful , and the weather was divine ; but scenery and weather had never been enough for [Scrap]115-scrap , and how could they be enough for somebody who would have to leave [them]1710-them quite soon and go back to life in [Hampstead]3-hampstead ? Also , there was the imminence of [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , of [that [Mellersh]149-lotty from whom [Lotty]149-lotty had so lately run]149-lotty . It was all very well to feel [one]235-one ought to share , and to make [a beau geste]1712-a beau geste and do it , but [the beaux gestes Scrap]115-scrap had known had n’t made [anybody]202-anybody happy . [Nobody]231-nobody really liked being the object of one , and it always meant an effort on the part of [the maker]1715-the maker . Still , [she]115-scrap had to admit there was no effort about [Lotty]149-lotty ; it was quite plain that everything [she]115-scrap did and said was effortless , and that [she]115-scrap was just simply , completely happy .

And so [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was ; for [her]64-mrs. wilkins doubts as to whether [she]64-mrs. wilkins had had time to become steady enough in serenity to go on being serene in [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins ’s company when [she]64-mrs. wilkins had it uninterruptedly right round the clock , had gone by the middle of the week , and [she]64-mrs. wilkins felt that nothing now could shake [her]64-mrs. wilkins . [She]64-mrs. wilkins was ready for anything . [She]64-mrs. wilkins was firmly grafted , rooted , built into heaven . Whatever [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins said or did , [she]64-mrs. wilkins would not budge an inch out of [heaven]2706-heaven , would not rouse [herself]64-mrs. wilkins a single instant to come outside it and be cross . On the contrary , [she]64-mrs. wilkins was going to pull [him]1717-he up into it beside [her]64-mrs. wilkins , and [they]1718-they would sit comfortably together , suffused in light , and laugh at how much afraid of [him]1717-he [she]64-mrs. wilkins used to be in [Hampstead]3-hampstead , and at how deceitful [her]64-mrs. wilkins afraidness had made [her]64-mrs. wilkins . But [he]1717-he would n’t need much pulling . [He]1717-he would come in quite naturally after a day or two , irresistibly wafted on the scented breezes of that divine air ; and there [he]1717-he would sit arrayed in stars , thought [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , in whose mind , among much other débris , floated occasional bright shreds of poetry . [She]64-mrs. wilkins laughed to [herself]64-mrs. wilkins a little at the picture of [Mellersh]64-mrs. wilkins , [that top - hatted , black - coated , respectable family solicitor , arrayed in stars]1719-that top - hatted , black - coated , respectable family solicitor , arrayed in stars , but [she]64-mrs. wilkins laughed affectionately , almost with a maternal pride in how splendid [he]1717-he would look in such fine clothes . “ [Poor lamb]2896-poor lamb , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins murmured to [herself]64-mrs. wilkins affectionately . And added , “ What [he]1717-he wants is a thorough airing . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

This was during the first half of the week . By the beginning of the last half , at the end of which [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins arrived , [she]64-mrs. wilkins left off even assuring [herself]64-mrs. wilkins that [she]64-mrs. wilkins was unshakeable , that [she]64-mrs. wilkins was permeated beyond altering by the atmosphere , [she]64-mrs. wilkins no longer thought of it or noticed it ; [she]64-mrs. wilkins took it for granted . If one may say so , and [she]64-mrs. wilkins certainly said so , not only to [herself]64-mrs. wilkins but also to [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , [she]64-mrs. wilkins had found [her]64-mrs. wilkins celestial legs .

Contrary to [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s idea of the seemly — but of course contrary ; what else would one expect of [Mrs. Wilkins?—she]150-mrs. wilkins?—she did not go to meet [[her]64-mrs. wilkins husband]204-her husband at [Mezzago]32-mezzago , but merely walked down to the point where [Beppo]97-beppo ’s fly would leave [him]204-her husband and [his]204-her husband luggage in [the street of [Castagneto]33-castagneto]1721-the street of castagneto . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher disliked the arrival of [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , and was sure that anybody who could have married [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins must be at least of an injudicious disposition , but [a husband]286-a husband , whatever [his]286-a husband disposition , should be properly met . [Mr. Fisher]90-mr. fisher had always been properly met . Never once in [his]90-mr. fisher married life had [he]90-mr. fisher gone unmet at [a station]1723-a station , nor had [he]90-mr. fisher ever not been seen off . These observances , these courtesies , strengthened the bonds of marriage , and made [the husband]1441-the husband feel [he]1441-the husband could rely on [[his]1441-the husband wife]244-his wife ’s being always there . Always being there was the essential secret for [a wife]1726-a wife . What would have become of [Mr. Fisher]90-mr. fisher if [she]83-mrs. fisher had neglected to act on this principle [she]83-mrs. fisher preferred not to think . Enough things became of [him]90-mr. fisher as it was ; for whatever [one]235-one ’s care in stopping up , married life yet seemed to contain chinks .

But [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins took no pains . [She]64-mrs. wilkins just walked down [the hill]1635-the hill singing — [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher could hear [her]64-mrs. wilkins — and picked up [[her]64-mrs. wilkins husband]204-her husband in [the street]1730-the street as casually as if [he]90-mr. fisher were a pin . [The three others]1731-the three others , still in bed , for it was not nearly time to get up , heard [her]64-mrs. wilkins as [she]64-mrs. wilkins passed beneath [their]1731-the three others windows down [the zigzag path]837-the zigzag path to meet [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , who was coming by [the morning train]1733-the morning train , and [Scrap]115-scrap smiled , and [Rose]103-rose sighed , and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher rang [her]83-mrs. fisher bell and desired [Francesca]106-francesca to bring [her]83-mrs. fisher [her]83-mrs. fisher breakfast in [[her]83-mrs. fisher room]727-her room . [All three]1735-all three had breakfast that day in [[their]1735-all three rooms]1736-their rooms , moved by a common instinct to take cover .

[Scrap]115-scrap always breakfasted in bed , but [she]115-scrap had the same instinct for cover , and during breakfast [she]115-scrap made plans for spending the whole day where [she]115-scrap was . Perhaps , though , it would n’t be as necessary that day as the next . That day , [Scrap]115-scrap calculated , [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins would be provided for . [He]65-mr. wilkins would want to have a bath , and having a bath at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore was an elaborate business , a real adventure if one had a hot one in [the bathroom]1737-the bathroom , and it took a lot of time . It involved the attendance of [the entire staff]1738-the entire staff — [Domenico]96-domenico and [the boy]1739-the boy [Giuseppe]151-giuseppe coaxing the patent stove to burn , restraining it when it burnt too fiercely , using the bellows to it when it threatened to go out , relighting it when it did go out ; [Francesca]106-francesca anxiously hovering over the tap regulating its trickle , because if it were turned on too full the water instantly ran cold , and if not full enough the stove blew up inside and mysteriously flooded [the house]410-the house ; and [Costanza]112-costanza and [Angela]113-angela running up and down bringing pails of hot water from [the kitchen]2806-the kitchen to eke out what the tap did .

[This bath]1742-this bath had been put in lately , and was at once the pride and the terror of [the servants]423-the servants . It was very patent . [Nobody]231-nobody quite understood it . There were long printed instructions as to its right treatment hanging on the wall , in which the word pericoloso recurred . When [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , proceeding on [her]83-mrs. fisher arrival to [the bathroom]1737-the bathroom , saw this word , [she]83-mrs. fisher went back to [[her]83-mrs. fisher room]727-her room again and ordered a sponge - bath instead ; and when [the others]822-the others found what using [the bathroom]1737-the bathroom meant , and how reluctant [the servants]423-the servants were to leave [them]423-the servants alone with the stove , and how [Francesca]106-francesca positively refused to , and stayed with [her]106-francesca back turned watching the tap , and how [the remaining servants]1750-the remaining servants waited anxiously outside the door till [the bather]1751-the bather came safely out again , [they]1750-the remaining servants too had sponge - baths brought into [[their]1750-the remaining servants rooms]1736-their rooms instead .

[Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , however , was [a man]662-a man , and would be sure to want a big bath . Having it , [Scrap]115-scrap calculated , would keep [him]65-mr. wilkins busy for a long while . Then [he]65-mr. wilkins would unpack , and then , after [his]65-mr. wilkins night in [the train]540-the train , [he]65-mr. wilkins would probably sleep till the evening . So would [he]65-mr. wilkins be provided for the whole of that day , and not be let loose on [them]423-the servants till dinner .

Therefore [Scrap]115-scrap came to the conclusion [she]115-scrap would be quite safe in [the garden]519-the garden that day , and got up as usual after breakfast , and dawdled as usual through [her]115-scrap dressing , listening with a slightly cocked ear to the sounds of [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ’s arrival , of [his]65-mr. wilkins luggage being carried into [[Lotty]149-lotty ’s room]1756-lotty ’s room on the other side of [the landing]1757-the landing , of [his]65-mr. wilkins educated voice as [he]65-mr. wilkins inquired of [Lotty]149-lotty , first , “ Do [I]65-mr. wilkins give [this fellow]2978-this fellow anything ? ”[65-mr. wilkins] and immediately afterwards , “ Can [I]149-lotty have a hot bath?”—of[149-lotty] [Lotty]149-lotty ’s voice cheerfully assuring [him]65-mr. wilkins that [he]65-mr. wilkins need n’t give [the fellow]1758-the fellow anything because [he]65-mr. wilkins was [the gardener]2775-the gardener , and that yes , [he]65-mr. wilkins could have a hot bath ; and soon after this [the landing]1757-the landing was filled with the familiar noises of wood being brought , of water being brought , of feet running , of tongues vociferating — in fact , with the preparation of the bath .

[Scrap]115-scrap finished dressing , and then loitered at [her]115-scrap window , waiting till [she]115-scrap should hear [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins go into [the bathroom]1737-the bathroom . When [he]65-mr. wilkins was safely [there]296-there [she]115-scrap would slip out and settle [herself]115-scrap in [[her]115-scrap garden]1599-her garden and resume [her]115-scrap inquiries into the probable meaning of [her]115-scrap life . [She]115-scrap was getting on with [her]115-scrap inquiries . [She]115-scrap dozed much less frequently , and was beginning to be inclined to agree that tawdry was the word to apply to [her]115-scrap past . Also [she]115-scrap was afraid that [her]115-scrap future looked black .

[There]296-there — [she]115-scrap could hear [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ’s educated voice again . [Lotty]149-lotty ’s door had opened , and [he]65-mr. wilkins was coming out of [it]1765-it asking [his]65-mr. wilkins way to [the bathroom]1737-the bathroom .

“ It ’s where [you]115-scrap see [the crowd]2979-the crowd , ”[149-lotty] [Lotty]149-lotty ’s voice answered — still a cheerful voice , [Scrap]115-scrap was glad to notice .

[His]65-mr. wilkins steps went along [the landing]1757-the landing , and [Lotty]149-lotty ’s steps seemed to go [downstairs]1768-downstairs , and then there seemed to be a brief altercation at the bathroom door — hardly so much an altercation as a chorus of vociferations on one side and a wordless determination , [Scrap]115-scrap judged , to have a bath by [oneself]1769-oneself on the other .

[Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins knew no Italian , and the expression pericoloso left [him]65-mr. wilkins precisely as it found [him]65-mr. wilkins — or would have if [he]65-mr. wilkins had seen it , but naturally [he]65-mr. wilkins took no notice of the printed matter on the wall . [He]65-mr. wilkins firmly closed the door on [the servants]423-the servants , resisting [Domenico]96-domenico , who tried to the last to press through , and locked [himself]65-mr. wilkins in as [a man]662-a man should for [his]662-a man bath , judicially considering , as [he]65-mr. wilkins made [his]65-mr. wilkins simple preparations for getting in , the singular standard of behaviour of [these foreigners who , both male and female , apparently wished to stay with [him]65-mr. wilkins while [he]65-mr. wilkins bathed]1772-these foreigners who , both male and female , apparently wished to stay with him while he bathed . In [Finland]46-finland , [he]65-mr. wilkins had heard , [the female natives]1773-the female natives not only were present on such occasions but actually washed [the bath - taking traveller]1774-the bath - taking traveller . [He]65-mr. wilkins had not heard , however , that this was true too of [Italy]13-italy , which somehow seemed much nearer civilisation — perhaps because [one]235-one went [there]296-there , and did not go to [Finland]46-finland .

Impartially examining this reflection , and carefully balancing the claims to civilisation of [Italy]13-italy and [Finland]46-finland , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins got into [the bath]1777-the bath and turned off the tap . Naturally [he]65-mr. wilkins turned off the tap . It was what [one]235-one did . But on the instructions , printed in red letters , was a paragraph saying that the tap should not be turned off as long as there was still fire in the stove . It should be left on — not much on , but on — until the fire was quite out ; otherwise , and here again was the word pericoloso , the stove would blow up .

[Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins got into [the bath]1777-the bath , turned off the tap , and the stove blew up , exactly as the printed instructions said it would . It blew up , fortunately , only in its inside , but it blew up with a terrific noise , and [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins leapt out of [the bath]1777-the bath and rushed to the door , and only the instinct born of years of training made [him]65-mr. wilkins snatch up a towel as [he]65-mr. wilkins rushed .

[Scrap]115-scrap , half - way across [the landing]1757-the landing on [her]115-scrap way out of doors , heard the explosion .

“ Good heavens , ”[115-scrap] [she]115-scrap thought , remembering the instructions , “ there goes [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ! ”[115-scrap]

And [she]115-scrap ran toward the head of [the stairs]1782-the stairs to call [the servants]423-the servants , and as [she]115-scrap ran , out ran [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins clutching [his]65-mr. wilkins towel , and [they]1784-they ran into [each other]207-each other .

“ [That damned bath]2980-that damned bath ! ”[65-mr. wilkins] cried [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , perhaps for the only time in [his]65-mr. wilkins life forgetting [himself]65-mr. wilkins ; but [he]65-mr. wilkins was upset .

Here was an introduction . [Mr Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , imperfectly concealed in [his]65-mr. wilkins towel , [his]65-mr. wilkins shoulders exposed at one end and [his]65-mr. wilkins legs at the other , and [Lady Caroline Dester]82-lady caroline , to meet whom [he]65-mr. wilkins had swallowed all [his]65-mr. wilkins anger with [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife and come out to [Italy]13-italy .

For [Lotty]149-lotty in [her]149-lotty letter had told [him]65-mr. wilkins who was at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore besides [herself]149-lotty and [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , and [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins at once had perceived that this was an opportunity which might never recur . [He]65-mr. wilkins knew all about [the Droitwiches]152-the droitwiches , [their]152-the droitwiches wealth , [their]152-the droitwiches connections , [their]152-the droitwiches place in history , and the power [they]152-the droitwiches had , should [they]152-the droitwiches choose to exert it , of making yet [another solicitor]1787-another solicitor happy by adding [him]1787-another solicitor to those [they]152-the droitwiches already employed . Directly [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife ’s letter reached [him]65-mr. wilkins [he]65-mr. wilkins telegraphed and packed . This was business . [He]65-mr. wilkins was not [a man to lose time when it came to business]1800-a man to lose time when it came to business ; nor was [he]65-mr. wilkins [a man]662-a man to jeopardise a chance by neglecting to be amiable . [He]65-mr. wilkins met [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife perfectly amiably , aware that amiability under such circumstances was wisdom . In [the train]540-the train [he]65-mr. wilkins had selected the words of [his]65-mr. wilkins greeting , going over them with care — some slight expression of [his]65-mr. wilkins gratification in meeting one of whom [he]65-mr. wilkins , in common with [the whole world]203-the whole world , had heard — but of course put delicately , very delicately ; some slight reference to [[her]149-lotty distinguished parents]1806-her distinguished parents and the part [[her]149-lotty family]1807-her family had played in the history of [England]17-england — made , of course , with proper tact ; a sentence or two about [[her]149-lotty eldest brother [Lord Winchcombe]154-lord winchcombe , who had won [his]154-lord winchcombe V.C. in the late war under circumstances which could only cause — [he]65-mr. wilkins might or might not add this — [every Englishman]1809-every englishman ’s heart]1808-her eldest brother lord winchcombe , who had won his v.c. in the late war under circumstances which could only cause — he might or might not add this — every englishman ’s heart to beat higher than ever with pride , and the first steps towards what might well be the turning - point in [his]65-mr. wilkins career would have been taken .

And here [he]65-mr. wilkins was . . . no , it was too terrible , what could be more terrible ? Only a towel on , water running off [his]65-mr. wilkins legs , and that exclamation . [He]65-mr. wilkins knew at once [the lady]1810-the lady was [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline — the minute the exclamation was out [he]65-mr. wilkins knew it . But [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins was reckoning without [Scrap]115-scrap . What perfect tact . [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins could have worshipped [her]1810-the lady . [This exquisite ignoring . Blue blood]1813-this exquisite ignoring . blue blood , of course , coming out .

“ [I]65-mr. wilkins ’m afraid [I]65-mr. wilkins used unpardonable language , ”[65-mr. wilkins] began [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins very earnestly , as earnestly and ceremoniously as if [he]65-mr. wilkins had had [his]65-mr. wilkins clothes on .
