[Scrap]115-scrap melted away down into [the garden]519-the garden .

Chapter 15

The strange effect of this incident was that when [they]1836-they met that evening at dinner both [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher and [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline had a singular feeling of secret understanding with [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins . [He]65-mr. wilkins could not be to [them]1836-they as [other men]1837-other men . [He]65-mr. wilkins could not be to [them]1836-they as [he]65-mr. wilkins would have been if [they]1836-they had met [him]65-mr. wilkins in [his]65-mr. wilkins clothes . There was a sense of broken ice ; [they]1836-they felt at once intimate and indulgent ; almost [they]1836-they felt to [him]65-mr. wilkins as [nurses]1838-nurses do — as [those feel who have assisted either [patients]1840-patients or [young children]1841-young children at [their]1839-those feel who have assisted either patients or young children at their baths baths]1839-those feel who have assisted either patients or young children at their baths . [They]1836-they were acquainted with [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ’s legs .

What [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher said to [him]65-mr. wilkins that morning in [her]83-mrs. fisher first shock will never be known , but what [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins said to [her]83-mrs. fisher in reply , when reminded by what [she]83-mrs. fisher was saying of [his]65-mr. wilkins condition , was so handsome in its apology , so proper in its confusion , that [she]83-mrs. fisher had ended by being quite sorry for [him]65-mr. wilkins and completely placated . After all , it was an accident , and [nobody]231-nobody could help [accidents]1843-accidents . And when [she]83-mrs. fisher saw [him]65-mr. wilkins next at dinner , dressed , polished , spotless as to linen and sleek as to hair , [she]83-mrs. fisher felt this singular sensation of a secret understanding with [him]65-mr. wilkins and , added to it , of a kind of almost personal pride in [his]65-mr. wilkins appearance , now that [he]65-mr. wilkins was dressed , which presently extended in some subtle way to an almost personal pride in everything [he]65-mr. wilkins said .

There was no doubt whatever in [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s mind that [a man]662-a man was infinitely preferable as [a companion to [a woman]804-a woman]1845-a companion to a woman . [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ’s presence and conversation at once raised the standard of the dinner - table from that of [a bear garden]1847-a bear garden — yes , [a bear garden]1847-a bear garden — to that of a civilised social gathering . [He]65-mr. wilkins talked as [men]807-men talk , about interesting subjects , and , though most courteous to [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , showed no traces of dissolving into simpers and idiocy whenever [he]65-mr. wilkins addressed [her]82-lady caroline . [He]65-mr. wilkins was , indeed , precisely as courteous to [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher [herself]83-mrs. fisher ; and when for the first time at that table politics were introduced , [he]65-mr. wilkins listened to [her]82-lady caroline with the proper seriousness on [her]82-lady caroline exhibiting a desire to speak , and treated [her]82-lady caroline opinions with the attention [they]1850-they deserved . [He]65-mr. wilkins appeared to think much as [she]82-lady caroline did about [Lloyd George]155-lloyd george , and in regard to literature [he]65-mr. wilkins was equally sound . In fact there was real conversation , and [he]65-mr. wilkins liked nuts . How [he]65-mr. wilkins could have married [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was a mystery .

[Lotty]149-lotty , for [her]149-lotty part , looked on with round eyes . [She]149-lotty had expected [Mellersh]149-lotty to take at least two days before [he]65-mr. wilkins got to this stage , but the San Salvatore spell had worked instantly . It was not only that [he]65-mr. wilkins was pleasant at dinner , for [she]149-lotty had always seen [him]65-mr. wilkins pleasant at dinners with [other people]2716-other people , but [he]65-mr. wilkins had been pleasant all day privately — so pleasant that [he]65-mr. wilkins had complimented [her]149-lotty on [her]149-lotty looks while [she]149-lotty was brushing out [her]149-lotty hair , and kissed [her]149-lotty . Kissed [her]149-lotty ! And it was neither good - morning nor good - night .

Well , this being so , [she]149-lotty would put off telling [him]65-mr. wilkins the truth about [her]149-lotty nest - egg , and about [Rose]103-rose not being [[his]65-mr. wilkins hostess]1852-his hostess after all , till next day . Pity to spoil things . [She]149-lotty had been going to blurt it out as soon as [he]65-mr. wilkins had had a rest , but it did seem a pity to disturb such a very beautiful frame of mind as that of [Mellersh]149-lotty this first day . Let [him]65-mr. wilkins too get more firmly fixed in [heaven]2706-heaven . Once fixed [he]65-mr. wilkins would n’t mind anything .

[Her]149-lotty face sparkled with delight at the instantaneous effect of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore . Even the catastrophe of the bath , of which [she]149-lotty had been told when [she]149-lotty came in from [the garden]519-the garden , had not shaken [him]65-mr. wilkins . Of course all that [he]65-mr. wilkins had needed was a holiday . What a brute [she]149-lotty had been to [him]65-mr. wilkins when [he]65-mr. wilkins wanted to take [her]149-lotty [himself]65-mr. wilkins to [Italy]13-italy . But this arrangement , as it happened , was ever so much better , though not through any merit of [hers]149-lotty . [She]149-lotty talked and laughed gaily , not a shred of fear of [him]65-mr. wilkins left in [her]149-lotty , and even when [she]149-lotty said , struck by [his]65-mr. wilkins spotlessness , that [he]65-mr. wilkins looked so clean that [one]235-one could eat [one]235-one ’s dinner off [him]65-mr. wilkins , and [Scrap]115-scrap laughed , [Mellersh]149-lotty laughed too . [He]65-mr. wilkins would have minded that at [home]222-home , supposing that at [home]222-home [she]149-lotty had had the spirit to say it .

It was a successful evening . [Scrap]115-scrap , whenever [she]149-lotty looked at [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , saw [him]65-mr. wilkins in [his]65-mr. wilkins towel , dripping water , and felt indulgent . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was delighted with [him]65-mr. wilkins . [Rose]103-rose was a dignified hostess in [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ’s eyes , quiet and dignified , and [he]65-mr. wilkins admired the way [she]149-lotty waived [her]149-lotty right to preside at the head of the table — as a graceful compliment , of course , to [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s age . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot was , opined [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , naturally retiring . [She]149-lotty was [the most retiring of [the three ladies]1860-the three ladies]1859-the most retiring of the three ladies . [He]65-mr. wilkins had met [her]149-lotty before dinner alone for a moment in [the drawing - room]1518-the drawing - room , and had expressed in appropriate language [his]65-mr. wilkins sense of [her]149-lotty kindness in wishing [him]65-mr. wilkins to join [her]149-lotty party , and [she]149-lotty had been retiring . Was [she]149-lotty shy ? Probably . [She]149-lotty had blushed , and murmured as if in deprecation , and then [the others]822-the others had come in . At dinner [she]149-lotty talked least . [He]65-mr. wilkins would , of course , become better acquainted with [her]149-lotty during the next few days , and it would be a pleasure , [he]65-mr. wilkins was sure .

Meanwhile [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline was all and more than all [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins had imagined , and had received [his]65-mr. wilkins speeches , worked in skilfully between the courses , graciously ; [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was [the exact old lady [he]65-mr. wilkins had been hoping to come across all [his]65-mr. wilkins professional life]1863-the exact old lady he had been hoping to come across all his professional life ; and [Lotty]149-lotty had not only immensely improved , but was obviously au mieux — [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins knew what was necessary in French — with [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline . [He]65-mr. wilkins had been much tormented during the day by the thought of how [he]65-mr. wilkins had stood conversing with [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline forgetful of [his]65-mr. wilkins not being dressed , and had at last written [her]149-lotty a note most deeply apologising , and beseeching [her]149-lotty to overlook [his]65-mr. wilkins amazing , [his]65-mr. wilkins incomprehensible obliviousness , to which [she]149-lotty had replied in pencil on the back of the envelope , “ Do n’t worry . ”[149-lotty] And [he]65-mr. wilkins had obeyed [her]149-lotty commands , and had put it from [him]65-mr. wilkins . The result was [he]65-mr. wilkins was now in great contentment . Before going to sleep that night [he]65-mr. wilkins pinched [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife ’s ear . [She]149-lotty was amazed . These endearments . . .

What is more , the morning brought no relapse in [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , and [he]65-mr. wilkins kept up to this high level throughout the day , in spite of its being the first day of the second week , and therefore pay day .

[Its]1865-its being pay day precipitated [Lotty]149-lotty ’s confession , which [she]149-lotty had , when it came to the point , been inclined to put off a little longer . [She]149-lotty was not afraid , [she]149-lotty dared anything , but [Mellersh]149-lotty was in such an admirable humour — why risk clouding it just yet ? When , however , soon after breakfast [Costanza]112-costanza appeared with a pile of very dirty little bits of paper covered with sums in pencil , and having knocked at [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s door and been sent away , and at [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline ’s door and been sent away , and at [Rose]103-rose ’s door and had no answer because [Rose]103-rose had gone out , [she]149-lotty waylaid [Lotty]149-lotty , who was showing [Mellersh]149-lotty over [the house]410-the house , and pointed to the bits of paper and talked very rapidly and loud , and shrugged [her]149-lotty shoulders a great deal , and kept on pointing at the bits of paper , [Lotty]149-lotty remembered that a week had passed without [anybody]202-anybody paying anything to [anyone]1868-anyone , and that the moment had come to settle up .

“ Does [this good lady]2984-this good lady want something ? ”[65-mr. wilkins] inquired [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins mellifluously .

“ Money , ”[149-lotty] said [Lotty]149-lotty .

“ Money ? ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ It ’s the housekeeping bills . ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ Well , [you]65-mr. wilkins have nothing to do with those , ”[65-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins serenely .

“ Oh yes , [I]65-mr. wilkins have — ”[65-mr. wilkins]

And the confession was precipitated .

It was wonderful how [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins took it . [One]235-one would have imagined that [his]65-mr. wilkins sole idea about the nest - egg had always been that it should be lavished on just this . [He]65-mr. wilkins did not , as [he]65-mr. wilkins would have done at [home]222-home , cross - examine [her]149-lotty ; [he]65-mr. wilkins accepted everything as it came pouring out , about [her]149-lotty fibs and all , and when [she]149-lotty had finished and said , “ [You]65-mr. wilkins have every right to be angry , [I]65-mr. wilkins think , but [I]65-mr. wilkins hope [you]65-mr. wilkins wo n’t be and will forgive [me]65-mr. wilkins instead , ”[65-mr. wilkins] [he]65-mr. wilkins merely asked , “ What can be more beneficial than such a holiday ? ”[65-mr. wilkins]

Whereupon [she]149-lotty put [her]149-lotty arm through [his]65-mr. wilkins and held it tight and said , “ Oh , [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins , [you]65-mr. wilkins really are too sweet!”—her[149-lotty] face red with pride in [him]65-mr. wilkins .

That [he]65-mr. wilkins should so quickly assimilate the atmosphere , that [he]65-mr. wilkins should at once become nothing but kindness , showed surely what a real affinity [he]65-mr. wilkins had with good and beautiful things . [He]65-mr. wilkins belonged quite naturally in [this place of heavenly calm]1871-this place of heavenly calm . [He]65-mr. wilkins was — extraordinary how [she]149-lotty had misjudged [him]65-mr. wilkins — by nature [a child of light]1872-a child of light . Fancy not minding the dreadful fibs [she]149-lotty had gone in for before leaving [home]222-home ; fancy passing even those over without comment . Wonderful . Yet not wonderful , for was n’t [he]65-mr. wilkins in [heaven]2706-heaven ? In [heaven]2706-heaven [nobody]231-nobody minded any of those done - with things , [one]235-one did n’t even trouble to forgive and forget , [one]235-one was much too happy . [She]149-lotty pressed [his]65-mr. wilkins arm tight in [her]149-lotty gratitude and appreciation ; and though [he]65-mr. wilkins did not withdraw [his]65-mr. wilkins , neither did [he]65-mr. wilkins respond to [her]149-lotty pressure . [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins was of a cool habit , and rarely had any real wish to press .

Meanwhile , [Costanza]112-costanza , perceiving that [she]112-costanza had lost [the Wilkinses]127-the wilkinses ’ ear had gone back to [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , who at least understood Italian , besides being clearly in [the servants]423-the servants ’ eyes the one of [the party marked down by age and appearance to pay the bills]1880-the party marked down by age and appearance to pay the bills ; and to [her]112-costanza , while [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher put the final touches to [her]112-costanza toilette , for [she]112-costanza was preparing , by means of putting on a hat and veil and feather boa and gloves , to go for [her]112-costanza first stroll in [the lower garden]927-the lower garden — positively [her]112-costanza first since [her]112-costanza arrival — [she]112-costanza explained that unless [she]112-costanza was given money to pay the last week ’s bills [the shops of [Castagneto]33-castagneto]1882-the shops of castagneto would refuse credit for the current week ’s food . Not even credit would [they]1882-the shops of castagneto give , affirmed [Costanza]112-costanza , who had been spending a great deal and was anxious to pay all [her]112-costanza relations what was owed [them]1883-them and also to find out how [[her]112-costanza mistresses]1884-her mistresses took it , for that day ’s meals . Soon it would be the hour of colazione , and how could there be colazione without meat , without fish , without eggs , without —

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher took the bills out of [her]83-mrs. fisher hand and looked at the total ; and [she]83-mrs. fisher was so much astonished by its size , so much horrified by the extravagance to which it testified , that [she]83-mrs. fisher sat down at [her]83-mrs. fisher writing - table to go into the thing thoroughly .

[Costanza]112-costanza had a very bad half - hour . [She]112-costanza had not supposed it was in [the English]128-the english to be so mercenary . And then [la Vecchia]156-la vecchia , as [she]112-costanza was called in [the kitchen]2806-the kitchen , knew so much Italian , and with a doggedness that filled [Costanza]112-costanza with shame on [her]112-costanza behalf , for such conduct was the last one expected from [the noble English]128-the english , [she]112-costanza went through item after item , requiring and persisting till [she]112-costanza got them , explanations .

There were no explanations , except that [Costanza]112-costanza had had one glorious week of doing exactly as [she]112-costanza chose , of splendid unbridled licence , and that this was the result .

[Costanza]112-costanza , having no explanations , wept . It was miserable to think [she]112-costanza would have to cook from now on under watchfulness , under suspicion ; and what would [[her]112-costanza relations]1886-her relations say when [they]1886-her relations found the orders [they]1886-her relations received were whittled down ? [They]1886-her relations would say [she]112-costanza had no influence ; [they]1886-her relations would despise [her]112-costanza .

[Costanza]112-costanza wept , but [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was unmoved . In slow and splendid Italian , with the roll of the cantos of the Inferno , [she]83-mrs. fisher informed [her]83-mrs. fisher that [she]83-mrs. fisher would pay no bills till the following week , and that meanwhile the food was to be precisely as good as ever , and at a quarter the cost .

[Costanza]112-costanza threw up [her]112-costanza hands .

Next week , proceeded [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher unmoved , if [she]83-mrs. fisher found this had been so [she]83-mrs. fisher would pay the whole . Otherwise — [she]83-mrs. fisher paused ; for what [she]83-mrs. fisher would do otherwise [she]83-mrs. fisher did not know [herself]83-mrs. fisher . But [she]83-mrs. fisher paused and looked impenetrable , majestic and menacing , and [Costanza]112-costanza was cowed .

Then [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , having dismissed [her]112-costanza with a gesture , went in search of [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline to complain . [She]83-mrs. fisher had been under the impression that [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline ordered the meals and therefore was responsible for the prices , but now it appeared that [the cook]2803-the cook had been left to do exactly as [she]2803-the cook pleased ever since [they]1888-they got [there]296-there , which of course was simply disgraceful .

[Scrap]115-scrap was not in [[her]83-mrs. fisher bedroom]1070-her bedroom , but [the room]219-the room , on [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s opening the door , for [she]83-mrs. fisher suspected [her]83-mrs. fisher of being in [it]219-the room and only pretending not to hear the knock , was still flowerlike from [her]83-mrs. fisher presence .

Even [Mr. Fisher]90-mr. fisher , who had been , [she]83-mrs. fisher should say , [a man originally tenacious of habits]1898-a man originally tenacious of habits , had quite soon after marriage got out of this one .

However , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , snatching off [his]65-mr. wilkins hat on seeing [her]83-mrs. fisher , instantly threw the cigar away . But the cigar did not reach the water . It got caught in the lilies , and smoked on by itself among them , a strange and depraved - looking object .

Was it morning spirits impelling [him]65-mr. wilkins to address [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher in the terms of a nursery rhyme ? [He]65-mr. wilkins felt great respect for [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , and would not for [the world]186-the world have insulted [her]83-mrs. fisher by addressing [her]83-mrs. fisher as [a maid]1901-a maid , pretty or otherwise . [A headstrong old lady]1911-a headstrong old lady . Perhaps not so easy to deal with as [he]65-mr. wilkins had hoped . But how wealthy . “ Of course if [you]83-mrs. fisher choose to throw [your]83-mrs. fisher money about — ”[83-mrs. fisher] [she]83-mrs. fisher said at last , disapproving but immensely relieved , while [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins was rapt in the contemplation of the precious qualities of blue blood . Let [us]2999-us call it a [Collins]159-collins . ”[65-mr. wilkins]

[Scrap]115-scrap smiled , and held out [her]115-scrap cigarette case . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher could not help being mollified . A way out of waste was going to be found , thanks to [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , and [she]83-mrs. fisher hated waste quite as much as having to pay for it ; also a way was found out of housekeeping . For a moment [she]83-mrs. fisher had thought that if [everybody]2701-everybody tried to force [her]83-mrs. fisher into housekeeping on [her]83-mrs. fisher brief holiday by [their]2701-everybody own indifference ( [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline ) , or inability to speak Italian ( the other two ) , [she]83-mrs. fisher would have to send for [Kate Lumley]137-kate after all . But this was much better , this way of [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ’s . Really [a most superior man]1930-a most superior man . But [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins did not go with [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher because of [her]83-mrs. fisher conversation , but because , when [she]83-mrs. fisher got up and [he]65-mr. wilkins got up because [she]83-mrs. fisher got up , intending merely to bow [her]83-mrs. fisher out of the recess , [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline had put [her]82-lady caroline feet up on the parapet again , and arranging [her]82-lady caroline head sideways in the cushions had shut [her]82-lady caroline eyes .

[The daughter of [the Droitwiches]152-the droitwiches]2989-the daughter of the droitwiches desired to go to sleep .

Chapter 16

And so the second week began , and all was harmony . The arrival of [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , instead of , as three of [the party]1940-the party had feared and [the fourth]1941-the fourth had only been protected from fearing by [her]83-mrs. fisher burning faith in the effect on [him]65-mr. wilkins of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , disturbing such harmony as there was , increased it . [He]65-mr. wilkins fitted in . [He]65-mr. wilkins was determined to please , and [he]65-mr. wilkins did please . [He]65-mr. wilkins was most amiable to [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife — not only in public , which [she]244-his wife was used to , but in private , when [he]65-mr. wilkins certainly would n’t have been if [he]65-mr. wilkins had n’t wanted to . [He]65-mr. wilkins did want to . [He]65-mr. wilkins was so much obliged to [her]244-his wife , so much pleased with [her]244-his wife , for making [him]65-mr. wilkins acquainted with [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , that [he]65-mr. wilkins felt really fond of [her]244-his wife . Also proud ; for there must be , [he]65-mr. wilkins reflected , a good deal more in [her]244-his wife than [he]65-mr. wilkins had supposed , for [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline to have become so intimate with [her]244-his wife and so affectionate . And the more [he]65-mr. wilkins treated [her]244-his wife as though [she]244-his wife were really very nice , the more [Lotty]149-lotty expanded and became really very nice , and the more [he]65-mr. wilkins , affected in [his]65-mr. wilkins turn , became really very nice [himself]65-mr. wilkins ; so that [they]1943-they went round and round , not in a vicious but in a highly virtuous circle .

[Positively]160-positively , for [him]65-mr. wilkins , [Mellersh]149-lotty petted [her]244-his wife . There was at no time much pet in [Mellersh]149-lotty , because [he]65-mr. wilkins was by nature [a cool man]1944-a cool man ; yet such was the influence on [him]65-mr. wilkins of , as [Lotty]149-lotty supposed , [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , that in this second week [he]65-mr. wilkins sometimes pinched both [her]244-his wife ears , one after the other , instead of only one ; and [Lotty]149-lotty , marvelling at such rapidly developing affectionateness , wondered what [he]65-mr. wilkins would do , should [he]65-mr. wilkins continue at this rate , in the third week , when [her]244-his wife supply of ears would have come to an end .

[He]65-mr. wilkins was particularly nice about [the washstand]1945-the washstand , and genuinely desirous of not taking up too much of the space in [the small bedroom]1946-the small bedroom . Quick to respond , [Lotty]149-lotty was even more desirous not to be in [his]65-mr. wilkins way ; and [the room]219-the room became the scene of many an affectionate combat de générosité , each of which left [them]1948-them more pleased with [each other]207-each other than ever . [He]65-mr. wilkins did not again have a bath in [the bathroom]1737-the bathroom , though it was mended and ready for [him]65-mr. wilkins , but got up and went down every morning to [the sea]2735-the sea , and in spite of the cool nights making the water cold early had [his]65-mr. wilkins dip as [a man]662-a man should , and came up to breakfast rubbing [his]65-mr. wilkins hands and feeling , as [he]65-mr. wilkins told [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , prepared for anything .

[Lotty]149-lotty ’s belief in the irresistible influence of the heavenly atmosphere of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore being thus obviously justified , and [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , whom [Rose]103-rose knew as alarming and [Scrap]115-scrap had pictured as icily unkind , being so evidently [a changed man]1953-a changed man , both [Rose]103-rose and [Scrap]115-scrap began to think there might after all be something in what [Lotty]149-lotty insisted on , and that [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore did work purgingly on the character .

[They]1954-they were the more inclined to think so in that [they]1954-they too felt a working going on inside [themselves]1954-they : [they]1954-they felt more cleared , both of [them]1954-they , that second week — [Scrap]115-scrap in [her]103-rose thoughts , many of which were now quite nice thoughts , real amiable ones about [[her]103-rose parents]1095-her parents and [relations]1956-relations , with a glimmer in them of recognition of the extraordinary benefits [she]103-rose had received at the hands of — what ? Fate ? Providence?—anyhow of something , and of how , having received them , [she]103-rose had misused [them]1954-they by failing to be happy ; and [Rose]103-rose in [her]103-rose bosom , which though it still yearned , yearned to some purpose , for [she]103-rose was reaching the conclusion that merely inactively to yearn was no use at all , and that [she]103-rose must either by some means stop [her]103-rose yearning or give it at least a chance — remote , but still a chance — of being quieted by writing to [Frederick]75-frederick and asking [him]75-frederick to come out .

If [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins could be changed , thought [Rose]103-rose , why not [Frederick]75-frederick ? How wonderful it would be , how too wonderful , if [the place]428-the place worked on [him]75-frederick too and were able to make [them]1958-them even a little understand [each other]207-each other , even a little be [friends]2712-friends . [Rose]103-rose , so far had loosening and disintegration gone on in [her]103-rose character , now was beginning to think [her]103-rose obstinate strait - lacedness about [his]75-frederick books and [her]103-rose austere absorption in good works had been foolish and perhaps even wrong . [He]75-frederick was [[her]103-rose husband]204-her husband , and [she]103-rose had frightened [him]75-frederick away . [She]103-rose had frightened love away , precious love , and that could n’t be good . Was not [Lotty]149-lotty right when [she]103-rose said the other day that nothing at all except love mattered ? Nothing certainly seemed much use unless it was built up on love . But once frightened away , could it ever come back ? Yes , it might in that beauty , it might in the atmosphere of happiness [Lotty]149-lotty and [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore seemed between [them]1958-them to spread round like some divine infection .

[She]103-rose had , however , to get [him]75-frederick [there]296-there first , and [he]75-frederick certainly could n’t be got there if [she]103-rose did n’t write and tell [him]75-frederick where [she]103-rose was .

[She]103-rose would write . [She]103-rose must write ; for if [she]103-rose did there was at least a chance of [his]75-frederick coming , and if [she]103-rose did n’t there was manifestly none . And then , once here in this loveliness , with everything so soft and kind and sweet all round , it would be easier to tell [him]75-frederick , to try and explain , to ask for something different , for at least an attempt at something different in [their]1958-them lives in the future , instead of the blankness of separation , the cold — oh , the cold — of nothing at all but the great windiness of faith , the great bleakness of works . Why , [one person in [the world]186-the world]1963-one person in the world , [one single person belonging to [one , of one]1966-one , of one ’s very own]1965-one single person belonging to one , of one ’s very own , to talk to , to take care of , to love , to be interested in , was worth more than all the speeches on platforms and the compliments of chairmen in [the world]186-the world . It was also worth more — [Rose]103-rose could n’t help it , the thought would come — than all the prayers .

These thoughts were not head thoughts , like [Scrap]115-scrap ’s , who was altogether free from yearnings , but bosom thoughts . They lodged in the bosom ; it was in the bosom that [Rose]103-rose ached , and felt so dreadfully lonely . And when [her]103-rose courage failed [her]103-rose , as it did on most days , and it seemed impossible to write to [Frederick]75-frederick , [she]103-rose would look at [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins and revive .

There [he]75-frederick was , [a changed man]1953-a changed man . There [he]75-frederick was , going into [that small , uncomfortable room]1969-that small , uncomfortable room every night , [that room whose proximities had been [Lotty]149-lotty ’s only misgiving , and coming out of it in the morning]1970-that room whose proximities had been lotty ’s only misgiving , and coming out of it in the morning , and [Lotty]149-lotty coming out of it too , both of [them]1971-them as unclouded and as nice to [each other]207-each other as when [they]1971-them went in . And had n’t [he]75-frederick , so critical at [home]222-home , [Lotty]149-lotty had told [her]103-rose , of the least thing going wrong , emerged from the bath catastrophe as untouched in spirit as [Shadrach]161-shadrach , [Meshach]162-meshach and [Abednego]163-abednego were untouched in body when [they]1974-they emerged from the fire ? Miracles were happening in [this place]2843-this place . If [they]1976-they could happen to [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , why not to [Frederick]75-frederick ?

[She]103-rose got up quickly . Yes , [she]103-rose would write . [She]103-rose would go and write to [him]75-frederick at once .

But suppose —

[She]103-rose paused . Suppose [he]75-frederick did n’t answer . Suppose [he]75-frederick did n’t even answer .

And [she]103-rose sat down again to think a little longer .

In these hesitations did [Rose]103-rose spend most of the second week .

Then there was [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . [Her]83-mrs. fisher restlessness increased that second week . It increased to such an extent that [she]83-mrs. fisher might just as well not have had [[her]83-mrs. fisher private sitting - room]1346-her private sitting - room at all , for [she]83-mrs. fisher could no longer sit . Not for ten minutes together could [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher sit . And added to the restlessness , as the days of the second week proceeded on their way , [she]83-mrs. fisher had a curious sensation , which worried [her]83-mrs. fisher , of rising sap . [She]83-mrs. fisher knew the feeling , because [she]83-mrs. fisher had sometimes had it in childhood in [specially swift springs]1978-specially swift springs , when the lilacs and the syringas seemed to rush out into blossom in a single night , but it was strange to have it again after over fifty years . [She]83-mrs. fisher would have liked to remark on the sensation to [some one]1601-some one , but [she]83-mrs. fisher was ashamed . It was such an absurd sensation at [her]83-mrs. fisher age . Yet oftener and oftener , and every day more and more , did [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher have a ridiculous feeling as if [she]83-mrs. fisher were presently going to burgeon .

Sternly [she]83-mrs. fisher tried to frown the unseemly sensation down . Burgeon , indeed . [She]83-mrs. fisher had heard of dried staffs , pieces of mere dead wood , suddenly putting forth fresh leaves , but only in legend . [She]83-mrs. fisher was not in legend . [She]83-mrs. fisher knew perfectly what was due to [herself]83-mrs. fisher . [Dignity]146-dignity demanded that [she]83-mrs. fisher should have nothing to do with fresh leaves at [her]83-mrs. fisher age ; and yet there it was — the feeling that presently , that at any moment now , [she]83-mrs. fisher might crop out all green .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was upset . There were many things [she]83-mrs. fisher disliked more than anything else , and one was when [the elderly]1980-the elderly imagined [they]1980-the elderly felt young and behaved accordingly . Of course [they]1980-the elderly only imagined it , [they]1980-the elderly were only deceiving [themselves]1980-the elderly ; but how deplorable were the results . [She]83-mrs. fisher [herself]83-mrs. fisher had grown old as [people]278-people should grow old — steadily and firmly . No interruptions , no belated after - glows and spasmodic returns . If , after all these years , [she]83-mrs. fisher were now going to be deluded into some sort of unsuitable breaking - out , how humiliating .

Indeed [she]83-mrs. fisher was thankful , that second week , that [Kate Lumley]137-kate was not there . It would be most unpleasant , should anything different occur in [her]83-mrs. fisher behaviour , to have [Kate]137-kate looking on . [Kate]137-kate had known [her]83-mrs. fisher all [her]137-kate life . [She]137-kate felt [she]137-kate could let [herself]137-kate go — here [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher frowned at the book [she]83-mrs. fisher was vainly trying to concentrate on , for where did that expression come from?—much less painfully before [strangers]323-strangers than before [an old friend]1983-an old friend . [Old friends]1984-old friends , reflected [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , who hoped [she]83-mrs. fisher was reading , compare [one]235-one constantly with what [one]235-one used to be . [They]1984-old friends are always doing it if [one]235-one develops . [They]1984-old friends are surprised at development . [They]1984-old friends hark back ; [they]1984-old friends expect motionlessness after , say , fifty , to the end of one ’s days .

That , thought [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , [her]83-mrs. fisher eyes going steadily line by line down the page and not a word of it getting through into [her]83-mrs. fisher consciousness , is foolish of [friends]2712-friends . It is condemning [one]235-one to a premature death . [One]235-one should continue ( of course with dignity ) to develop , however old one may be . [She]83-mrs. fisher had nothing against developing , against further ripeness , because as long as [one]235-one was alive [one]235-one was not dead — obviously , decided [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , and development , change , ripening , were life . What [she]83-mrs. fisher would dislike would be unripening , going back to something green . [She]83-mrs. fisher would dislike it intensely ; and this is what [she]83-mrs. fisher felt [she]83-mrs. fisher was on the brink of doing .

Naturally it made [her]83-mrs. fisher very uneasy , and only in constant movement could [she]83-mrs. fisher find distraction . Increasingly restless and no longer able to confine [herself]83-mrs. fisher to [her]83-mrs. fisher battlements , [she]83-mrs. fisher wandered more and more frequently , and also aimlessly , in and out of [the top garden]1097-the top garden , to the growing surprise of [Scrap]115-scrap , especially when [she]83-mrs. fisher found that all [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher did was to stare for a few minutes at the view , pick a few dead leaves off the rose - bushes , and go away again .

In [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ’s conversation [she]83-mrs. fisher found temporary relief , but though [he]65-mr. wilkins joined [her]83-mrs. fisher whenever [he]65-mr. wilkins could [he]65-mr. wilkins was not always there , for [he]65-mr. wilkins spread [his]65-mr. wilkins attentions judiciously among [the three ladies]1860-the three ladies , and when [he]65-mr. wilkins was [somewhere else]1995-somewhere else [she]83-mrs. fisher had to face and manage [her]83-mrs. fisher thoughts as best [she]83-mrs. fisher could by [herself]83-mrs. fisher . Perhaps it was the excess of light and colour at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore which made [every other place]1996-every other place seem dark and black ; and [Prince of Wales Terrace]36-prince of wales terrace did seem [a very dark black spot to have to go]1997-a very dark black spot to have to go back to — [a dark , narrow street]1998-a dark , narrow street , and [[her]83-mrs. fisher house]382-her house dark and narrow as [the street]1730-the street , with nothing really living or young in [it]382-her house . [The goldfish]165-the goldfish could hardly be called living , or at most not more than half living , and were certainly not young , and except for [them]2001-them there were only [the maids]2002-the maids , and [they]2001-them were dusty old things .

Dusty old things . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher paused in [her]83-mrs. fisher thoughts , arrested by the strange expression . Where had it come from ? How was it possible for it to come at all ? It might have been one of [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s , in its levity , its almost slang . Perhaps it was one of [hers]83-mrs. fisher , and [she]83-mrs. fisher had heard [her]83-mrs. fisher say it and unconsciously caught it from [her]83-mrs. fisher .

If so , this was both serious and disgusting . That [the foolish creature]2003-the foolish creature should penetrate into [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s very mind and establish [her]83-mrs. fisher personality there , the personality which was still , in spite of the harmony apparently existing between [her]83-mrs. fisher and [[her]83-mrs. fisher intelligent husband]2004-her intelligent husband , so alien to [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s own , so far removed from what [she]83-mrs. fisher understood and liked , and infect [her]83-mrs. fisher with [her]83-mrs. fisher undesirable phrases , was most disturbing . Never in [her]83-mrs. fisher life before had such a sentence come into [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s head . Never in [her]83-mrs. fisher life before had [she]83-mrs. fisher thought of [[her]83-mrs. fisher maids]2005-her maids , or of [anybody else]1573-anybody else , as dusty old things . [[Her]83-mrs. fisher maids]2005-her maids were not dusty old things ; [they]2005-her maids were [most respectable , neat women , who were allowed the use of the bathroom every Saturday night]2008-most respectable , neat women , who were allowed the use of the bathroom every saturday night . [Elderly]2009-elderly , certainly , but then so was [she]83-mrs. fisher , so was [[her]83-mrs. fisher house]382-her house , so was [her]83-mrs. fisher furniture , so were [her]83-mrs. fisher goldfish . [They]2011-they were all elderly , as [they]2011-they should be , together . But there was a great difference between being elderly and being a dusty old thing .

How true it was what [Ruskin]107-ruskin said , that evil communications corrupt good manners . But did [Ruskin]107-ruskin say it ? On second thoughts [she]83-mrs. fisher was not sure , but it was just the sort of thing [he]2012-he would have said if [he]2012-he had said it , and in any case it was true . Merely hearing [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s evil communications at meals — [she]83-mrs. fisher did not listen , [she]83-mrs. fisher avoided listening , yet it was evident [she]83-mrs. fisher had heard — those communications which , in that they so often were at once vulgar , indelicate and profane , and always , [she]83-mrs. fisher was sorry to say , laughed at by [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , must be classed as evil , was spoiling [her]83-mrs. fisher own mental manners . Soon [she]83-mrs. fisher might not only think but say . How terrible that would be . If that were the form [her]83-mrs. fisher breaking - out was going to take , the form of unseemly speech , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was afraid [she]83-mrs. fisher would hardly with any degree of composure be able to bear it .

At this stage [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher wished more than ever that [she]83-mrs. fisher were able to talk over [her]83-mrs. fisher strange feelings with [some one who would understand]2013-some one who would understand . There was , however , [no one who would understand except [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins [herself]64-mrs. wilkins]2014-no one who would understand except mrs. wilkins herself . [She]64-mrs. wilkins would . [She]64-mrs. wilkins would know at once , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was sure , what [she]64-mrs. wilkins felt like . But this was impossible . It would be as abject as begging the very microbe that was infecting one for protection against its disease .

[She]64-mrs. wilkins continued , accordingly , to bear [her]64-mrs. wilkins sensations in silence , and was driven by [them]2015-them into that frequent aimless appearing in the top garden which presently roused even [Scrap]115-scrap ’s attention .

[Scrap]115-scrap had noticed it , and vaguely wondered at it , for some time before [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins inquired of [her]64-mrs. wilkins one morning as [he]65-mr. wilkins arranged [her]64-mrs. wilkins cushions for [her]64-mrs. wilkins — [he]65-mr. wilkins had established the daily assisting of [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline into [her]64-mrs. wilkins chair as [his]65-mr. wilkins special privilege — whether there was anything the matter with [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher .

At that moment [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher was standing by [the eastern parapet]2016-the eastern parapet , shading [her]83-mrs. fisher eyes and carefully scrutinising [the distant white houses of [Mezzago]32-mezzago]2017-the distant white houses of mezzago . [They]2018-they could see [her]83-mrs. fisher through the branches of the daphnes .

“ [I]115-scrap do n’t know , ”[115-scrap] said [Scrap]115-scrap .

“ [She]83-mrs. fisher is [a lady]1811-a lady , [I]65-mr. wilkins take it , ”[65-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , “ who would be unlikely to have anything on [her]83-mrs. fisher mind ? ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ [I]115-scrap should imagine so , ”[115-scrap] said [Scrap]115-scrap , smiling .

“ If [she]83-mrs. fisher has , and [her]83-mrs. fisher restlessness appears to suggest it , [I]65-mr. wilkins should be more than glad to assist [her]83-mrs. fisher with advice . ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ [I]65-mr. wilkins am sure [you]65-mr. wilkins would be most kind . ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ Of course [she]83-mrs. fisher has [[her]83-mrs. fisher own legal adviser]3001-her own legal adviser , but [he]3001-her own legal adviser is not on the spot . [I]65-mr. wilkins am . And [a lawyer on the spot]3002-a lawyer on the spot , ”[65-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , who endeavoured to make [his]65-mr. wilkins conversation when [he]65-mr. wilkins talked to [Lady Caroline light]82-lady caroline , aware that one must be light with [young ladies]2019-young ladies , “ is worth two in — [we]3003-we wo n’t be ordinary and complete the proverb , but say [London]2-london . ”[82-lady caroline]

“ [You]65-mr. wilkins should ask [her]83-mrs. fisher . ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ Ask [her]83-mrs. fisher if [she]83-mrs. fisher needs assistance ? Would [you]65-mr. wilkins advise it ? Would it not be a little — a little delicate to touch on such a question , the question whether or [no a lady]3004-no a lady has something on [her]83-mrs. fisher mind ? ”[82-lady caroline]

“ Perhaps [she]83-mrs. fisher will tell [you]65-mr. wilkins if [you]65-mr. wilkins go and talk to [her]83-mrs. fisher . [I]65-mr. wilkins think it must be lonely to be [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ [You]65-mr. wilkins are all thoughtfulness and consideration , ”[65-mr. wilkins] declared [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , wishing , for the first time in [his]65-mr. wilkins life , that [he]65-mr. wilkins were [a foreigner]2020-a foreigner so that [he]65-mr. wilkins might respectfully kiss [her]2021-she hand on withdrawing to go obediently and relieve [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s loneliness .

It was wonderful what a variety of exits from [her]2021-she corner [Scrap]115-scrap contrived for [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins . Each morning [she]2021-she found a different one , which sent [him]65-mr. wilkins off pleased after [he]65-mr. wilkins had arranged [her]2021-she cushions for [her]2021-she . [She]2021-she allowed [him]65-mr. wilkins to arrange the cushions because [she]2021-she instantly had discovered , the very first five minutes of the very first evening , that [her]2021-she fears lest [he]65-mr. wilkins should cling to [her]2021-she and stare in dreadful admiration were baseless . [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins did not admire like that . It was not only , [she]2021-she instinctively felt , not in [him]65-mr. wilkins , but if it had been [he]65-mr. wilkins would not have dared to in [her]2021-she case . [He]65-mr. wilkins was all respectfulness . [She]2021-she could direct [his]65-mr. wilkins movements in regard to [herself]2021-she with the raising of an eyelash . [His]65-mr. wilkins one concern was to obey . [She]2021-she had been prepared to like [him]65-mr. wilkins if [he]65-mr. wilkins would only be so obliging as not to admire [her]2021-she , and [she]2021-she did like [him]65-mr. wilkins . [She]2021-she did not forget [his]65-mr. wilkins moving defencelessness the first morning in [his]65-mr. wilkins towel , and [he]65-mr. wilkins amused [her]2021-she , and [he]65-mr. wilkins was kind to [Lotty]149-lotty . It is true [she]2021-she liked [him]65-mr. wilkins most when [he]65-mr. wilkins was n’t [there]296-there , but then [she]2021-she usually liked [everybody]2701-everybody most when [they]2701-everybody were n’t [there]296-there . Certainly [he]65-mr. wilkins did seem to be [one of those men , rare in [her]2021-she experience , who never looked at [a woman from the predatory angle]2026-a woman from the predatory angle]2025-one of those men , rare in her experience , who never looked at a woman from the predatory angle . The comfort of this , the simplification it brought into the relations of [the party]1940-the party , was immense . From this point of view [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins was simply ideal ; [he]65-mr. wilkins was unique and precious . Whenever [she]2021-she thought of [him]65-mr. wilkins , and was perhaps inclined to dwell on the aspects of [him]65-mr. wilkins that were a little boring , [she]2021-she remembered this and murmured , “ But what a treasure . ”[2021-she]

Indeed it was [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ’s one aim during [his]65-mr. wilkins stay at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore to be a treasure . At all costs [the three ladies who were not [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife]2028-the three ladies who were not his wife must like [him]65-mr. wilkins and trust [him]65-mr. wilkins . Then presently when trouble arose in [their]2028-the three ladies who were not his wife lives — and in what lives did not trouble sooner or later [arise?—they]166-arise?—they would recollect how reliable [he]65-mr. wilkins was and how sympathetic , and turn to [him]65-mr. wilkins for advice . Ladies with something on [their]2028-the three ladies who were not his wife minds were exactly what [he]65-mr. wilkins wanted . [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , [he]65-mr. wilkins judged , had nothing on [hers]82-lady caroline at the moment , but so much beauty — for [he]65-mr. wilkins could not but see what was evident — must have had its difficulties in the past and would have more of them before it had done . In the past [he]65-mr. wilkins had not been at hand ; in the future [he]65-mr. wilkins hoped to be . And meanwhile the behaviour of [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , the next in importance of [the ladies from the professional point of view]2030-the ladies from the professional point of view , showed definite promise . It was almost certain that [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had something on [her]83-mrs. fisher mind . [He]65-mr. wilkins had been observing [her]83-mrs. fisher attentively , and it was almost certain .

With the third , with [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , [he]65-mr. wilkins had up to this made least headway , for [she]83-mrs. fisher was so very retiring and quiet . But might not this very retiringness , this tendency to avoid [the others]822-the others and spend [her]83-mrs. fisher time alone , indicate that [she]83-mrs. fisher too was troubled ? If so , [he]65-mr. wilkins was [[her]83-mrs. fisher man]2032-her man . [He]65-mr. wilkins would cultivate [her]83-mrs. fisher . [He]65-mr. wilkins would follow [her]83-mrs. fisher and sit with [her]83-mrs. fisher , and encourage [her]83-mrs. fisher to tell [him]65-mr. wilkins about [herself]83-mrs. fisher . [Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , [he]65-mr. wilkins understood from [Lotty]149-lotty , was [a British Museum official]2033-a british museum official — nothing specially important at present , but [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins regarded it as [his]65-mr. wilkins business to know all sorts and kinds . Besides , there was promotion . [Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , promoted , might become very much worth while .

As for [Lotty]149-lotty , [she]149-lotty was charming . [She]149-lotty really had all the qualities [he]65-mr. wilkins had credited [her]149-lotty with during [his]65-mr. wilkins courtship , and [they]2034-they had been , it appeared , merely in abeyance since . [His]65-mr. wilkins early impressions of [her]149-lotty were now being endorsed by the affection and even admiration [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline showed for [her]149-lotty . [Lady Caroline Dester]82-lady caroline was [the last person]2035-the last person , [he]65-mr. wilkins was sure , to be mistaken on such a subject . [Her]82-lady caroline knowledge of [the world]186-the world , [her]82-lady caroline constant association with only the best , must make [her]82-lady caroline quite unerring . [Lotty]149-lotty was evidently , then , that which before marriage [he]65-mr. wilkins had believed [her]149-lotty to be — [she]149-lotty was valuable . [She]149-lotty certainly had been most valuable in introducing [him]65-mr. wilkins to [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . [A man in [his]65-mr. wilkins profession]2037-a man in his profession could be immensely helped by [a clever and attractive wife]2038-a clever and attractive wife . Why had [she]149-lotty not been attractive sooner ? Why this sudden flowering ?

[Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins began too to believe there was something peculiar , as [Lotty]149-lotty had almost at once informed [him]65-mr. wilkins , in the atmosphere of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore . [It]2039-it promoted expansion . [It]2039-it brought out dormant qualities . And feeling more and more pleased , and even charmed , by [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife , and very content with the progress [he]65-mr. wilkins was making with [the two others]905-the two others , and hopeful of progress to be made with the retiring third , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins could not remember ever having had such an agreeable holiday . The only thing that might perhaps be bettered was the way [they]2042-they would call [him]65-mr. wilkins [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins . [Nobody]231-nobody said [Mr. Mellersh - Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins . Yet [he]65-mr. wilkins had introduced [himself]65-mr. wilkins to [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline — [he]65-mr. wilkins flinched a little on remembering the circumstances — as [Mellersh - Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins .

Still , this was a small matter , not enough to worry about . [He]65-mr. wilkins would be foolish if in such a place and such society [he]65-mr. wilkins worried about anything . [He]65-mr. wilkins was not even worrying about what the holiday was costing , and had made up [his]65-mr. wilkins mind to pay not only [his]65-mr. wilkins own expenses but [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife ’s as well , and surprise [her]244-his wife at the end by presenting [her]244-his wife with [her]244-his wife nest - egg as intact as when [she]244-his wife started ; and just the knowledge that [he]65-mr. wilkins was preparing a happy surprise for [her]244-his wife made [him]65-mr. wilkins feel warmer than ever towards [her]244-his wife .

In fact [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , who had begun by being consciously and according to plan on [his]65-mr. wilkins best behaviour , remained on it unconsciously , and with no effort at all .

And meanwhile the beautiful golden days were dropping gently from the second week one by one , equal in beauty with those of the first , and the scent of beanfields in flower on [the hillside behind [the village]615-the village]2045-the hillside behind the village came across to [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore whenever the air moved . In [the garden]519-the garden that second week [the poet]2048-the poet ’s eyed narcissus disappeared out [the long grass at the edge of the zigzag path]2049-the long grass at the edge of the zigzag path , and wild gladiolus , slender and rose - coloured , came in [their]2050-their stead , white pinks bloomed in the borders , filling [the whole place]695-the whole place with their smoky - sweet smell , and a bush [nobody]231-nobody had noticed burst into glory and fragrance , and it was a purple lilac bush . Such a jumble of spring and summer was not to be believed in , except by [those who dwelt in [those gardens]2054-those gardens]2053-those who dwelt in those gardens . Everything seemed to be out together — all the things crowded into one month which in [England]17-england are spread penuriously over six . Even primroses were found one day by [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins in [a cold corner up in [the hills]1554-the hills]2055-a cold corner up in the hills ; and when [she]64-mrs. wilkins brought [them]2057-them down to [the geraniums and heliotrope of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore]2058-the geraniums and heliotrope of san salvatore [they]2057-them looked quite shy .

Chapter 17

On the first day of the third week [Rose]103-rose wrote to [Frederick]75-frederick .

In case [she]103-rose should again hesitate and not post the letter , [she]103-rose gave it to [Domenico]96-domenico to post ; for if [she]103-rose did not write now there would be no time left at all . Half the month at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore was over . Even if [Frederick]75-frederick started directly [he]75-frederick got the letter , which of course [he]75-frederick would n’t be able to do , what with packing and passport , besides not being in a hurry to come , [he]75-frederick could n’t arrive for five days .

Having done it , [Rose]103-rose wished [she]103-rose had n’t . [He]75-frederick would n’t come . [He]75-frederick would n’t bother to answer . And if [he]75-frederick did answer , it would just be giving some reason which was not true , and about being too busy to get away ; and all that had been got by writing to [him]75-frederick would be that [she]103-rose would be more unhappy than before .

What things [one]235-one did when [one]235-one was idle . This resurrection of [Frederick]75-frederick , or rather this attempt to resurrect [him]75-frederick , what was it but the result of having nothing whatever to do ? [She]103-rose wished [she]103-rose had never come away on a holiday . What did [she]103-rose want with holidays ? Work was [her]103-rose salvation ; work was the only thing that protected [one]235-one , that kept [one]235-one steady and [one]235-one ’s values true . At [home]222-home in [Hampstead]3-hampstead , absorbed and busy , [she]103-rose had managed to get over [Frederick]75-frederick , thinking of [him]75-frederick latterly only with the gentle melancholy with which [one]235-one thinks of some one once loved but long since dead ; and now [this place]2843-this place , idleness in [this soft place]2067-this soft place , had thrown [her]103-rose back to the wretched state [she]103-rose had climbed so carefully out of years ago . Why , if [Frederick]75-frederick did come [she]103-rose would only bore [him]75-frederick . Had n’t [she]103-rose seen in a flash quite soon after getting to [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore that that was really what kept [him]75-frederick away from [her]103-rose ? And why should [she]103-rose suppose that now , after such a long estrangement , [she]103-rose would be able not to bore [him]75-frederick , be able to do anything but stand before [him]75-frederick like [a tongue - tied idiot]2068-a tongue - tied idiot , with all the fingers of [her]103-rose spirit turned into thumbs ? Besides , what a hopeless position , to have as it were to beseech : Please wait a little — please do n’t be impatient — [I]0-i think perhaps [I]0-i sha n’t be [a bore presently]2069-a bore presently .

A thousand times a day [Rose]103-rose wished [she]103-rose had let [Frederick]75-frederick alone . [Lotty]149-lotty , who asked [her]103-rose every evening whether [she]103-rose had sent [her]103-rose letter yet , exclaimed with delight when the answer at last was yes , and threw [her]149-lotty arms round [her]103-rose . “ Now [we]3005-we shall be completely happy ! ”[149-lotty] cried [the enthusiastic Lotty]149-lotty .

But nothing seemed less certain to [Rose]103-rose , and [her]103-rose expression became more and more the expression of [one who has something on [her]2070-one who has something on her mind mind]2070-one who has something on her mind .

[Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , wanting to find out what it was , strolled in the sun in [his]65-mr. wilkins Panama hat , and began to meet [her]103-rose accidentally .

“ [I]65-mr. wilkins did not know , ”[65-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins the first time , courteously raising [his]65-mr. wilkins hat , “ that [you]103-rose too liked [this particular spot]3006-this particular spot . ”[65-mr. wilkins] And [he]65-mr. wilkins sat down beside [her]103-rose .

In the afternoon [she]103-rose chose another spot ; and [she]103-rose had not been in [it]2071-it half an hour before [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , lightly swinging [his]65-mr. wilkins cane , came round the corner .

“ [We]3007-we are destined to meet in [[our]3007-we rambles]3008-our rambles , ”[65-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins pleasantly . And [he]65-mr. wilkins sat down beside [her]103-rose .

[Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins was very kind , and [she]103-rose had , [she]103-rose saw , misjudged [him]65-mr. wilkins in [Hampstead]3-hampstead , and this was [the real man]2072-the real man , ripened like fruit by the beneficent sun of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , but [Rose]103-rose did want to be alone . Still , [she]103-rose was grateful to [him]65-mr. wilkins for proving to [her]103-rose that though [she]103-rose might bore [Frederick]75-frederick [she]103-rose did not bore [everybody]2701-everybody ; if [she]103-rose had , [he]65-mr. wilkins would not have sat talking to [her]103-rose on each occasion till it was time to go in . True [he]65-mr. wilkins bored [her]103-rose , but that was n’t anything like so dreadful as if [she]103-rose bored [him]65-mr. wilkins . Then indeed [her]103-rose vanity would have been sadly ruffled . For now that [Rose]103-rose was not able to say [her]103-rose prayers [she]103-rose was being assailed by every sort of weakness : vanity , sensitiveness , irritability , pugnacity — strange , unfamiliar devils to have coming crowding on one and taking possession of one ’s swept and empty heart . [She]103-rose had never been vain or irritable or pugnacious in [her]103-rose life before . Could it be that [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore was capable of opposite effects , and the same sun that ripened [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins made [her]103-rose go acid ?

The next morning , so as to be sure of being alone , [she]103-rose went down , while [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins was still lingering pleasantly with [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher over breakfast , to the rocks by [the water]690-the water ’s edge where [she]103-rose and [Lotty]149-lotty had sat the first day . [Frederick]75-frederick by now had got [her]103-rose letter . To - day , if [he]75-frederick were like [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , [she]103-rose might get a telegram from [him]75-frederick .

[She]103-rose tried to silence the absurd hope by jeering at it . Yet — if [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins had telegraphed , why not [Frederick]75-frederick ? The spell of [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore lurked even , it seemed , in notepaper . [Lotty]149-lotty had not dreamed of getting a telegram , and when [she]149-lotty came in at lunch - time there it was . It would be too wonderful if when [she]149-lotty went back at lunch - time [she]149-lotty found one there for [her]149-lotty too . . .

[Rose]103-rose clasped [her]103-rose hands tight round [her]103-rose knees . How passionately [she]103-rose longed to be important to [somebody]996-somebody again — not important on platforms , not important as an asset in [an organisation]2076-an organisation , but privately important , just to [one other person]2077-one other person , quite privately , [nobody else to know or notice]2078-nobody else to know or notice . It did n’t seem much to ask in a world so crowded with [people]278-people , just to have [one of [them]278-people]405-one of them , only one out of all the millions , to [oneself]2081-oneself . [Somebody who needed one]2082-somebody who needed one , who thought of one , who was eager to come to one — oh , oh how dreadfully [one]235-one wanted to be precious !

All the morning [she]149-lotty sat beneath the pine - tree by [the sea]2735-the sea . [Nobody]231-nobody came near [her]149-lotty . The great hours passed slowly ; they seemed enormous . But [she]149-lotty would n’t go up before lunch , [she]149-lotty would give the telegram time to arrive . . .

That day [Scrap]115-scrap , egged on by [Lotty]149-lotty ’s persuasions and also thinking that perhaps [she]149-lotty had sat long enough , had arisen from [her]149-lotty chair and cushions and gone off with [Lotty]149-lotty and sandwiches up into [the hills]1554-the hills till evening . [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , who wished to go with [them]2087-them , stayed on [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline ’s advice with [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher in order to cheer [her]83-mrs. fisher solitude , and though [he]65-mr. wilkins left off cheering [her]83-mrs. fisher about eleven to go and look for [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , so as for a space to cheer [her]83-mrs. fisher too , thus dividing [himself]65-mr. wilkins impartially between [these solitary ladies]2088-these solitary ladies , [he]65-mr. wilkins came back again presently mopping [his]65-mr. wilkins forehead and continued with [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher where [he]65-mr. wilkins had left off , for this time [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot had hidden successfully . There was a telegram , too , for [her]83-mrs. fisher [he]65-mr. wilkins noticed when [he]65-mr. wilkins came in . Pity [he]65-mr. wilkins did not know where [she]83-mrs. fisher was .

“ Ought [we]3009-we to open it ? ”[65-mr. wilkins] [he]65-mr. wilkins said to [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher .

“ No , ”[83-mrs. fisher] said [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher .

“ It may require an answer . ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ Tampering ! [[My]65-mr. wilkins dear lady]2988-my dear lady — ”[65-mr. wilkins]

[Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins was shocked . Such a word . Tampering . [He]65-mr. wilkins had the greatest possible esteem for [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , but [he]65-mr. wilkins did at times find [her]83-mrs. fisher a little difficult . [She]83-mrs. fisher liked [him]65-mr. wilkins , [he]65-mr. wilkins was sure , and [she]83-mrs. fisher was in a fair way , [he]65-mr. wilkins felt , to become [a client]1812-a client , but [he]65-mr. wilkins feared [she]83-mrs. fisher would be [a headstrong and secretive client]2090-a headstrong and secretive client . [She]83-mrs. fisher was certainly secretive , for though [he]65-mr. wilkins had been skilful and sympathetic for a whole week , [she]83-mrs. fisher had as yet given [him]65-mr. wilkins no inkling of what was so evidently worrying [her]83-mrs. fisher .

“ [Poor old thing]2882-poor old thing , ”[149-lotty] said [Lotty]149-lotty , on [his]65-mr. wilkins asking [her]83-mrs. fisher if [she]83-mrs. fisher perhaps could throw light on [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s troubles . “ [She]83-mrs. fisher has n’t got love . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

“ Any love , ”[149-lotty] said [Lotty]149-lotty .

That very morning [he]65-mr. wilkins had asked [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife , for [he]65-mr. wilkins now sought and respected [her]244-his wife opinion , if [she]244-his wife could tell [him]65-mr. wilkins what was the matter with [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot , for [she]244-his wife too , though [he]65-mr. wilkins had done [his]65-mr. wilkins best to thaw [her]244-his wife into confidences , had remained persistently retiring .

And [Lotty]149-lotty said , smiling at [him]65-mr. wilkins , “ [One]235-one does . ”[149-lotty]

And [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , much pleased with [her]244-his wife , though it was still quite early in the day , a time when caresses are sluggish , pinched [her]244-his wife ear .

Just before half - past twelve [Rose]103-rose came slowly up through [the pergola]926-the pergola and between the camellias ranged on either side of the old stone steps . The rivulets of periwinkles that flowed down them when first [she]244-his wife arrived were gone , and now there were these bushes , incredibly rosetted . Pink , white , red , striped — [she]244-his wife fingered and smelt them one after the other , so as not to get to [her]244-his wife disappointment too quickly . As long as [she]244-his wife had n’t seen for [herself]244-his wife , seen the table in [the hall]337-the hall quite empty except for its bowl of flowers , [she]244-his wife still could hope , [she]244-his wife still could have the joy of imagining the telegram lying on it waiting for [her]244-his wife . But there is no smell in [a camellia]2094-a camellia , as [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , who was standing in the doorway on the look - out for [her]244-his wife and knew what was necessary in horticulture , reminded [her]244-his wife .

[She]244-his wife started at [his]65-mr. wilkins voice and looked up .

“ A telegram has come for [you]244-his wife , ”[65-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins .

[She]244-his wife stared at [him]65-mr. wilkins , [her]244-his wife mouth open .

“ [I]244-his wife searched for [you]244-his wife everywhere , but failed — ”[244-his wife]

Of course . [She]244-his wife knew it . [She]244-his wife had been sure of it all the time . Bright and burning , [Youth]167-youth in that instant flashed down again on [Rose]103-rose . [She]244-his wife flew up the steps , red as the camellia [she]244-his wife had just been fingering , and was in [the hall]337-the hall and tearing open the telegram before [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins had finished [his]65-mr. wilkins sentence . Why , but if things could happen like this — why , but there was no end to — why , [she]244-his wife and [Frederick]75-frederick — [they]2096-they were going to be — again — at last —

“ No bad news , [I]65-mr. wilkins trust ? ”[65-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins who had followed [her]244-his wife , for when [she]244-his wife had read the telegram [she]244-his wife stood staring at it and [her]244-his wife face went slowly white . Curious to watch how [her]244-his wife face went slowly white .

[She]244-his wife turned and looked at [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins as if trying to remember [him]65-mr. wilkins .

“ Oh no . On the contrary — ”[244-his wife]

[She]244-his wife managed to smile . “ [I]244-his wife ’m going to have [a visitor]3016-a visitor , ”[244-his wife] [she]244-his wife said , holding out the telegram ; and when [he]65-mr. wilkins had taken it [she]244-his wife walked away towards [the dining - room]856-the dining - room , murmuring something about lunch being ready .

[Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins read the telegram . It had been sent that morning from [Mezzago]32-mezzago , and was :

Am passing through on way to [Rome]50-rome . May [I]0-i pay [my]0-i respects this afternoon ?

[Thomas Briggs]118-thomas briggs .

Why should such a telegram make [the interesting lady]2098-the interesting lady turn pale ? For [her]244-his wife pallor on reading it had been so striking as to convince [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins [she]244-his wife was receiving a blow .

“ Who is [Thomas Briggs]118-thomas briggs ? ”[65-mr. wilkins] [he]65-mr. wilkins asked , following [her]244-his wife into [the dining - room]856-the dining - room .

“ [Thomas Briggs]118-thomas briggs . ”[244-his wife]

“ Oh . Yes . [He]118-thomas briggs is [the owner]440-the owner . This is [[his]118-thomas briggs house]501-his house . [He]118-thomas briggs is very nice . [He]118-thomas briggs is coming this afternoon . ”[244-his wife]

[Thomas Briggs]118-thomas briggs was at that very moment coming . [He]65-mr. wilkins was jogging along [[the road]2745-the road between [Mezzago]32-mezzago and [Castagneto]33-castagneto]2101-the road between mezzago and castagneto in a fly , sincerely hoping that [the dark - eyed lady]1549-the dark - eyed lady would grasp that all [he]65-mr. wilkins wanted was to see [her]1549-the dark - eyed lady , and not at all to see if [[his]65-mr. wilkins house]501-his house were still there . [He]65-mr. wilkins felt that [an owner of delicacy]2104-an owner of delicacy did not intrude on [a tenant]2105-a tenant . But — [he]65-mr. wilkins had been thinking so much of [her]1549-the dark - eyed lady since that day . [Rose Arbuthnot]80-rose . Such a pretty name . And such [a pretty creature]892-a pretty creature — mild , milky , mothery in the best sense ; the best sense being that [she]1549-the dark - eyed lady was n’t [[his]65-mr. wilkins mother]451-his mother and could n’t have been if [she]1549-the dark - eyed lady had tried , for [parents]1795-parents were the only things impossible to have younger than [oneself]2109-oneself . Also , [he]65-mr. wilkins was passing so near . It seemed absurd not just to look in and see if [she]1549-the dark - eyed lady were comfortable . [He]65-mr. wilkins longed to see [her]1549-the dark - eyed lady in [[his]65-mr. wilkins house]501-his house . Had [she]1549-the dark - eyed lady seen the portrait of [herself]1549-the dark - eyed lady on [the stairs]1782-the stairs ? [He]65-mr. wilkins wondered if [she]1549-the dark - eyed lady liked it . [He]65-mr. wilkins would explain it to [her]1549-the dark - eyed lady . If [she]1549-the dark - eyed lady did n’t paint , and [she]1549-the dark - eyed lady had said nothing to suggest it , [she]1549-the dark - eyed lady would n’t perhaps notice how exactly the moulding of the eyebrows and the slight hollow of the cheek —

[He]65-mr. wilkins told [the fly]2113-the fly to wait in [Castagneto]33-castagneto , and crossed [the piazza]835-the piazza , hailed by [children]455-children and dogs , who all knew [him]65-mr. wilkins and sprang up suddenly from nowhere , and walking quickly up [the zigzag path]837-the zigzag path , for [he]65-mr. wilkins was [an active young man not much more than thirty]2117-an active young man not much more than thirty , [he]65-mr. wilkins pulled the ancient chain that rang the bell , and waited decorously on the proper side of the open door to be allowed to come in .

Chapter 18

[They]2134-they had a very pleasant walk , with a great deal of sitting down in warm , thyme - fragrant corners , and if anything could have helped [Rose]80-rose to recover from the bitter disappointment of the morning it would have been the company and conversation of [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs . [He]65-mr. wilkins did help [her]106-francesca to recover , and the same process took place as that which [Lotty]149-lotty had undergone with [[her]149-lotty husband]204-her husband , and the more [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs thought [Rose]80-rose charming the more charming [she]106-francesca became .

[Briggs]79-briggs was a man incapable of concealments , who never lost time if [he]79-briggs could help it . [They]2134-they had not got to [the end of [the headland where the lighthouse]2137-the headland where the lighthouse]2136-the end of the headland where the lighthouse is — [Briggs]79-briggs asked [her]106-francesca to show [him]79-briggs [the lighthouse]2138-the lighthouse , because the path to [it]2138-the lighthouse , [he]79-briggs knew , was wide enough for two to walk abreast and fairly level — before [he]79-briggs had told [her]106-francesca of the impression [she]106-francesca had made on [him]79-briggs in [London]2-london .

Since even [the most religious , sober women]2139-the most religious , sober women like to know [they]2139-the most religious , sober women have made an impression , particularly the kind that has nothing to do with character or merits , [Rose]80-rose was pleased . Being pleased , [she]106-francesca smiled . Smiling , [she]106-francesca was more attractive than ever . Colour came into [her]106-francesca cheeks , and brightness into [her]106-francesca eyes . [She]106-francesca heard [herself]106-francesca saying things that really sounded quite interesting and even amusing . If [Frederick]75-frederick were listening now , [she]106-francesca thought , perhaps [he]75-frederick would see that [she]106-francesca could n’t after all be such [a hopeless bore]2140-a hopeless bore ; for here was [a man , nice - looking , young , and surely clever]2141-a man , nice - looking , young , and surely clever — [he]2141-a man , nice - looking , young , and surely clever seemed clever , and [she]106-francesca hoped [he]2141-a man , nice - looking , young , and surely clever was , for then the compliment would be still greater — who was evidently quite happy to spend the afternoon just talking to [her]106-francesca .

And indeed [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs seemed very much interested . [He]79-briggs wanted to hear all about everything [she]106-francesca had been doing from the moment [she]106-francesca got [there]296-there . [He]79-briggs asked [her]106-francesca if [she]106-francesca had seen this , that , and the other in [the house]410-the house , what [she]106-francesca liked best , which room [she]106-francesca had , if [she]106-francesca were comfortable , if [Francesca]106-francesca was behaving , if [Domenico]96-domenico took care of [her]106-francesca , and whether [she]106-francesca did n’t enjoy using [the yellow sitting - room]2144-the yellow sitting - room — the one that got all the sun and looked out towards [Genoa]30-genoa .

[Rose]80-rose was ashamed how little [she]106-francesca had noticed in [the house]410-the house , and how few of the things [he]79-briggs spoke of as curious or beautiful in it [she]106-francesca had even seen . Swamped in thoughts of [Frederick]75-frederick , [she]106-francesca appeared to have lived in [San Salvatore blindly]16-san salvatore , and more than half the time had gone , and what had been the good of it ? [She]106-francesca might just as well have been sitting hankering on [Hampstead Heath]48-hampstead heath . [She]2164-she came back to tea , bringing [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs , and looking quite different , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins noticed , from what [she]2164-she had looked till then . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher too was gracious . This was [[this young man]2175-this young man ’s house]2176-this young man ’s house . Accordingly it was a pleasant meal , with [everybody]2701-everybody amiable and pleased . [Briggs]79-briggs thought [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher [a dear old lady]2183-a dear old lady , and showed [he]79-briggs thought so ; and again the magic worked , and [she]83-mrs. fisher became [a dear old lady]2183-a dear old lady . [She]83-mrs. fisher developed benignity with [him]79-briggs , and a kind of benignity which was almost playful — actually before tea was over including in some observation [she]83-mrs. fisher made [him]79-briggs the words “ [[My]83-mrs. fisher dear boy]3044-my dear boy . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

Strange words in [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s mouth . It is doubtful whether in [her]83-mrs. fisher life [she]83-mrs. fisher had used them before . [Rose]80-rose was astonished . How nice [people]278-people really were . When would [she]83-mrs. fisher leave off making mistakes about [them]278-people ? [She]83-mrs. fisher had n’t suspected this side of [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , and [she]83-mrs. fisher began to wonder whether those other sides of [her]83-mrs. fisher with which alone [she]83-mrs. fisher was acquainted had not perhaps after all been the effect of [her]83-mrs. fisher own militant and irritating behaviour . Probably [they]2186-they were . How horrid , then , [she]83-mrs. fisher must have been . [She]83-mrs. fisher felt very penitent when [she]83-mrs. fisher saw [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher beneath [her]83-mrs. fisher eyes blossoming out into real amiability the moment [some one]1601-some one came along who was charming to [her]83-mrs. fisher , and [she]83-mrs. fisher could have sunk into the ground with shame when [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher presently laughed , and [she]83-mrs. fisher realised by the shock it gave [her]83-mrs. fisher that the sound was entirely new . Not once before had [she]83-mrs. fisher or [any one else there]2188-any one else there heard [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher laugh . What an indictment of [the lot of [them]2189-the lot of them]2189-the lot of them ! For [they]2189-the lot of them had all laughed , [the others]822-the others , [some more and some less]2191-some more and some less , at one time or another since [their]2189-the lot of them arrival , and only [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had not . Clearly , since [she]83-mrs. fisher could enjoy [herself]83-mrs. fisher as [she]83-mrs. fisher was now enjoying [herself]83-mrs. fisher , [she]83-mrs. fisher had not enjoyed [herself]83-mrs. fisher before . [Nobody]231-nobody had cared whether [she]83-mrs. fisher did or not , except perhaps [Lotty]149-lotty . Yes ; [Lotty]149-lotty had cared , and had wanted [her]83-mrs. fisher to be happy ; but [Lotty]149-lotty seemed to produce a bad effect on [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , while as for [Rose]80-rose [herself]80-rose [she]83-mrs. fisher had never been with [her]83-mrs. fisher for five minutes without wanting , really wanting , to provoke and oppose [her]83-mrs. fisher .

How very horrid [she]83-mrs. fisher had been . [She]83-mrs. fisher had behaved unpardonably . [Her]83-mrs. fisher penitence showed itself in a shy and deferential solicitude towards [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher which made [the observant Briggs]83-mrs. fisher think [her]83-mrs. fisher still more angelic , and wish for a moment that [he]2193-he were [an old lady]2194-an old lady [himself]2193-he in order to be behaved to by [Rose Arbuthnot]80-rose just like that . It might have been [Lotty]149-lotty talking . Chapter 19

“ Where are [your]79-briggs things , [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs ? ”[83-mrs. fisher] asked [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , [her]83-mrs. fisher voice round with motherliness . “ Ought n’t [they]3077-they to be fetched ? ”[83-mrs. fisher] For the sun was nearly in [the sea]2735-the sea now , and the sweet - smelling April dampness that followed immediately on its disappearance was beginning to steal into [the garden]519-the garden .
