[I]79-briggs ’ll send [Domenico]96-domenico . [My]79-briggs fly is waiting in [the village]615-the village . [He]96-domenico can go back in [it]615-the village . [I]79-briggs ’ll go and tell [him]96-domenico . ”[79-briggs]

[He]79-briggs got up . To whom was [he]79-briggs talking ? To [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , ostensibly , yet [his]79-briggs eyes were fixed on [Scrap]115-scrap , who said nothing and looked at [no one]310-no one .

Then , recollecting [himself]79-briggs , [he]79-briggs stammered , “ [I]79-briggs ’m awfully sorry — [I]79-briggs keep on forgetting — [I’ll]79-briggs go down and fetch them [myself]79-briggs . ”[79-briggs]

“ [We]3079-we can easily send [Domenico]96-domenico , ”[80-rose] said [Rose]80-rose ; and at [her]83-mrs. fisher gentle voice [he]79-briggs turned [his]79-briggs head .

Why , there was [[his]79-briggs friend]2243-his friend , [the sweet - named lady]2244-the sweet - named lady — but how had [she]2244-the sweet - named lady not in this short interval changed ! Was it the failing light making [her]2244-the sweet - named lady so colourless , so vague - featured , so dim , so much like a ghost ? [A nice good ghost]2245-a nice good ghost , of course , and still with a pretty name , but only a ghost .

[He]79-briggs turned from [her]2244-the sweet - named lady to [Scrap]115-scrap again , and forgot [Rose Arbuthnot]80-rose ’s existence . How was it possible for [him]79-briggs to bother about anybody or anything else in this first moment of being face to face with [his]79-briggs dream come true ?

[Briggs]79-briggs had not supposed or hoped that any one as beautiful as [his]79-briggs dream of beauty existed . [He]79-briggs had never till now met even [an approximation]2246-an approximation . [Pretty women]2247-pretty women , [charming women]2248-charming women by the score [he]79-briggs had met and properly appreciated , but never the real , the godlike thing itself . [He]79-briggs used to think , “ If ever [I]79-briggs saw [a perfectly beautiful woman]3080-a perfectly beautiful woman [I]79-briggs should die ”[79-briggs] ; and though , having now met what to [his]79-briggs ideas was [a perfectly beautiful woman]3080-a perfectly beautiful woman , [he]79-briggs did not die , [he]79-briggs became very nearly as incapable of managing [his]79-briggs own affairs as if [he]79-briggs had .

[The others]822-the others were obliged to arrange everything for [him]79-briggs . By questions [they]822-the others extracted from [him]79-briggs that [his]79-briggs luggage was in [the station cloakroom at [Mezzago]32-mezzago]2251-the station cloakroom at mezzago , and [they]822-the others sent for [Domenico]96-domenico , and , urged and prompted by [everybody]2701-everybody except [Scrap]115-scrap , who sat in silence and looked at [no one]310-no one , [Briggs]79-briggs was induced to give [him]96-domenico the necessary instructions for going back in the fly and bringing out [his]79-briggs things .

It was a sad sight to see the collapse of [Briggs]79-briggs . [Everybody]2701-everybody noticed it , even [Rose]80-rose .

“ Upon [my]83-mrs. fisher word , ”[83-mrs. fisher] thought [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , “ the way [one pretty face]3081-one pretty face can turn [a delightful man]3082-a delightful man into [an idiot]3083-an idiot is past all patience . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

And feeling the air getting chilly , and the sight of the enthralled [Briggs]79-briggs painful , [she]83-mrs. fisher went in to order [[his]79-briggs room]2255-his room to be got ready , regretting now that [she]83-mrs. fisher had pressed [the poor boy]2256-the poor boy to stay . [She]83-mrs. fisher had forgotten [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline ’s kill - joy face for the moment , and the more completely owing to the absence of any ill effects produced by it on [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins . [Poor boy]2257-poor boy . [Such a charming boy]2258-such a charming boy too , left to [himself]2258-such a charming boy . It was true [she]83-mrs. fisher could not accuse [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline of not leaving [him]79-briggs to [himself]79-briggs , for [she]83-mrs. fisher was taking no notice of [him]79-briggs at all , but that did not help . Exactly like foolish moths did [men]807-men , in other respects intelligent , flutter round the impassive lighted candle of a pretty face . [She]83-mrs. fisher had seen [them]807-men doing it . [She]83-mrs. fisher had looked on only too often . Almost [she]83-mrs. fisher laid a motherly hand on [Briggs]79-briggs ’s fair head as [she]83-mrs. fisher passed [him]79-briggs . [Poor boy]2257-poor boy .

Then [Scrap]115-scrap , having finished [her]115-scrap cigarette , got up and went [indoors]2261-indoors too . [She]115-scrap saw no reason why [she]115-scrap should sit there in order to gratify [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs ’s desire to stare . [She]115-scrap would have liked to stay out longer , to go to [her]115-scrap corner behind the daphne bushes and look at the sunset sky and watch the lights coming out one by one in [the village]615-the village below and smell the sweet moistness of the evening , but if [she]115-scrap did [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs would certainly follow [her]115-scrap .

The old familiar tyranny had begun again . [Her]83-mrs. fisher holiday of peace and liberation was interrupted — perhaps over , for who knew if [he]79-briggs would go away , after all , to - morrow ? [He]79-briggs might leave [the house]410-the house , driven out of [it]410-the house by [Kate Lumley]137-kate , but there was nothing to prevent [his]79-briggs taking rooms in [the village]615-the village and coming up every day . This tyranny of [one person]2265-one person over another ! And [she]83-mrs. fisher was so miserably constructed that [she]83-mrs. fisher would n’t even be able to frown [him]79-briggs down without being misunderstood .

[Scrap]115-scrap , who loved this time of the evening in [her]115-scrap corner , felt indignant with [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs who was doing [her]115-scrap out of it , and [she]115-scrap turned [her]115-scrap back on [the garden]519-the garden and [him]79-briggs and went towards [the house]410-the house without a look or a word . But [Briggs]79-briggs , when [he]79-briggs realised [her]83-mrs. fisher intention , leapt to [his]79-briggs feet , snatched chairs which were not in [her]83-mrs. fisher way out of it , kicked a footstool which was not in [her]83-mrs. fisher path on one side , hurried to the door , which stood wide open , in order to hold it open , and followed [her]83-mrs. fisher through it , walking by [her]83-mrs. fisher side along [the hall]337-the hall .

What was to be done with [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs ? Well , it was [[his]79-briggs hall]2269-his hall ; [she]83-mrs. fisher could n’t prevent [his]79-briggs walking along [it]2269-his hall .

“ [I]79-briggs hope , ”[79-briggs] [he]79-briggs said , not able while walking to take [his]79-briggs eyes off [her]83-mrs. fisher , so that [he]79-briggs knocked against several things [he]79-briggs would otherwise have avoided — the corner of a bookcase , an ancient carved cupboard , the table with the flowers on it , shaking the water over—“that [you]83-mrs. fisher are quite comfortable [here]478-here ? [His]79-briggs voice vibrated . What was to be done with [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs ? [She]83-mrs. fisher could of course stay in [[her]83-mrs. fisher room]727-her room the whole time , say [she]83-mrs. fisher was ill , not appear at dinner ; but again , the tyranny of this . . .

“ [I]115-scrap ’m very comfortable indeed , ”[115-scrap] said [Scrap]115-scrap .

“ If [I]79-briggs had dreamed [you]83-mrs. fisher were coming — ”[79-briggs] [he]79-briggs began .

“ It ’s [a wonderful old place]3086-a wonderful old place , ”[115-scrap] said [Scrap]115-scrap , doing [her]115-scrap utmost to sound detached and forbidding , but with little hope of success .

[The kitchen]2806-the kitchen was on this floor , and passing [its]2806-the kitchen door , which was open a crack , [they]2272-they were observed by [the servants]423-the servants , whose thoughts , communicated to [each other by looks]2274-each other by looks , may be roughly reproduced by such rude symbols as Aha and Oho — symbols which represented and included [their]423-the servants appreciation of the inevitable , [their]423-the servants foreknowledge of the inevitable , and [their]423-the servants complete understanding and approval .

“ Are [you]83-mrs. fisher going [upstairs]3087-upstairs ? ”[79-briggs] asked [Briggs]79-briggs , as [she]83-mrs. fisher paused at the foot of [them]2272-they .

“ Yes . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

“ In [[my]83-mrs. fisher own room]3090-my own room . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

So then [he]79-briggs could n’t go up with [her]83-mrs. fisher ; so then all [he]79-briggs could do was to wait till [she]83-mrs. fisher came out again .

[He]79-briggs longed to ask [her]83-mrs. fisher which was [[her]83-mrs. fisher own room]1505-her own room — it thrilled [him]79-briggs to hear [her]83-mrs. fisher call [any room in [[his]79-briggs house]501-his house [[her]83-mrs. fisher own room]1505-her own room]2276-any room in his house her own room — that [he]79-briggs might picture [her]83-mrs. fisher in [it]2276-any room in his house her own room . [He]79-briggs would find that out later from [some one else]363-some one else — [Francesca]106-francesca , [anybody]202-anybody .

“ Then [I]202-anybody sha n’t see [you]83-mrs. fisher again till dinner ? ”[202-anybody]

“ Dinner is at eight , ”[115-scrap] was [Scrap]115-scrap ’s evasive answer as [she]83-mrs. fisher went [upstairs]3087-upstairs .

[He]79-briggs watched [her]83-mrs. fisher go .

[She]83-mrs. fisher passed [the Madonna]2283-the madonna , the portrait of [Rose Arbuthnot]80-rose , and the dark - eyed figure [he]79-briggs had thought so sweet seemed to turn pale , to shrivel into insignificance as [she]83-mrs. fisher passed .

[She]83-mrs. fisher turned the bend of the stairs , and the setting sun , shining through the west window a moment on [her]83-mrs. fisher face , turned [her]83-mrs. fisher to glory .

[She]83-mrs. fisher disappeared , and the sun went out too , and [the stairs]1782-the stairs were dark and empty .

[He]79-briggs listened till [her]83-mrs. fisher footsteps were silent , trying to tell from the sound of the shutting door which room [she]83-mrs. fisher had gone into , then wandered aimlessly away through [the hall]337-the hall again , and found [himself]79-briggs back in [the top garden]1097-the top garden .

[Scrap]115-scrap from [her]83-mrs. fisher window saw [him]79-briggs there . [She]83-mrs. fisher saw [Lotty]149-lotty and [Rose]80-rose sitting on the end parapet , where [she]83-mrs. fisher would have liked to have been , and [she]83-mrs. fisher saw [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins buttonholing [Briggs]79-briggs and evidently telling [him]79-briggs the story of the oleander tree in the middle of [the garden]519-the garden .

[Briggs]79-briggs was listening with a patience [she]83-mrs. fisher thought rather nice , seeing that it was [his]79-briggs oleander and [[his]79-briggs own father]2288-his own father ’s story . [She]83-mrs. fisher knew [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins was telling [him]79-briggs the story by [his]65-mr. wilkins gestures . [Domenico]96-domenico had told it [her]83-mrs. fisher soon after [her]83-mrs. fisher arrival , and [he]96-domenico had also told [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , who had told [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins . [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher thought highly of this story , and often spoke of it . It was about a cherrywood walking - stick . [[Briggs]79-briggs ’s father]2289-briggs ’s father had thrust this stick into the ground at that spot , and said to [[Domenico]96-domenico ’s father]2290-domenico ’s father , who was then [the gardener]2775-the gardener , “ Here [we]3091-we will have an oleander . ”[96-domenico] And [[Briggs]79-briggs ’s father]2289-briggs ’s father left the stick in the ground as a reminder to [[Domenico]96-domenico ’s father]2290-domenico ’s father , and presently — how long afterwards [nobody]231-nobody remembered — the stick began to sprout , and it was an oleander .

There stood [poor Mr. Briggs]79-briggs being told all about it , and listening to the story [he]79-briggs must have known from infancy with patience .

Probably [he]79-briggs was thinking of something else . [She]83-mrs. fisher was afraid [he]79-briggs was . How unfortunate , how extremely unfortunate , the determination that seized [people]278-people to get hold of and engulf [other people]2716-other people . If only [they]278-people could be induced to stand more on [their]278-people own feet . Why could n’t [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs be more like [Lotty]149-lotty , who never wanted anything of [anybody]202-anybody , but was complete in [herself]149-lotty and respected [other people]2716-other people ’s completeness ? [One]235-one loved being with [Lotty]149-lotty . With [her]83-mrs. fisher one was free , and yet befriended . [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs looked so really nice , too . [She]83-mrs. fisher thought [she]83-mrs. fisher might like [him]79-briggs if only [he]79-briggs would n’t so excessively like [her]83-mrs. fisher .

[Scrap]115-scrap felt melancholy . Here [she]115-scrap was shut up in [[her]115-scrap bedroom]1070-her bedroom , which was stuffy from the afternoon sun that had been pouring into it , instead of out in [the cool garden]2301-the cool garden , and all because of [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs .

Intolerable tyranny , [she]115-scrap thought , flaring up . [She]115-scrap would n’t endure it ; [she]115-scrap would go out all the same ; [she]115-scrap would run [downstairs]1768-downstairs while [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins — really [that man]1290-that man was a treasure — held [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs down telling [him]65-mr. wilkins about the oleander , and get out of [the house]410-the house by the front door , and take cover in the shadows of [the zigzag path]837-the zigzag path . [Nobody]231-nobody could see [her]115-scrap there ; [nobody]231-nobody would think of looking for [her]115-scrap there .

[She]115-scrap snatched up a wrap , for [she]115-scrap did not mean to come back for a long while , perhaps not even to dinner — it would be all [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs ’s fault if [she]115-scrap went dinnerless and hungry — and with another glance out of the window to see if [she]115-scrap were still safe , [she]115-scrap stole out and got away to the sheltering trees of [the zigzag path]837-the zigzag path , and there sat down on one of the seats placed at each bend to assist the upward journey of [those who were breathless]2309-those who were breathless .

Ah , this was lovely , thought [Scrap]115-scrap with a sigh of relief . How cool . How good it smelt . [She]115-scrap could see the quiet water of [the little harbour]982-the little harbour through the pine trunks , and the lights coming out in [the houses on the other side]2311-the houses on the other side , and all round [her]115-scrap the green dusk was splashed by the rose - pink of the gladioluses in the grass and the white of the crowding daisies .

Ah , this was lovely . So still . Nothing moving — not a leaf , not a stalk . The only sound was a dog barking , far away somewhere up on [the hills]1554-the hills , or when the door of [the little restaurant in [the piazza below]2314-the piazza below]2313-the little restaurant in the piazza below was opened and there was a burst of voices , silenced again immediately by the swinging to of the door .

[She]115-scrap drew in a deep breath of pleasure . Ah , this was —

[Her]115-scrap deep breath was arrested in the middle . What was that ?

[She]115-scrap leaned forward listening , [her]115-scrap body tense .

Footsteps . On [the zigzag path]837-the zigzag path . [Briggs]79-briggs . Finding [her]115-scrap out .

Should [she]115-scrap run ?

No — the footsteps were coming up , not down . [Some one from [the village]615-the village]2316-some one from the village . Perhaps [Angelo]172-angelo , with provisions .

[She]115-scrap relaxed again . But the steps were not the steps of [Angelo]172-angelo , [that swift and springy youth]2318-that swift and springy youth ; they were slow and considered , and [they]2319-they kept on pausing .

“ [Some one who is n’t used to hills]3092-some one who is n’t used to hills , ”[115-scrap] thought [Scrap]115-scrap .

The idea of going back to [the house]410-the house did not occur to [her]115-scrap . [She]115-scrap was afraid of nothing in life except love . [Brigands]2321-brigands or [murderers as such]2322-murderers as such held no terrors for [the daughter of [the Droitwiches]152-the droitwiches]2989-the daughter of the droitwiches ; [she]115-scrap only would have been afraid of [them]2324-them if [they]2324-them left off being [brigands]2321-brigands and [murderers]2326-murderers and began instead to try and make love .

The next moment the footsteps turned the corner of [her]115-scrap bit of path , and stood still .

“ Getting [his]172-angelo wind , ”[115-scrap] thought [Scrap]115-scrap , not looking round .

Then as [he]172-angelo — from the sounds of the steps [she]115-scrap took them to belong to [a man]662-a man — did not move , [she]115-scrap turned [her]115-scrap head , and beheld with astonishment [a person [she]115-scrap had seen a good deal of lately in [London]2-london]2328-a person she had seen a good deal of lately in london , [the well - known writer of amusing memoirs]2329-the well - known writer of amusing memoirs , [Mr. Ferdinand Arundel]173-mr. arundel .

[She]115-scrap stared . Nothing in the way of being followed surprised [her]115-scrap any more , but that [he]172-angelo should have discovered where [she]115-scrap was surprised [her]115-scrap . [[Her]115-scrap mother]1033-her mother had promised faithfully to tell [no one]310-no one .

“ [You]172-angelo ? ”[115-scrap] [she]115-scrap said , feeling betrayed . “ Here ? ”[115-scrap]

[He]172-angelo came up to [her]115-scrap and took off [his]172-angelo hat . [His]172-angelo forehead beneath the hat was wet with the beads of unaccustomed climbing . [He]172-angelo looked ashamed and entreating , like a guilty but devoted dog .

“ [You]115-scrap must forgive [me]172-angelo , ”[172-angelo] [he]172-angelo said . “ [Lady Droitwich]157-lady droitwich told [me]172-angelo where [you]115-scrap were , and as [I]172-angelo happened to be passing through on [my]172-angelo way to [Rome]50-rome [I]172-angelo thought [I]172-angelo would get out at [Mezzago]32-mezzago and just look in and see how [you]115-scrap were . ”[172-angelo]

“ But — didn’t [[my]172-angelo mother]2823-my mother tell [you]115-scrap [I]172-angelo was doing a rest - cure ? ”[172-angelo]

“ Yes . [She]2823-my mother did . And that ’s why [I]172-angelo have n’t intruded on [you]115-scrap earlier in the day . [I]172-angelo thought [you]115-scrap would probably sleep all day , and wake up about now so as to be fed . ”[172-angelo]

“ But — ”[172-angelo]

“ [I]172-angelo know . [I]172-angelo ’ve got nothing to say in excuse . [I]172-angelo could n’t help [myself]172-angelo . ”[172-angelo]

“ This , ”[115-scrap] thought [Scrap]115-scrap , “ comes of [mother]1438-mother insisting on having authors to lunch , and [me]115-scrap being so much more amiable in appearance than [I]115-scrap really am . ”[115-scrap]

[She]115-scrap had been amiable to [Ferdinand Arundel]173-mr. arundel ; [she]115-scrap liked [him]173-mr. arundel — or rather [she]115-scrap did not dislike [him]173-mr. arundel . [He]173-mr. arundel seemed [a jovial , simple man]2332-a jovial , simple man , and had the eyes of a nice dog . Also , though it was evident that [he]173-mr. arundel admired [her]115-scrap , [he]173-mr. arundel had not in [London]2-london grabbed . There [he]173-mr. arundel had merely been [a good - natured , harmless person of entertaining conversation]2333-a good - natured , harmless person of entertaining conversation , who helped to make luncheons agreeable . Now it appeared that [he]173-mr. arundel too was [a grabber]2334-a grabber . Fancy following [her]115-scrap out there — daring to . [Nobody else]2335-nobody else had . Perhaps [[her]115-scrap mother]1033-her mother had given [him]173-mr. arundel the address because [she]1033-her mother considered [him]173-mr. arundel so absolutely harmless , and thought [he]173-mr. arundel might be useful and see [her]1033-her mother [home]222-home .

Well , whatever [he]173-mr. arundel was [he]173-mr. arundel could n’t possibly give [her]115-scrap the trouble [an active young man like [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs]2338-an active young man like mr. briggs might give [her]115-scrap . [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs , infatuated , would be reckless , [she]115-scrap felt , would stick at nothing , would lose [his]79-briggs head publicly . [She]115-scrap could imagine [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs doing things with rope - ladders , and singing all night under [her]115-scrap window — being really difficult and uncomfortable . [Mr. Arundel]173-mr. arundel had n’t the figure for any kind of recklessness . [He]173-mr. arundel had lived too long and too well . [She]115-scrap was sure [he]173-mr. arundel could n’t sing , and would n’t want to . [He]173-mr. arundel must be at least forty . How many good dinners could not [a man]662-a man have eaten by the time [he]173-mr. arundel was forty ? And if during that time instead of taking exercise [he]173-mr. arundel had sat writing books , [he]173-mr. arundel would quite naturally acquire the figure [Mr. Arundel]173-mr. arundel had in fact acquired — the figure rather for conversation than adventure .

[Scrap]115-scrap , who had become melancholy at the sight of [Briggs]79-briggs , became philosophical at the sight of [Arundel]173-mr. arundel . Here [he]173-mr. arundel was . [She]115-scrap could n’t send [him]173-mr. arundel away till after dinner . [He]173-mr. arundel must be nourished .

This being so , [she]115-scrap had better make the best of it , and do that with a good grace which anyhow was n’t to be avoided . Besides , [he]173-mr. arundel would be a temporary shelter from [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs . [She]115-scrap was at least acquainted with [Ferdinand Arundel]173-mr. arundel , and could hear news from [him]173-mr. arundel of [[her]115-scrap mother]1033-her mother and [[her]115-scrap friends]490-her friends , and such talk would put up a defensive barrier at dinner between [herself]115-scrap and the approaches of [the other one]1213-the other one . And it was only for one dinner , and [he]173-mr. arundel could n’t eat [her]115-scrap .

[She]115-scrap therefore prepared [herself]115-scrap for friendliness . “ [I]115-scrap ’m to be fed , ”[115-scrap] [she]115-scrap said , ignoring [his]173-mr. arundel last remark , “ at eight , and [you]173-mr. arundel must come up and be fed too . Sit down and get cool and tell [me]115-scrap how [everybody]2701-everybody is . ”[115-scrap]

“ May [I]173-mr. arundel really dine with [you]115-scrap ? In these travelling things ? ”[173-mr. arundel] [he]173-mr. arundel said , wiping [his]173-mr. arundel forehead before sitting down beside [her]115-scrap .

[She]115-scrap was too lovely to be true , [he]173-mr. arundel thought . Just to look at [her]115-scrap for an hour , just to hear [her]115-scrap voice , was enough reward for [his]173-mr. arundel journey and [his]173-mr. arundel fears .

“ Of course . [I]115-scrap suppose [you]115-scrap ’ve left [your]115-scrap fly in [the village]615-the village , and will be going on from [Mezzago]32-mezzago by [the night train]2235-the night train . ”[115-scrap]

“ Or stay in [Mezzago]32-mezzago in [an hotel]1163-an hotel and go on to - morrow . But tell [me]173-mr. arundel , ”[173-mr. arundel] [he]173-mr. arundel said , gazing at the adorable profile , “ about [yourself]115-scrap . [London]2-london has been extraordinarily dull and empty . [Lady Droitwich]157-lady droitwich said [you]115-scrap were with [people]278-people [here]478-here [she]157-lady droitwich did n’t know . [I]173-mr. arundel hope [they]278-people ’ve been kind to [you]115-scrap ? [You]115-scrap look — well , as if [your]115-scrap cure had done everything a cure should . ”[173-mr. arundel]

“ [They]278-people ’ve been very kind , ”[115-scrap] said [Scrap]115-scrap . “ [I]115-scrap got [them]278-people out of an advertisement . ”[115-scrap]

“ An advertisement ? ”[115-scrap]

“ It ’s a good way , [I]115-scrap find , to get [friends]2712-friends . [I]115-scrap ’m fonder of one of these than [I]115-scrap ’ve been of [anybody]202-anybody in years . ”[115-scrap]

Chapter 20

[Scrap]115-scrap wanted to know so much about [[her]2344-her mother]1033-her mother that [Arundel]173-mr. arundel had presently to invent . [He]2343-he would talk about anything [she]2344-her wished if only [he]2343-he might be with [her]2344-her for a while and see [her]2344-her and hear [her]2344-her , but [he]2343-he knew very little of [the Droitwiches]152-the droitwiches and [[their]152-the droitwiches friends]2347-their friends really — beyond meeting [them]152-the droitwiches at those bigger functions where literature is also represented , and amusing [them]152-the droitwiches at luncheons and dinners , [he]2343-he knew very little of [them]152-the droitwiches really . But [he]2343-he was , however , good at inventing ; and as soon as [he]2343-he had come to an end of first - hand knowledge , in order to answer [her]2344-her inquiries and keep [her]2344-her there to [himself]2343-he [he]2343-he proceeded to invent . [Scrap]115-scrap , who had that affection for [[her]2344-her parents]1095-her parents which warms in absence , was athirst for news , and became more and more interested by the news [he]2343-he gradually imparted .

At first it was ordinary news . [He]2343-he had met [[her]2344-her mother]1033-her mother here , and seen [her]1033-her mother [there]296-there . [She]1033-her mother looked very well ; [she]1033-her mother said so and so . But presently the things [Lady Droitwich]157-lady droitwich had said took on an unusual quality : they became amusing .

“ [Mother]1438-mother said that ? ”[115-scrap] [Scrap]115-scrap interrupted , surprised .

And presently [Lady Droitwich]157-lady droitwich began to do amusing things as well as say them .

“ [Mother]1438-mother did that ? ”[115-scrap] [Scrap]115-scrap inquired , wide - eyed .

[Arundel]173-mr. arundel warmed to [his]173-mr. arundel work . [Scrap]115-scrap ’s eyes grew round with wonder and affectionate pride in [[her]115-scrap mother]1033-her mother . Why , but how funny — [fancy mother]2355-fancy mother . [She]1033-her mother laughed and laughed , and had a great longing to hug [[her]1033-her mother mother]1033-her mother , and the time flew , and it grew quite dusk , and it grew nearly dark , and [Mr. Arundel]173-mr. arundel still went on amusing [her]1033-her mother , and it was a quarter to eight before [she]1033-her mother suddenly remembered dinner .

“ Yes . It ’s late , ”[173-mr. arundel] said [Arundel]173-mr. arundel .

And [she]1033-her mother was gone up [the path]704-the path with the swiftness of a young , slender deer .

[Arundel]173-mr. arundel followed . [He]173-mr. arundel did not wish to arrive too hot , so had to go slowly . [Rose]80-rose was quite aware of what had happened to [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs . It had been funny and delightful , that little interlude of admiration , but of course it could n’t go on once [Caroline]82-lady caroline appeared . [Rose]80-rose knew [her]149-lotty place . [They]2372-they seemed to quicken unsuspected faculties into life . [She]149-lotty was sure [she]149-lotty had been [a thoroughly amusing woman]2373-a thoroughly amusing woman between lunch and tea , and [a pretty one]2374-a pretty one too . [She]149-lotty was quite certain [she]149-lotty had been pretty ; [she]149-lotty saw it in [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs ’s eyes as clearly as in a looking - glass . [She]149-lotty still buzzed , [she]149-lotty still tingled , just at the remembrance . What fun it had been , having [an admirer]2376-an admirer even for that little while . No wonder [people]278-people liked [admirers]2378-admirers . [They]2378-admirers seemed , in some strange way , to make [one]235-one come alive .

Although it was all over [she]149-lotty still glowed with it and felt more exhilarated , more optimistic , more as [Lotty]149-lotty probably constantly felt , than [she]149-lotty had done since [she]149-lotty was [a girl]2717-a girl . [She]149-lotty dressed with care , though [she]149-lotty knew [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs would no longer see [her]149-lotty , but it gave [her]149-lotty pleasure to see how pretty , while [she]149-lotty was about it , [she]149-lotty could make [herself]149-lotty look ; and very nearly [she]149-lotty stuck a crimson camellia in [her]149-lotty hair down by [her]149-lotty ear . [She]149-lotty did hold it there for a minute , and it looked almost sinfully attractive and was exactly the colour of [her]149-lotty mouth , but [she]149-lotty took it out again with a smile and a sigh and put it in the proper place for flowers , which is water . [She]149-lotty must n’t be silly , [she]149-lotty thought . Think of [the poor]226-the poor . But on one thing [she]149-lotty was determined : the first thing [she]149-lotty would do when [she]149-lotty got [home]222-home would be to have it out with [Frederick]75-frederick . This separate life , this freezing loneliness , [she]149-lotty had had enough of it . Why should n’t [she]149-lotty too be happy ? Why on [earth]2384-earth — the energetic expression matched [her]149-lotty mood of rebelliousness — shouldn’t [she]149-lotty too be loved and allowed to love ?

[She]149-lotty looked at [her]149-lotty little clock . Still ten minutes before dinner . Tired of staying in [[her]149-lotty bedroom]1070-her bedroom [she]149-lotty thought [she]149-lotty would go on to [[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s battlements]2386-mrs. fisher ’s battlements , which would be empty at this hour , and watch the moon rise out of [the sea]2735-the sea .

[She]149-lotty went into [the deserted upper hall]2388-the deserted upper hall with this intention , but was attracted on [her]149-lotty way along [it]2388-the deserted upper hall by the firelight shining through the open door of [the drawing - room]1518-the drawing - room .

How gay [it]2390-it looked . The fire transformed [the room]219-the room . [A dark , ugly room]2392-a dark , ugly room in the daytime , [it]219-the room was transformed just as [she]149-lotty had been transformed by the warmth of — no , [she]149-lotty would n’t be silly ; [she]149-lotty would think of [the poor]226-the poor ; the thought of [them]226-the poor always brought [her]149-lotty down to sobriety at once .

[She]149-lotty peeped in . Firelight and flowers ; and outside the deep slits of windows hung the blue curtain of the night . How pretty . What [a sweet place [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore was]2394-a sweet place san salvatore was . And that gorgeous lilac on the table — [she]149-lotty must go and put [her]149-lotty face in it . . .

But [she]149-lotty never got to the lilac . [She]149-lotty went one step towards it , and then stood still , for [she]149-lotty had seen [the figure]2395-the figure looking out of the window in the farthest corner , and it was [Frederick]75-frederick .

All the blood in [Rose]80-rose ’s body rushed to [her]149-lotty heart and seemed to stop its beating .

[Frederick]75-frederick . Come .

[She]149-lotty stood quite still . [He]75-frederick had not heard [her]149-lotty . [He]75-frederick did not turn round . [She]149-lotty stood looking at [him]75-frederick . The miracle had happened , and [he]75-frederick had come .

[She]149-lotty stood holding [her]149-lotty breath . So [he]75-frederick needed [her]149-lotty , for [he]75-frederick had come instantly . So [he]75-frederick too must have been thinking , longing . . .

[Her]149-lotty heart , which had seemed to stop beating , was suffocating [her]149-lotty now , the way it raced along . It was a miracle . [God]73-god could do miracles . [God]73-god had done this one . [God]73-god could — [God]73-god could — could —

[Her]149-lotty mind stammered again , and broke off .

“ [Frederick]75-frederick — ”[149-lotty] [she]149-lotty tried to say ; but no sound came , or if it did the crackling of the fire covered it up .

[She]149-lotty must go nearer . [She]149-lotty began to creep towards [him]75-frederick — softly , softly .

[He]75-frederick did not move . [He]75-frederick had not heard .

[She]149-lotty stole nearer and nearer , and the fire crackled and [he]75-frederick heard nothing .

[She]149-lotty stopped a moment , unable to breathe . [She]149-lotty was afraid . Suppose [he]75-frederick — suppose [he]75-frederick — oh , but [he]75-frederick had come , [he]75-frederick had come .

[She]149-lotty went on again , close up to [him]75-frederick , and [her]149-lotty heart beat so loud that [she]149-lotty thought [he]75-frederick must hear it . And could n’t [he]75-frederick feel — didn’t [he]75-frederick know —

“ [Frederick]75-frederick , ”[149-lotty] [she]149-lotty whispered , hardly able even to whisper , choked by the beating of [her]149-lotty heart .

[He]75-frederick spun round on [his]75-frederick heels .

Chapter 21

Now [Frederick]75-frederick was not the man to hurt anything if [he]75-frederick could help it ; besides , [he]75-frederick was completely bewildered . Not only was [[his]75-frederick wife]244-his wife [here]478-here — here , of all places in [the world]186-the world — but [she]244-his wife was clinging to [him]75-frederick as [she]244-his wife had not clung for years , and murmuring love , and welcoming [him]75-frederick . If [she]244-his wife welcomed [him]75-frederick [she]244-his wife must have been expecting [him]75-frederick . Strange as this was , it was the only thing in the situation which was evident — that , and the softness of [her]244-his wife cheek against [his]75-frederick , and the long - forgotten sweet smell of [her]244-his wife .

[Frederick]75-frederick was bewildered . But not being [the man]679-the man to hurt anything if [he]75-frederick could help it [he]75-frederick too put [his]75-frederick arms round [her]244-his wife , and having put them round [her]244-his wife [he]75-frederick also kissed [her]244-his wife ; and presently [he]75-frederick was kissing [her]244-his wife almost as tenderly as [she]244-his wife was kissing [him]75-frederick ; and presently [he]75-frederick was kissing [her]244-his wife quite as tenderly ; and again presently [he]75-frederick was kissing [her]244-his wife more tenderly , and just as if [he]75-frederick had never left off .

[He]75-frederick was bewildered , but [he]75-frederick still could kiss . It seemed curiously natural to be doing it . It made [him]75-frederick feel as if [he]75-frederick were thirty again instead of forty , and [Rose]80-rose were [his]75-frederick Rose of twenty , the Rose [he]75-frederick had so much adored before [she]244-his wife began to weigh what [he]75-frederick did with [her]244-his wife idea of right , and the balance went against [him]75-frederick , and [she]244-his wife had turned strange , and stony , and more and more shocked , and oh , so lamentable . [He]75-frederick could n’t get at [her]244-his wife in those days at all ; [she]244-his wife would n’t , [she]244-his wife could n’t understand . [She]244-his wife kept on referring everything to what [she]244-his wife called [God]73-god ’s eyes — in [God]73-god ’s eyes it could n’t be right , it was n’t right . [Her]244-his wife miserable face — whatever [her]244-his wife principles did for [her]244-his wife they did n’t make [her]244-his wife happy — [her]244-his wife little miserable face , twisted with effort to be patient , had been at last more than [he]75-frederick could bear to see , and [he]75-frederick had kept away as much as [he]75-frederick could . [She]244-his wife never ought to have been [the daughter of [a low - church rector]2401-a low - church rector]2400-the daughter of a low - church rector — [narrow devil]2402-narrow devil ; [she]244-his wife was quite unfitted to stand up against such an upbringing .

What had happened , why [she]244-his wife was here , why [she]244-his wife was [his]75-frederick [Rose]80-rose again , passed [his]75-frederick comprehension ; and meanwhile , and until such time as [he]75-frederick understood , [he]75-frederick still could kiss . In fact [he]75-frederick could not stop kissing ; and it was [he]75-frederick now who began to murmur , to say love things in [her]244-his wife ear under the hair that smelt so sweet and tickled [him]75-frederick just as [he]75-frederick remembered it used to tickle [him]75-frederick .

And as [he]75-frederick held [her]244-his wife close to [his]75-frederick heart and [her]244-his wife arms were soft round [his]75-frederick neck , [he]75-frederick felt stealing over [him]75-frederick a delicious sense of — at first [he]75-frederick did n’t know what it was , this delicate , pervading warmth , and then [he]75-frederick recognised it as security . Yes ; security . No need now to be ashamed of [his]75-frederick figure , and to make jokes about it so as to forestall [other people]2716-other people ’s and show [he]75-frederick did n’t mind it ; no need now to be ashamed of getting hot going up hills , or to torment [himself]75-frederick with pictures of how [he]75-frederick probably appeared to [beautiful young women]2404-beautiful young women — how middle - aged , how absurd in [his]75-frederick inability to keep away from [them]2404-beautiful young women . [Rose]80-rose cared nothing for such things . With [her]244-his wife [he]75-frederick was safe . To [her]244-his wife [he]75-frederick was [[her]244-his wife lover]342-her lover , as [he]75-frederick used to be ; and [she]244-his wife would never notice or mind any of the ignoble changes that getting older had made in [him]75-frederick and would go on making more and more .

[Frederick]75-frederick continued , therefore , with greater and greater warmth and growing delight to kiss [[his]75-frederick wife]244-his wife , and the mere holding of [her]244-his wife in [his]75-frederick arms caused [him]75-frederick to forget everything else . How could [he]75-frederick , for instance , remember or think of [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , to mention only one of the complications with which [his]75-frederick situation bristled , when here was [[his]75-frederick sweet wife]2407-his sweet wife , miraculously restored to [him]75-frederick , whispering with [her]244-his wife cheek against [his]75-frederick in the dearest , most romantic words how much [she]244-his wife loved [him]75-frederick , how terribly [she]244-his wife had missed [him]75-frederick ? [He]75-frederick did for one brief instant , for even in moments of love there are brief instants of lucid thought , recognise the immense power of [the woman present]2408-the woman present and being actually held compared to that of the woman , however beautiful , who is somewhere else , but that is as far as [he]75-frederick got towards remembering [Scrap]115-scrap ; no farther . [She]244-his wife was like a dream , fleeing before the morning light .

“ When did [you]75-frederick start ? ”[80-rose] murmured [Rose]80-rose , [her]244-his wife mouth on [his]75-frederick ear . [She]244-his wife could n’t let [him]75-frederick go ; not even to talk [she]244-his wife could n’t let [him]75-frederick go .

“ Yesterday morning , ”[75-frederick] murmured [Frederick]75-frederick , holding [her]244-his wife close . [He]75-frederick could n’t let [her]244-his wife go either .

“ Oh — the very instant then , ”[80-rose] murmured [Rose]80-rose .

This was cryptic , but [Frederick]75-frederick said , “ Yes , the very instant , ”[75-frederick] and kissed [her]244-his wife neck .

“ How quickly [my]80-rose letter got to [you]75-frederick , ”[80-rose] murmured [Rose]80-rose , whose eyes were shut in the excess of [her]244-his wife happiness .

“ Did n’t it , ”[75-frederick] said [Frederick]75-frederick , who felt like shutting [his]75-frederick eyes [himself]75-frederick .

So there had been a letter . Soon , no doubt , light would be vouchsafed [him]75-frederick , and meanwhile this was so strangely , touchingly sweet , this holding [his]75-frederick Rose to [his]75-frederick heart again after all the years , that [he]75-frederick could n’t bother to try to guess anything . Oh , [he]75-frederick had been happy during these years , because it was not in [him]75-frederick to be unhappy ; besides , how many interests life had had to offer [him]75-frederick , how many [friends]2712-friends , how much success , how many women only too willing to help [him]75-frederick to blot out the thought of [the altered , petrified , pitiful little wife at [home]222-home who would n’t spend [his]75-frederick money , who was appalled by [his]75-frederick books , who drifted away and away from [him]75-frederick , and always if [he]75-frederick tried to have it out with [her]244-his wife]2410-the altered , petrified , pitiful little wife at home who would n’t spend his money , who was appalled by his books , who drifted away and away from him , and always if he tried to have it out with her asked [him]75-frederick with patient obstinacy what [he]75-frederick thought the things [he]75-frederick wrote and lived by looked in the eyes of [God]73-god . “ [No one]310-no one , ”[244-his wife] [she]244-his wife said once , “ should ever write a book [God]73-god would n’t like to read . That is the test , [Frederick]75-frederick . ”[244-his wife] And [he]75-frederick had laughed hysterically , burst into a great shriek of laughter , and rushed out of [the house]410-the house , away from [her]244-his wife solemn little face — away from [her]244-his wife pathetic , solemn little face . . .

But this [Rose]80-rose was [his]75-frederick youth again , the best part of [his]75-frederick life , the part of it that had had all the visions in it and all the hopes . How [they]2413-they had dreamed together , [he]75-frederick and [she]244-his wife , before [he]75-frederick struck that vein of memoirs ; how [they]2413-they had planned , and laughed , and loved . [They]2413-they had lived for a while in the very heart of poetry . After the happy days came the happy nights , the happy , happy nights , with [her]244-his wife asleep close against [his]75-frederick heart , with [her]244-his wife when [he]75-frederick woke in the morning still close against [his]75-frederick heart , for [they]2413-they hardly moved in [their]2413-they deep , happy sleep . It was wonderful to have it all come back to [him]75-frederick at the touch of [her]244-his wife , at the feel of [her]244-his wife face against [his]75-frederick — wonderful that [she]244-his wife should be able to give [him]75-frederick back [his]75-frederick youth .

“ [Sweetheart]174-sweetheart — sweetheart , ”[75-frederick] [he]75-frederick murmured , overcome by remembrance , clinging to [her]244-his wife now in [his]75-frederick turn .

“ [Beloved husband]3118-beloved husband , ”[244-his wife] [she]244-his wife breathed — the bliss of it — the sheer bliss . . .

[Briggs]83-mrs. fisher , coming in a few minutes before the gong went on the chance that [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline might be there , was much astonished . [He]75-frederick had supposed [Rose Arbuthnot]80-rose was [a widow]447-a widow , and [he]75-frederick still supposed it ; so that [he]75-frederick was much astonished .

“ Well [I]83-mrs. fisher ’m damned , ”[83-mrs. fisher] thought [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher , quite clearly and distinctly , for the shock of what [he]75-frederick saw in the window startled [him]75-frederick so much that for a moment [he]75-frederick was shaken free of [his]75-frederick own confused absorption .

Aloud [he]75-frederick said , very red , “ Oh [I]75-frederick say — [I]75-frederick beg [your]2416-they pardon”—and[75-frederick] then stood hesitating , and wondering whether [he]75-frederick ought n’t to go back to [[his]75-frederick bedroom]2415-his bedroom again .

If [he]75-frederick had said nothing [they]2416-they would not have noticed [he]75-frederick was there , but when [he]75-frederick begged [their]2416-they pardon [Rose]80-rose turned and looked at [him]75-frederick as [one looks who is trying to remember]2417-one looks who is trying to remember , and [Frederick]75-frederick looked at [him]75-frederick too without at first quite seeing [him]75-frederick .

[They]2416-they did n’t seem , thought [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher , to mind or to be at all embarrassed . [He]75-frederick could n’t be [[her]2418-her brother]1013-her brother ; [no brother]2420-no brother ever brought that look into [a woman]804-a woman ’s face . It was very awkward . If [they]2416-they did n’t mind , [he]75-frederick did . It upset [him]75-frederick to come across [[his]75-frederick Madonna]2422-his madonna forgetting [herself]2422-his madonna .

“ Is [this one of [[your]2418-her friends]3120-your friends]3119-this one of your friends ? ”[75-frederick] [Frederick]75-frederick was able after an instant to ask [Rose]80-rose , who made no attempt to introduce [the young man]2423-the young man standing awkwardly in front of [them]2416-they but continued to gaze at [him]75-frederick with a kind of abstracted , radiant goodwill .

“ It ’s [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs , ”[80-rose] said [Rose]80-rose , recognizing [him]75-frederick . “ This is [[my]2422-his madonna husband]2697-my husband , ”[2422-his madonna] [she]2422-his madonna added .

And [Briggs]79-briggs , shaking hands , just had time to think how surprising it was to have [a husband]286-a husband when [you]2425-you were [a widow]447-a widow before the gong sounded , and [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline would be [there]296-there in a minute , and [he]79-briggs ceased to be able to think at all , and merely became a thing with its eyes fixed on the door .

Through the door immediately entered , in what seemed to [him]79-briggs an endless procession , first [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , very stately in [her]83-mrs. fisher evening lace shawl and brooch , who when [she]83-mrs. fisher saw [him]75-frederick at once relaxed into smiles and benignity , only to stiffen , however , when [she]83-mrs. fisher caught sight of [the stranger]2428-the stranger ; then [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , cleaner and neater and more carefully dressed and brushed than [any man on earth]2429-any man on earth ; and then , tying something hurriedly as [she]83-mrs. fisher came , [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ; and then [nobody]231-nobody .

[Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline was late . Where was [she]82-lady caroline ? Had [she]82-lady caroline heard the gong ? Ought n’t it to be beaten again ? Suppose [she]82-lady caroline did n’t come to dinner after all . . .

[Briggs]79-briggs went cold .

“ Introduce [me]75-frederick , ”[75-frederick] said [Frederick]75-frederick on [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s entrance , touching [Rose]80-rose ’s elbow .

“ [[My]80-rose husband]2697-my husband , ”[80-rose] said [Rose]80-rose , holding [him]75-frederick by the hand , [her]83-mrs. fisher face exquisite .

“ This , ”[83-mrs. fisher] thought [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , “ must now be the last of [the husbands]3123-the husbands , unless [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline produces one from up [her]82-lady caroline sleeve . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

But [she]83-mrs. fisher received [him]75-frederick graciously , for [he]75-frederick certainly looked exactly like [a husband]286-a husband , not at all like one of [those people who go about abroad pretending [they]2432-those people who go about abroad pretending they are husbands when they are not are [husbands]2800-husbands when [they]2432-those people who go about abroad pretending they are husbands when they are not are not]2432-those people who go about abroad pretending they are husbands when they are not , and said [she]83-mrs. fisher supposed [he]75-frederick had come to accompany [[his]75-frederick wife]244-his wife [home]222-home at the end of the month , and remarked that now [the house]410-the house would be completely full . “ So that , ”[83-mrs. fisher] [she]83-mrs. fisher added , smiling at [Briggs]79-briggs , “ [we]3124-we shall at last really be getting [our]3124-we money ’s worth . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

[Briggs]79-briggs grinned automatically , because [he]75-frederick was just able to realise that [somebody]996-somebody was being playful with [him]75-frederick , but [he]75-frederick had not heard [her]996-somebody and [he]75-frederick did not look at [her]996-somebody . Not only were [his]75-frederick eyes fixed on the door but [his]75-frederick whole body was concentrated on it .

Introduced in [his]75-frederick turn , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins was most hospitable and called [Frederick]75-frederick “ [sir]3125-sir . ”[75-frederick]

“ Well , [sir]3125-sir , ”[65-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins heartily , “ here [we]3127-we are , here [we]3127-we are”—and[65-mr. wilkins] having gripped [his]75-frederick hand with an understanding that only was n’t mutual because [Arbuthnot]80-rose did not yet know what [he]75-frederick was in for in the way of trouble , [he]65-mr. wilkins looked at [him]80-rose as [a man]662-a man should , squarely in the eyes , and allowed [his]65-mr. wilkins look to convey as plainly as a look can that in [him]75-frederick would be found staunchness , integrity , reliability — in fact [a friend in need]2439-a friend in need . [Mrs. Arbuthnot]67-mrs. arbuthnot was very much flushed , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins noticed . [He]65-mr. wilkins had not seen [her]67-mrs. arbuthnot flushed like that before . “ Well , [I]65-mr. wilkins ’m [[their]3128-their man]2170-their man , ”[65-mr. wilkins] [he]65-mr. wilkins thought .

[Lotty]149-lotty ’s greeting was effusive . It was done with both hands . “ Did n’t [I]149-lotty tell [you]75-frederick ? ”[149-lotty] [she]149-lotty laughed to [Rose]80-rose over [her]149-lotty shoulder while [Frederick]75-frederick was shaking [her]149-lotty hands in both [his]75-frederick .

“ What did [you]2441-the sandy but agreeable young woman tell [her]2441-the sandy but agreeable young woman ? ”[75-frederick] asked [Frederick]75-frederick , in order to say something . The way [they]2440-they were all welcoming [him]75-frederick was confusing . [They]2440-they had evidently all expected [him]75-frederick , not only [Rose]80-rose .

[The sandy but agreeable young woman]2441-the sandy but agreeable young woman did n’t answer [his]75-frederick question , but looked extraordinarily pleased to see [him]75-frederick . Why should [she]2441-the sandy but agreeable young woman be extraordinarily pleased to see [him]75-frederick ?

“ What a delightful place this is , ”[75-frederick] said [Frederick]75-frederick , confused , and making the first remark that occurred to [him]75-frederick .

“ It ’s a tub of love , ”[2442-the sandy young woman] said [the sandy young woman]2442-the sandy young woman earnestly ; which confused [him]75-frederick more than ever .

And [his]75-frederick confusion became excessive at the next words [he]75-frederick heard — spoken , these , by [the old lady]1547-the old lady , who said : “ [We]3130-we wo n’t wait . [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline is always late”—for[1547-the old lady] [he]75-frederick only then , on hearing [her]1547-the old lady name , really and properly remembered [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , and the thought of [her]1547-the old lady confused [him]75-frederick to excess .

[He]75-frederick went into [the dining - room]856-the dining - room like [a man in a dream]2445-a man in a dream . [He]75-frederick had come out to [this place]2843-this place to see [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , and had told [her]82-lady caroline so . [He]75-frederick had even told [her]82-lady caroline in [his]75-frederick fatuousness — it was true , but how fatuous — that [he]75-frederick had n’t been able to help coming . [She]82-lady caroline did n’t know [he]75-frederick was married . [She]82-lady caroline thought [his]75-frederick name was [Arundel]173-mr. arundel . [Everybody in [London]2-london]2447-everybody in london thought [his]75-frederick name was [Arundel]173-mr. arundel . [He]75-frederick had used it and written under it so long that [he]75-frederick almost thought it was [himself]75-frederick . In the short time since [she]82-lady caroline had left [him]75-frederick on the seat in [the garden]519-the garden , where [he]75-frederick told [her]82-lady caroline [he]75-frederick had come because [he]75-frederick could n’t help it , [he]75-frederick had found [Rose]80-rose again , had passionately embraced and been embraced , and had forgotten [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline . It would be an extraordinary piece of good fortune if [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline ’s being late meant [she]82-lady caroline was tired or bored and would not come to dinner at all . Then [he]75-frederick could — no , [he]75-frederick could n’t . [He]75-frederick turned a deeper red even than usual , [he]75-frederick being [a man of full habit and red anyhow , at the thought of such cowardice]2449-a man of full habit and red anyhow , at the thought of such cowardice . No , [he]75-frederick could n’t go away after dinner and catch [his]75-frederick train and disappear to [Rome]50-rome ; not unless , that is , [Rose]80-rose came with [him]75-frederick . But even so , what a running away . No , [he]75-frederick could n’t .

When [they]2450-they got to [the dining - room]856-the dining - room [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher went to the head of the table — was this [[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s house]2452-mrs. fisher ’s house ? [he]75-frederick asked [himself]75-frederick . [He]75-frederick did n’t know ; [he]75-frederick did n’t know anything — and [Rose]80-rose , who in [her]83-mrs. fisher earlier days of defying [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had taken the other end as [[her]83-mrs. fisher place]2453-her place , for after all [no one]310-no one could say by looking at a table which was [its]2455-its top and which its bottom , led [Frederick]75-frederick to the seat next to [her]83-mrs. fisher . If only , [he]75-frederick thought , [he]75-frederick could have been alone with [Rose]80-rose ; just five minutes more alone with [Rose]80-rose , so that [he]75-frederick could have asked [her]83-mrs. fisher —

But probably [he]75-frederick would n’t have asked [her]83-mrs. fisher anything , and only gone on kissing [her]83-mrs. fisher .

[He]75-frederick looked round . [The sandy young woman]2442-the sandy young woman was telling [the man [they]2458-they called [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher to go and sit beside [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher]2457-the man they called briggs to go and sit beside mrs. fisher — was [the house]410-the house , then , [the sandy young woman]2442-the sandy young woman ’s and not [[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s]2461-mrs. fisher ’s ? [He]75-frederick did n’t know ; [he]75-frederick did n’t know anything — and [she]2442-the sandy young woman [herself]2442-the sandy young woman sat down on [Rose]80-rose ’s other side , so that [she]2442-the sandy young woman was opposite [him]75-frederick , [Frederick]75-frederick , and next to [the genial man who had said “ Here [we]2458-they are]3131-the genial man who had said “ here we are , ”[3131-the genial man who had said “ here we are] when it was only too evident that there [they]2458-they were indeed .

Next to [Frederick]75-frederick , and between [him]75-frederick and [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher , was an empty chair : [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline ’s . No more than [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline knew of the presence in [Frederick]75-frederick ’s life of [Rose]80-rose was [Rose]80-rose aware of the presence in [Frederick]75-frederick ’s life of [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline . What would each think ? [He]75-frederick did n’t know ; [he]75-frederick did n’t know anything . Yes , [he]75-frederick did know something , and that was that [[his]75-frederick wife]244-his wife had made it up with [him]75-frederick — suddenly , miraculously , unaccountably , and divinely . Beyond that [he]75-frederick knew nothing . The situation was one with which [he]75-frederick felt [he]75-frederick could not cope . It must lead [him]75-frederick whither it would . [He]75-frederick could only drift .

In silence [Frederick]75-frederick ate [his]75-frederick soup , and the eyes , the large expressive eyes of [the young woman]2463-the young woman opposite , were on [him]75-frederick , [he]75-frederick could feel , with a growing look in them of inquiry . [They]2464-they were , [he]75-frederick could see , very intelligent and attractive eyes , and full , apart from the inquiry of goodwill . Probably [she]2463-the young woman thought [he]75-frederick ought to talk — but if [she]2463-the young woman knew everything [she]2463-the young woman would n’t think so . [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher did n’t talk either . [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher seemed uneasy . What was the matter with [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher ? And [Rose]80-rose too did n’t talk , but then that was natural . [She]2463-the young woman never had been [a talker]2465-a talker . [She]2463-the young woman had the loveliest expression on [her]2463-the young woman face . How long would it be on it after [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline ’s entrance ? [He]75-frederick did n’t know ; [he]75-frederick did n’t know anything .

But [the genial man on [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s left]2466-the genial man on mrs. fisher ’s left was talking enough for [everybody]2701-everybody . [That fellow]2468-that fellow ought to have been [a parson]2469-a parson . [Pulpits]2470-pulpits were [the place for a voice like [his]75-frederick]2471-the place for a voice like his ; it would get [him]75-frederick a bishopric in six months . [He]75-frederick was explaining to [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher , who shuffled about in [his]2466-the genial man on mrs. fisher ’s left seat — why did [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher shuffle about in [his]2466-the genial man on mrs. fisher ’s left seat?—that [he]2466-the genial man on mrs. fisher ’s left must have come out by [the same train]2472-the same train as [Arbuthnot]80-rose , and when [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher , who said nothing , wriggled in apparent dissent , [he]75-frederick undertook to prove it to [him]75-frederick , and did prove it to [him]75-frederick in long clear sentences .

“ Who ’s [the man with the voice]3132-the man with the voice ? ”[75-frederick] [Frederick]75-frederick asked [Rose]80-rose in a whisper ; and [the young woman opposite , whose ears appeared to have the quickness of hearing of wild creatures]2473-the young woman opposite , whose ears appeared to have the quickness of hearing of wild creatures , answered , “ [He]3132-the man with the voice ’s [[my]2473-the young woman opposite , whose ears appeared to have the quickness of hearing of wild creatures husband]2697-my husband . ”[2473-the young woman opposite , whose ears appeared to have the quickness of hearing of wild creatures]

“ Then by all the rules , ”[75-frederick] said [Frederick]75-frederick pleasantly , pulling [himself]75-frederick together , “ [you]2473-the young woman opposite , whose ears appeared to have the quickness of hearing of wild creatures ought n’t to be sitting next to [him]3132-the man with the voice . ”[75-frederick]

“ But [I]2473-the young woman opposite , whose ears appeared to have the quickness of hearing of wild creatures want to .
