[Frederick]75-frederick could think of nothing to say to this , so [he]75-frederick only smiled generally .

“ It ’s [this place]2843-this place , ”[2473-the young woman opposite , whose ears appeared to have the quickness of hearing of wild creatures] [she]2473-the young woman opposite , whose ears appeared to have the quickness of hearing of wild creatures said , nodding at [him]75-frederick . “ It makes [one]235-one understand . [You]75-frederick ’ve no idea what a lot [you]75-frederick ’ll understand before [you]75-frederick ’ve done [here]478-here . ”[2473-the young woman opposite , whose ears appeared to have the quickness of hearing of wild creatures]

“ [I]75-frederick ’m sure [I]75-frederick hope so , ”[75-frederick] said [Frederick]75-frederick with real fervour .

The soup was taken away , and the fish was brought . [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher , on the other side of the empty chair , seemed more uneasy than ever . What was the matter with [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher ? Did n’t [he]2474-he like fish ?

[Frederick]75-frederick wondered what [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher would do in the way of fidgets if [he]2474-he were in [his]2474-he own situation . [Frederick]75-frederick kept on wiping [his]75-frederick moustache , and was not able to look up from [his]75-frederick plate , but that was as much as [he]75-frederick showed of what [he]75-frederick was feeling .

Though [he]75-frederick did n’t look up [he]75-frederick felt the eyes of [the young woman]2463-the young woman opposite raking [him]75-frederick like searchlights , and [Rose]80-rose ’s eyes were on [him]75-frederick too , [he]75-frederick knew , but they rested on [him]75-frederick unquestioningly , beautifully , like a benediction . How long would [they]2476-they go on doing that once [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline was [there]296-there ? [He]75-frederick did n’t know ; [he]75-frederick did n’t know anything .

[He]75-frederick wiped [his]75-frederick moustache for the twentieth unnecessary time , and could not quite keep [his]75-frederick hand steady , and [the young woman]2463-the young woman opposite saw [his]75-frederick hand not being quite steady , and [her]2463-the young woman eyes raked [him]75-frederick persistently . Why did [her]2463-the young woman eyes rake [him]75-frederick persistently ? [He]75-frederick did n’t know ; [he]75-frederick did n’t know anything .

Then [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher leapt to [his]75-frederick feet . What was the matter with [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher ? Oh — yes — quite : [she]2463-the young woman had come .

[Frederick]75-frederick wiped [his]75-frederick moustache and got up too . [He]75-frederick was in for it now . Absurd , fantastic situation . Well , whatever happened [he]75-frederick could only drift — drift , and look like an ass to [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline , [the most absolute as well as deceitful ass]2479-the most absolute as well as deceitful ass — an ass who was also a reptile , for [she]82-lady caroline might well think [he]75-frederick had been mocking [her]82-lady caroline out in [the garden]519-the garden when [he]75-frederick said , no doubt in a shaking voice — [fool and ass]2481-fool and ass — that [he]75-frederick had come because [he]75-frederick could n’t help it ; while as for what [he]75-frederick would look like to [[his]75-frederick Rose]2482-his rose — when [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline introduced [him]75-frederick to [her]82-lady caroline — when [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline introduced [him]75-frederick as [[her]82-lady caroline friend whom [she]82-lady caroline had invited in to dinner]2483-her friend whom she had invited in to dinner — well , [God]73-god alone knew that .

[He]75-frederick , therefore , as [he]75-frederick got up wiped [his]75-frederick moustache for the last time before the catastrophe .

But [he]75-frederick was reckoning without [Scrap]115-scrap .

[That accomplished and experienced young woman]2484-that accomplished and experienced young woman slipped into the chair [Briggs]83-mrs. fisher was holding for [her]2484-that accomplished and experienced young woman , and on [Lotty]149-lotty ’s leaning across eagerly , and saying before [any one else]2485-any one else could get a word in , “ Just fancy , [Caroline]82-lady caroline , how quickly [[Rose]80-rose ’s husband]2367-rose ’s husband has got [here]478-here ! ”[2484-that accomplished and experienced young woman] turned to [him]75-frederick without so much as the faintest shadow of surprise on [her]2484-that accomplished and experienced young woman face , and held out [her]2484-that accomplished and experienced young woman hand , and smiled like [a young angel]2486-a young angel , and said , “ and [me]2486-a young angel late [your]75-frederick very first evening . ”[2486-a young angel]

[The daughter of [the Droitwiches]152-the droitwiches]2989-the daughter of the droitwiches . . .

Chapter 22

That evening was the evening of the full moon . [The garden]519-the garden was an enchanted place where all the flowers seemed white . The lilies , the daphnes , the orange - blossom , the white stocks , the white pinks , the white roses — [you]2489-you could see these as plainly as in the day - time ; but the coloured flowers existed only as fragrance .

[The three younger women]2490-the three younger women sat on the low wall at the end of [the top garden]1097-the top garden after dinner , [Rose]80-rose a little apart from [the others]822-the others , and watched the enormous moon moving slowly over the place where [Shelley]175-shelley had lived [his]75-frederick last months just on a hundred years before . [The sea]2735-the sea quivered along the path of the moon . The stars winked and trembled . [The mountains]737-the mountains were misty blue outlines , with little clusters of lights shining through from [little clusters of homes]2495-little clusters of homes . In [the garden]519-the garden the plants stood quite still , straight and unstirred by the smallest ruffle of air . Through the glass doors [the dining - room]856-the dining - room , with [its]856-the dining - room candle - lit table and brilliant flowers — nasturtiums and marigolds that night — glowed like some magic cave of colour , and [the three men smoking round it]2498-the three men smoking round it looked [strangely animated figures seen from the silence , the huge cool calm of outside]2499-strangely animated figures seen from the silence , the huge cool calm of outside .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher had gone to [the drawing - room]1518-the drawing - room and the fire . [Scrap]115-scrap and [Lotty]149-lotty , [their]2490-the three younger women faces upturned to the sky , said very little and in whispers . [Rose]80-rose said nothing . [Her]2501-her face too was upturned . [She]2501-her was looking at the umbrella pine , which had been smitten into something glorious , silhouetted against stars . Every now and then [Scrap]115-scrap ’s eyes lingered on [Rose]80-rose ; so did [Lotty]149-lotty ’s . For [Rose]80-rose was lovely . Anywhere at that moment , among [all the well - known beauties]2502-all the well - known beauties , [she]2501-her would have been lovely . [Nobody]231-nobody could have put [her]2501-her in the shade , blown out [her]2501-her light that evening ; [she]2501-her was too evidently shining .

[Lotty]149-lotty bent close to [Scrap]115-scrap ’s ear , and whispered . “ Love , ”[149-lotty] [she]149-lotty whispered .

[Scrap]115-scrap nodded . “ Yes , ”[149-lotty] [she]149-lotty said , under [her]149-lotty breath .

[She]149-lotty was obliged to admit it . [You]2504-you only had to look at [Rose]80-rose to know that here was Love .

“ There ’s nothing like it , ”[149-lotty] whispered [Lotty]149-lotty .

[Scrap]115-scrap was silent .

“ It ’s a great thing , ”[149-lotty] whispered [Lotty]149-lotty after a pause , during which [they]2505-they both watched [Rose]80-rose ’s upturned face , “ to get on with one ’s loving . Perhaps [you]80-rose can tell [me]80-rose of anything else in [the world]186-the world that works such wonders . ”[80-rose]

But [Scrap]115-scrap could n’t tell [her]149-lotty ; and if [she]115-scrap could have , what a night to begin arguing in . This was a night for —

[She]115-scrap pulled [herself]115-scrap up . Love again . It was everywhere . There was no getting away from it . [She]115-scrap had come to [this place]2843-this place to get away from [it]2843-this place , and here was [everybody]2701-everybody in [its]2843-this place different stages . Even [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher seemed to have been brushed by one of the many feathers of [Love]176-rose ’s wing , and at dinner was different — full of concern because [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs would n’t eat , and [her]115-scrap face when [she]115-scrap turned to [him]79-briggs all soft with motherliness .

[Scrap]115-scrap looked up at the pine - tree motionless among stars . Beauty made [you]2508-you love , and love made [you]2508-you beautiful . . .

[She]115-scrap pulled [her]115-scrap wrap closer round [her]115-scrap with a gesture of defence , of keeping out and off . [She]115-scrap did n’t want to grow sentimental . Difficult not to , here ; the marvellous night stole in through all one ’s chinks , and brought in with it , whether [one]235-one wanted them or not , enormous feelings — feelings [one]235-one could n’t manage , great things about death and time and waste ; glorious and devastating things , magnificent and bleak , at once rapture and terror and immense , heart - cleaving longing . [She]115-scrap felt small and dreadfully alone . [She]115-scrap felt uncovered and defenceless . Instinctively [she]115-scrap pulled [her]115-scrap wrap closer . With this thing of chiffon [she]115-scrap tried to protect [herself]115-scrap from the eternities .

“ [I]149-lotty suppose , ”[149-lotty] whispered [Lotty]149-lotty , “ [[Rose]176-rose ’s husband]2367-rose ’s husband seems to [you]115-scrap just [an ordinary , good - natured , middle - aged man]3142-an ordinary , good - natured , middle - aged man . ”[149-lotty]

[Scrap]115-scrap brought [her]115-scrap gaze down from the stars and looked at [Lotty]149-lotty a moment while [she]115-scrap focussed [her]115-scrap mind again .

“ Just [a rather red , rather round man]3143-a rather red , rather round man , ”[149-lotty] whispered [Lotty]149-lotty .

[Scrap]115-scrap bowed [her]115-scrap head .

“ [He]2367-rose ’s husband is n’t , ”[149-lotty] whispered [Lotty]149-lotty . “ [Rose]176-rose sees through all that . That ’s mere trimmings . [She]176-rose sees what [we]3144-we ca n’t see , because [she]176-rose loves [him]2367-rose ’s husband . ”[149-lotty]

Always love .

[Scrap]115-scrap got up , and winding [herself]115-scrap very tightly in [her]115-scrap wrap moved away to [her]115-scrap day corner , and sat down there alone on the wall and looked out across [the other sea]2511-the other sea , [the sea where the sun had gone down]2512-the sea where the sun had gone down , [the sea]2735-the sea with the far - away dim shadow stretching into it which was [France]39-france .

Yes , love worked wonders , and [Mr. Arundel]173-mr. arundel — [she]115-scrap could n’t at once get used to [his]173-mr. arundel other name — was to [Rose Love]176-rose itself ; but it also worked inverted wonders , it did n’t invariably , as [she]115-scrap well knew , transfigure [people]278-people into [saints and angels]2515-saints and angels . Grievously indeed did it sometimes do the opposite . [She]115-scrap had had it in [her]115-scrap life applied to [her]115-scrap to excess . If it had let [her]115-scrap alone , if it had at least been moderate and infrequent , [she]115-scrap might , [she]115-scrap thought , have turned out [a quite decent , generous - minded , kindly , human being]2516-a quite decent , generous - minded , kindly , human being . And what was [she]115-scrap , thanks to this love [Lotty]149-lotty talked so much about ? [Scrap]115-scrap searched for a just description . [She]115-scrap was [a spoilt]2517-a spoilt , [a sour , a suspicious , and a selfish spinster]2518-a sour , a suspicious , and a selfish spinster .

The glass doors of [the dining - room]856-the dining - room opened , and [the three men]2520-the three men came out into [the garden]519-the garden , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins ’s voice flowing along in front of [them]2520-the three men . [He]65-mr. wilkins appeared to be doing all the talking ; [the other two]1462-the other two were saying nothing .

Perhaps [she]115-scrap had better go back to [Lotty]149-lotty and [Rose]176-rose ; it would be tiresome to be discovered and hemmed into [that cul - de - sac]2523-that cul - de - sac by [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs .

[She]115-scrap got up reluctantly , for [she]115-scrap considered it unpardonable of [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs to force [her]115-scrap to move about like this , to force [her]115-scrap out of any place [she]115-scrap wished to sit in ; and [she]115-scrap emerged from the daphne bushes feeling like [some gaunt , stern figure of just resentment]2524-some gaunt , stern figure of just resentment and wishing that [she]115-scrap looked as gaunt and stern as [she]115-scrap felt ; so would [she]115-scrap have struck repugnance into the soul of [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs , and been free of [him]79-briggs . But [she]115-scrap knew [she]115-scrap did n’t look like that , however hard [she]115-scrap might try . At dinner [his]79-briggs hand shook when [he]79-briggs drank , and [he]79-briggs could n’t speak to [her]115-scrap without flushing scarlet and then going pale , and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s eyes had sought [hers]115-scrap with the entreaty of [one who asks that [[her]83-mrs. fisher only son]2526-her only son may not be hurt]2525-one who asks that her only son may not be hurt .

How could [a human being]2527-a human being , thought [Scrap]115-scrap , frowning as [she]115-scrap issued forth from [her]115-scrap corner , how could [a man made in [God]73-god ’s image]2528-a man made in god ’s image behave so ; and [he]79-briggs fitted for better things [she]115-scrap was sure , with [his]79-briggs youth , [his]79-briggs attractiveness , and [his]79-briggs brains . [He]79-briggs had brains . [She]115-scrap had examined [him]79-briggs cautiously whenever at dinner [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher forced [him]79-briggs to turn away to answer [her]115-scrap , and [she]115-scrap was sure [he]79-briggs had brains . Also [he]79-briggs had character ; there was something noble about [his]79-briggs head , about the shape of [his]79-briggs forehead — noble and kind . All the more deplorable that [he]79-briggs should allow [himself]79-briggs to be infatuated by [a mere outside]2529-a mere outside , and waste any of [his]79-briggs strength , any of [his]79-briggs peace of mind , hanging round just [a woman - thing]2530-a woman - thing . If only [he]79-briggs could see right through [her]115-scrap , see through all [her]115-scrap skin and stuff , [he]79-briggs would be cured , and [she]115-scrap might go on sitting undisturbed on this wonderful night by [herself]115-scrap .

Just beyond the daphne bushes [she]115-scrap met [Frederick]75-frederick , hurrying .

“ [I]75-frederick was determined to find [you]115-scrap first , ”[75-frederick] [he]75-frederick said , “ before [I]75-frederick go to [Rose]176-rose . ”[75-frederick] And [he]75-frederick added quickly , “ [I]75-frederick want to kiss [your]115-scrap shoes . ”[75-frederick]

“ Do [you]75-frederick ? ”[115-scrap] said [Scrap]115-scrap , smiling . “ Then [I]115-scrap must go and put on [my]115-scrap new ones . These are n’t nearly good enough . ”[115-scrap]

[She]115-scrap felt immensely well - disposed towards [Frederick]75-frederick . [He]75-frederick , at least , would grab no more . [His]75-frederick grabbing days , so sudden and so brief , were done . [Nice man]2531-nice man ; [agreeable man]2532-agreeable man . [She]115-scrap now definitely liked [him]75-frederick . Clearly [he]75-frederick had been getting into some sort of a tangle , and [she]115-scrap was grateful to [Lotty]149-lotty for stopping [her]115-scrap in time at dinner from saying something hopelessly complicating . But whatever [he]75-frederick had been getting into [he]75-frederick was out of it now ; [his]75-frederick face and [Rose]176-rose ’s face had the same light in them .

“ [I]75-frederick shall adore [you]115-scrap for ever now , ”[75-frederick] said [Frederick]75-frederick .

[Scrap]115-scrap smiled . “ Shall [you]75-frederick ? ”[115-scrap] [she]115-scrap said .

“ [I]115-scrap adored [you]115-scrap before because of [your]115-scrap beauty . Now [I]115-scrap adore [you]115-scrap because [you]115-scrap ’re not only as beautiful as a dream but as decent as [a man]662-a man . ”[115-scrap]

[Scrap]115-scrap laughed . “ Am [I]115-scrap ? ”[115-scrap] [she]115-scrap said , amused .

“ When [the impetuous young woman]3146-the impetuous young woman , ”[75-frederick] [Frederick]75-frederick went on , “ [the blessedly impetuous young woman]3147-the blessedly impetuous young woman , blurted out in the nick of time that [I]75-frederick am [[Rose]176-rose ’s husband]2367-rose ’s husband , [you]115-scrap behaved exactly as [a man]662-a man would have behaved to [[his]662-a man friend]2243-his friend . ”[75-frederick]

“ Did [I]115-scrap ? ”[115-scrap] said [Scrap]115-scrap , [her]115-scrap enchanting dimple very evident .

“ It ’s the rarest , most precious of combinations , ”[75-frederick] said [Frederick]75-frederick , “ to be [a woman]804-a woman and have the loyalty of [a man]662-a man . ”[75-frederick]

“ Is it ? ”[115-scrap] smiled [Scrap]115-scrap , a little wistfully . These were indeed handsome compliments . If only [she]115-scrap were really like that . . .

“ And [I]115-scrap want to kiss [your]115-scrap shoes . ”[115-scrap]

“ Wo n’t this save trouble ? ”[115-scrap] [she]115-scrap asked , holding out [her]115-scrap hand .

[He]75-frederick took it and swiftly kissed it , and was hurrying away again . “ Bless [you]115-scrap , ”[75-frederick] [he]75-frederick said as [he]75-frederick went .

“ Where is [your]75-frederick luggage ? ”[115-scrap] [Scrap]115-scrap called after [him]75-frederick .

“ Oh , [Lord]3153-lord , yes — ”[75-frederick] said [Frederick]75-frederick , pausing . “ It ’s at [the station]537-the station . ”[75-frederick]

“ [I]75-frederick ’ll send for it . ”[75-frederick]

[He]75-frederick disappeared through the bushes . [She]115-scrap went [indoors]2261-indoors to give the order ; and this is how it happened that [Domenico]96-domenico , for the second time that evening , found [himself]96-domenico journeying into [Mezzago]32-mezzago and wondering as [he]96-domenico went .

Then , having made the necessary arrangements for the perfect happiness of [these two people]2534-these two people , [she]115-scrap came slowly out into [the garden]519-the garden again , very much absorbed in thought . Love seemed to bring happiness to [everybody]2701-everybody but [herself]115-scrap . [It]2537-it had certainly got hold of [everybody there]2538-everybody there , in [its]2537-it different varieties , except [herself]115-scrap . [Poor Mr. Briggs]79-briggs had been got hold of by its least dignified variety . [Poor Mr. Briggs]79-briggs . [He]79-briggs was a disturbing problem , and [his]79-briggs going away next day would n’t [she]115-scrap was afraid solve [him]79-briggs .

When [she]115-scrap reached the others [Mr. Arundel]173-mr. arundel — [she]115-scrap kept on forgetting that [he]173-mr. arundel was n’t [Mr. Arundel]173-mr. arundel — was already , [his]173-mr. arundel arm through [Rose]176-rose ’s , going off with [her]115-scrap , probably to the greater seclusion of [the lower garden]927-the lower garden . No doubt [they]2540-they had a great deal to say to [each other]207-each other ; something had gone wrong between [them]2540-they , and had suddenly been put right . [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , [Lotty]149-lotty would say , [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore working its spell of happiness . [She]115-scrap could quite believe in its spell . Even [she]115-scrap was happier [there]296-there than [she]115-scrap had been for ages and ages . [The only person who would go empty away]2543-the only person who would go empty away would be [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs .

[Poor Mr. Briggs]79-briggs . When [she]115-scrap came in sight of [the group]2544-the group [he]79-briggs looked much too nice and boyish not to be happy . It seemed out of the picture that [the owner of [the place]428-the place]2545-the owner of the place , [the person to whom [they]2544-the group owed all this]2547-the person to whom they owed all this , should be [the only one to go away from [it]428-the place unblessed]2548-the only one to go away from it unblessed .

Compunction seized [Scrap]115-scrap . What very pleasant days [she]115-scrap had spent in [[his]79-briggs house]501-his house , lying in [[his]79-briggs garden]2550-his garden , enjoying [his]79-briggs flowers , loving [his]79-briggs views , using [his]79-briggs things , being comfortable , being rested — recovering , in fact . [She]115-scrap had had the most leisured , peaceful , and thoughtful time of [her]115-scrap life ; and all really thanks to [him]79-briggs . Oh , [she]115-scrap knew [she]115-scrap paid [him]79-briggs some ridiculous small sum a week , out of all proportion to the benefits [she]115-scrap got in exchange , but what was that in the balance ? And was n’t it entirely thanks to [him]79-briggs that [she]115-scrap had come across [Lotty]149-lotty ? Never else would [she]115-scrap and [Lotty]149-lotty have met ; never else would [she]115-scrap have known [her]149-lotty .

[Compunction]177-compunction laid [its]177-compunction quick , warm hand on [Scrap]115-scrap . Impulsive gratitude flooded [her]115-scrap . [She]115-scrap went straight up to [Briggs]79-briggs .

“ [I]115-scrap owe [you]79-briggs so much , ”[115-scrap] [she]115-scrap said , overcome by the sudden realisation of all [she]115-scrap did owe [him]79-briggs , and ashamed of [her]115-scrap churlishness in the afternoon and at dinner . Of course [he]79-briggs had n’t known [she]115-scrap was being churlish . Of course [her]115-scrap disagreeable inside was camouflaged as usual by the chance arrangement of [her]115-scrap outside ; but [she]115-scrap knew it . [She]115-scrap was churlish . [She]115-scrap had been churlish to [everybody]2701-everybody for years . Any penetrating eye , thought [Scrap]115-scrap , any really penetrating eye , would see [her]115-scrap for what [she]115-scrap was — [a spoilt]2517-a spoilt , [a sour]2553-a sour , [a suspicious and a selfish spinster]2554-a suspicious and a selfish spinster .

“ [I]115-scrap owe [you]79-briggs so much , ”[115-scrap] therefore said [Scrap]115-scrap earnestly , walking straight up to [Briggs]79-briggs , humbled by these thoughts .

[He]79-briggs looked at [her]115-scrap in wonder . “ [You]115-scrap owe [me]79-briggs ? ”[79-briggs] [he]79-briggs said . “ But it ’s [I]79-briggs who — [I]79-briggs who — ”[79-briggs] [he]79-briggs stammered . To see [her]115-scrap there in [[his]79-briggs garden]2550-his garden . . . nothing in it , no white flower , was whiter , more exquisite .

“ Please , ”[115-scrap] said [Scrap]115-scrap , still more earnestly , “ wo n’t [you]79-briggs clear [your]79-briggs mind of everything except just truth ? [You]79-briggs do n’t owe [me]115-scrap anything . How should [you]79-briggs ? ”[115-scrap]

“ [I]79-briggs do n’t owe [you]115-scrap anything ? ”[79-briggs] echoed [Briggs]79-briggs . “ Why , [I]79-briggs owe [you]115-scrap [my]79-briggs first sight of — of — ”[79-briggs]

“ Oh , for goodness sake — for goodness sake , ”[115-scrap] said [Scrap]115-scrap entreatingly , “ do , please , be ordinary . Do n’t be humble . Why should [you]79-briggs be humble ? It ’s ridiculous of [you]79-briggs to be humble . [You]79-briggs ’re worth fifty of [me]115-scrap . ”[115-scrap]

“ Unwise , ”[65-mr. wilkins] thought [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , who was standing there too , while [Lotty]149-lotty sat on the wall . [He]65-mr. wilkins was surprised , [he]65-mr. wilkins was concerned , [he]65-mr. wilkins was shocked that [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline should thus encourage [Briggs]79-briggs . “ Unwise — very , ”[65-mr. wilkins] thought [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , shaking [his]65-mr. wilkins head .

[Briggs]79-briggs ’s condition was so bad already that the only course to take with [him]79-briggs was to repel [him]79-briggs utterly , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins considered . No half measures were the least use with [Briggs]79-briggs , and kindliness and familiar talk would only be misunderstood by [the unhappy youth]2556-the unhappy youth . [The daughter of [the Droitwiches]152-the droitwiches]2989-the daughter of the droitwiches could not really , it was impossible to suppose it , desire to encourage [him]79-briggs . [Briggs]79-briggs was all very well , but [Briggs]79-briggs was [Briggs]79-briggs ; [his]79-briggs name alone proved that . Probably [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline did not quite appreciate the effect of [her]82-lady caroline voice and face , and how between [them]2558-them they made otherwise ordinary words seem — well , encouraging . But these words were not quite ordinary ; [she]82-lady caroline had not , [he]65-mr. wilkins feared , sufficiently pondered them . Indeed and indeed [she]82-lady caroline needed [an adviser]2559-an adviser — [some sagacious , objective counsellor like [himself]65-mr. wilkins]2560-some sagacious , objective counsellor like himself . There [she]82-lady caroline was , standing before [Briggs]79-briggs almost holding out [her]82-lady caroline hands to [him]79-briggs . [Briggs]79-briggs of course ought to be thanked , for [they]2561-they were having a most delightful holiday in [[his]79-briggs house]501-his house , but not thanked to excess and not by [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline alone . That very evening [he]79-briggs had been considering the presentation to [him]79-briggs next day of a round robin of collective gratitude on [his]79-briggs departure ; but [he]79-briggs should not be thanked like this , in the moonlight , in [the garden]519-the garden , by [the lady [he]79-briggs was so manifestly infatuated with]2564-the lady he was so manifestly infatuated with .

[Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins therefore , desiring to assist [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline out of this situation by swiftly applied tact , said with much heartiness : “ It is most proper , [Briggs]79-briggs , that [you]79-briggs should be thanked . [You]79-briggs will please allow [me]65-mr. wilkins to add [my]65-mr. wilkins expressions of indebtedness , and those of [[my]65-mr. wilkins wife]2983-my wife , to [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline ’s . [We]3156-we ought to have proposed a vote of thanks to [you]79-briggs at dinner . [You]79-briggs should have been toasted . There certainly ought to have been some — ”[65-mr. wilkins]

But [Briggs]79-briggs took no notice of [him]79-briggs whatever ; [he]79-briggs simply continued to look at [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline as though [she]82-lady caroline were [the first woman [he]79-briggs had ever seen]2565-the first woman he had ever seen . Neither , [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins observed , did [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline take any notice of [him]79-briggs ; [she]82-lady caroline too continued to look at [Briggs]79-briggs , and with that odd air of almost appeal . Most unwise . Most .

[Lotty]149-lotty , on the other hand , took too much notice of [him]79-briggs , choosing this moment when [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline needed special support and protection to get up off the wall and put [her]82-lady caroline arm through [his]79-briggs and draw [him]79-briggs away .

“ [I]149-lotty want to tell [you]79-briggs something , [Mellersh]149-lotty , ”[149-lotty] said [Lotty]149-lotty at this juncture , getting up .

“ Presently , ”[65-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , waving [her]149-lotty aside .

“ No — now , ”[149-lotty] said [Lotty]149-lotty ; and [she]149-lotty drew [him]79-briggs away .

[He]79-briggs went with extreme reluctance . [Briggs]79-briggs should be given no rope at all — not an inch .

“ Well — what is it ? ”[79-briggs] [he]79-briggs asked impatiently , as [she]149-lotty led [him]79-briggs towards [the house]410-the house . [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline ought not to be left like that , exposed to annoyance .

“ Oh , but [she]82-lady caroline is n’t , ”[149-lotty] [Lotty]149-lotty assured [him]79-briggs , just as if [he]79-briggs had said this aloud , which [he]79-briggs certainly had not . “ [Caroline]82-lady caroline is perfectly all right . ”[149-lotty]

“ Not at all all right . [That young Briggs]3157-that young briggs is — ”[149-lotty]

“ Of course [he]3157-that young briggs is . What did [you]65-mr. wilkins expect ? Let ’s go [indoors]2261-indoors to the fire and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . [She]82-lady caroline ’s all by [herself]82-lady caroline . ”[149-lotty]

“ [I]65-mr. wilkins can not , ”[65-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , trying to draw back , “ leave [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline alone in [the garden]519-the garden . ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ Do n’t be silly , [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins — [she]82-lady caroline is n’t alone . Besides , [I]149-lotty want to tell [you]65-mr. wilkins something . ”[149-lotty]

“ Well tell [me]65-mr. wilkins , then . ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ Indoors . ”[149-lotty]

With a reluctance that increased at every step [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins was taken farther and farther away from [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline . [He]65-mr. wilkins believed in [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife now and trusted [her]244-his wife , but on this occasion [he]65-mr. wilkins thought [she]244-his wife was making a terrible mistake . In [the drawing - room]1518-the drawing - room sat [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher by the fire , and it certainly was to [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , who preferred [rooms]824-rooms and fires after dark to [gardens]2570-gardens and moonlight , more agreeable to be in [there]296-there than out - of - doors if [he]65-mr. wilkins could have brought [Lady Caroline]82-lady caroline safely in with [him]65-mr. wilkins . As it was , [he]65-mr. wilkins went in with extreme reluctance .

[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , [her]83-mrs. fisher hands folded on [her]83-mrs. fisher lap , was doing nothing , merely gazing fixedly into the fire . The lamp was arranged conveniently for reading , but [she]83-mrs. fisher was not reading . [[Her]83-mrs. fisher great dead friends]1619-her great dead friends did not seem worth reading that night . [They]1619-her great dead friends always said the same things now — over and over again [they]1619-her great dead friends said the same things , and nothing new was to be got out of them any more for ever . No doubt [they]1619-her great dead friends were greater than [any one]2719-any one was now , but [they]1619-her great dead friends had this immense disadvantage , that [they]1619-her great dead friends were dead . Nothing further was to be expected of [them]1619-her great dead friends ; while of the living , what might [one]235-one not still expect ? [She]83-mrs. fisher craved for the living , the developing — the crystallised and finished wearied [her]83-mrs. fisher . [She]83-mrs. fisher was thinking that if only [she]83-mrs. fisher had had [a son]2195-a son — [a son like [Mr. Briggs]79-briggs]2576-a son like mr. briggs , [a dear boy like that]2577-a dear boy like that , going on , unfolding , alive , affectionate , taking care of [her]83-mrs. fisher and loving [her]83-mrs. fisher . . .

The look on [her]83-mrs. fisher face gave [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s heart a little twist when [she]64-mrs. wilkins saw it . “ [Poor old dear]3160-poor old dear , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins thought , all the loneliness of age flashing upon [her]64-mrs. wilkins , the loneliness of having outstayed [one]235-one ’s welcome in [the world]186-the world , of being in [it]186-the world only on sufferance , the complete loneliness of [the old childless woman who has failed to make friends]2580-the old childless woman who has failed to make friends . It did seem that [people]278-people could only be really happy in [pairs]2582-pairs — any sorts of [pairs]2582-pairs , not in the least necessarily [lovers]939-lovers , but [pairs of friends]2585-pairs of friends , [pairs of [mothers]2840-mothers and [children]455-children , of [brothers]3039-brothers and [sisters]2590-sisters]2586-pairs of mothers and children , of brothers and sisters — and where was the other half of [[Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s pair]2591-mrs. fisher ’s pair going to be found ?

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins thought [she]64-mrs. wilkins had perhaps better kiss [her]83-mrs. fisher again . The kissing this afternoon had been a great success ; [she]64-mrs. wilkins knew it , [she]64-mrs. wilkins had instantly felt [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s reaction to it . So [she]64-mrs. wilkins crossed over and bent down and kissed [her]83-mrs. fisher and said cheerfully , “ [We]3161-we ’ve come in — ”[64-mrs. wilkins] which indeed was evident .

This time [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher actually put up [her]83-mrs. fisher hand and held [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins ’s cheek against [her]83-mrs. fisher own — this living thing , full of affection , of warm , racing blood ; and as [she]83-mrs. fisher did this [she]83-mrs. fisher felt safe with [the strange creature]2592-the strange creature , sure that [she]83-mrs. fisher who [herself]83-mrs. fisher did unusual things so naturally would take the action quite as a matter of course , and not embarrass [her]83-mrs. fisher by being surprised .

[Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins was not at all surprised ; [she]64-mrs. wilkins was delighted . “ [I]64-mrs. wilkins believe [I]64-mrs. wilkins ’m [the other half of [[her]83-mrs. fisher pair]3163-her pair]3162-the other half of her pair , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] flashed into [her]64-mrs. wilkins mind . “ [I]64-mrs. wilkins believe it ’s [me]64-mrs. wilkins , positively [me]64-mrs. wilkins , going to be fast friends with [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ! ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

[Her]64-mrs. wilkins face when [she]64-mrs. wilkins lifted [her]64-mrs. wilkins head was full of laughter . Too extraordinary , the developments produced by [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore . [She]64-mrs. wilkins and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . . . but [she]64-mrs. wilkins saw [them]2593-them being [fast friends]2594-fast friends .

“ Where are [the others]822-the others ? ”[83-mrs. fisher] asked [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . “ Thank [you]64-mrs. wilkins — [dear]3165-dear , ”[83-mrs. fisher] [she]83-mrs. fisher added , as [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins put a footstool under [her]83-mrs. fisher feet , a footstool obviously needed , [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher ’s legs being short .

“ [I]64-mrs. wilkins see [myself]64-mrs. wilkins throughout the years , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] thought [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , [her]64-mrs. wilkins eyes dancing , “ bringing footstools to [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher . . . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

“ The Roses , ”[83-mrs. fisher] [she]83-mrs. fisher said , straightening [herself]83-mrs. fisher , “ have gone into [the lower garden]927-the lower garden — [I]83-mrs. fisher think lovemaking . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

“ The Roses ? ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

“ [The Fredericks]3167-the fredericks , then , if [you]64-mrs. wilkins like . [They]3167-the fredericks ’re completely merged and indistinguishable . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

“ Why not say [the Arbuthnots]178-the arbuthnots , [[my]65-mr. wilkins dear]3013-my dear ? ”[65-mr. wilkins] said [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins .

“ Very well , [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins — [the Arbuthnots]178-the arbuthnots . And [the Carolines]179-the carolines — ”[83-mrs. fisher]

Both [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins and [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher started . [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , usually in such complete control of [himself]65-mr. wilkins , started even more than [Mrs. Fisher]83-mrs. fisher , and for the first time since [his]65-mr. wilkins arrival felt angry with [[his]65-mr. wilkins wife]244-his wife .

“ Really — ”[65-mr. wilkins] [he]65-mr. wilkins began indignantly .

“ Very well , [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins — [the Briggses]3169-the briggses , then . ”[83-mrs. fisher]

“ [The Briggses]180-the briggses ! ”[65-mr. wilkins] cried [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins , now very angry indeed ; for the implication was to [him]65-mr. wilkins a most outrageous insult to [the entire race of [Desters]2597-desters]2596-the entire race of desters — [dead Desters]2598-dead desters , [living Desters]2599-living desters , and [Desters]181-desters still harmless because [they]181-desters were yet unborn . “ Really — ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ [I]64-mrs. wilkins ’m sorry , [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins , pretending meekness , “ if [you]65-mr. wilkins do n’t like it . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

“ Like it ! [You]65-mr. wilkins ’ve taken leave of [your]65-mr. wilkins senses . Why , [they]2597-desters ’ve never set eyes on [each other]207-each other before to - day . ”[65-mr. wilkins]

“ That ’s true . But that ’s why [they]2597-desters ’re able now to go ahead . ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

“ Go ahead ! ”[65-mr. wilkins] [Mr. Wilkins]65-mr. wilkins could only echo the outrageous words .

“ [I]64-mrs. wilkins ’m sorry , [Mellersh]65-mr. wilkins , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] said [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins again , “ if [you]65-mr. wilkins do n’t like it , but — ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

[Her]64-mrs. wilkins grey eyes shone , and [her]64-mrs. wilkins face rippled with the light and conviction that had so much surprised [Rose]176-rose the first time [they]2600-they met .

“ It ’s useless minding , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] [she]64-mrs. wilkins said . “ [I]64-mrs. wilkins should n’t struggle if [I]64-mrs. wilkins were [you]65-mr. wilkins . Because — ”[64-mrs. wilkins]

[She]64-mrs. wilkins stopped , and looked first at one alarmed solemn face and then at the other , and laughter as well as light flickered and danced over [her]64-mrs. wilkins .

“ [I]64-mrs. wilkins see [them]3171-them being [the Briggses]180-the briggses , ”[64-mrs. wilkins] finished [Mrs. Wilkins]64-mrs. wilkins .

That last week the syringa came out at [San Salvatore]16-san salvatore , and all the acacias flowered . [No one]310-no one had noticed how many acacias there were till one day [the garden]519-the garden was full of a new scent , and there were the delicate trees , the lovely successors to the wistaria , hung all over among [their]2603-their trembling leaves with blossom . To lie under an acacia tree that last week and look up through the branches at its frail leaves and white flowers quivering against the blue of the sky , while the least movement of the air shook down their scent , was a great happiness . Indeed , [the whole garden]2604-the whole garden dressed itself gradually towards the end in white , and grew more and more scented . There were the lilies , as vigorous as ever , and the white stocks and white pinks and white banksia roses , and the syringa and the jessamine , and at last the crowning fragrance of the acacias . When , on the first of May , [everybody]2701-everybody went away , even after [they]2701-everybody had got to [the bottom of [the hill]1635-the hill]2606-the bottom of the hill and passed through the iron gates out into [the village]615-the village [they]2701-everybody still could smell the acacias .

Section 2 . Information about the Mission of Project Gutenberg ™

Project Gutenberg ™ is synonymous with the free distribution of electronic works in formats readable by the widest variety of computers including obsolete , old , [middle - aged and new computers]2660-middle - aged and new computers . It exists because of the efforts of hundreds of [volunteers]2661-volunteers and donations from [people in all walks of life]2662-people in all walks of life .

[Volunteers]2661-volunteers and financial support to provide [volunteers]2661-volunteers with the assistance [they]2661-volunteers need are critical to reaching Project Gutenberg ™ ’s goals and ensuring that the Project Gutenberg ™ collection will remain freely available for [generations]2665-generations to come . In 2001 , the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation was created to provide a secure and permanent future for [Project Gutenberg]182-project gutenberg ™ and [future generations]2666-future generations . To learn more about the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation and how [your]2611-you efforts and donations can help , see Sections 3 and 4 and the Foundation information page at www.gutenberg.org .

Section 3 . Information about [the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation

The Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation]2667-the project gutenberg literary archive foundation the project gutenberg literary archive foundation is [a non - profit 501(c)(3 ) educational corporation organized under the laws of [the state of]2669-the state of [Mississippi]59-mississippi]2668-a non - profit 501(c)(3 ) educational corporation organized under the laws of the state of mississippi and granted tax exempt status by [the Internal Revenue Service]2670-the internal revenue service . [The Foundation]183-the foundation ’s EIN or federal tax identification number is 64 - 6221541 . Contributions to the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation are tax deductible to the full extent permitted by U.S. federal laws and [your]2611-you state ’s laws .

[[The Foundation]2610-the foundation ’s business office]2672-the foundation ’s business office is located at 809 [North 1500 West]2673-north 1500 west , [Salt Lake City]60-salt lake city , UT 84116 , ( 801 ) 596 - 1887 . Email contact links and up to date contact information can be found at [the Foundation]2610-the foundation ’s website and official page at www.gutenberg.org/contact

Section 4 . Information about Donations to the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation

Project Gutenberg ™ depends upon and can not survive without widespread public support and donations to carry out [its]2667-the project gutenberg literary archive foundation the project gutenberg literary archive foundation mission of increasing the number of public domain and licensed works that can be freely distributed in machine - readable form accessible by the widest array of equipment including outdated equipment . Many small donations ( $ 1 to $ 5,000 ) are particularly important to maintaining tax exempt status with [the IRS]61-the irs .

[The Foundation]183-the foundation is committed to complying with the laws regulating charities and charitable donations in [all 50 states of [the United States]2612-the united states]2675-all 50 states of the united states . Compliance requirements are not uniform and it takes a considerable effort , much paperwork and many fees to meet and keep up with these requirements . [We]2677-we do not solicit donations in locations where [we]2677-we have not received written confirmation of compliance . To SEND DONATIONS or determine the status of compliance for [any particular state]2678-any particular state visit www.gutenberg.org/donate .

While [we]2677-we can not and do not solicit contributions from states where [we]2677-we have not met the solicitation requirements , [we]2677-we know of no prohibition against accepting unsolicited donations from donors in [such states]2679-such states who approach [us]2677-we with offers to donate .

International donations are gratefully accepted , but [we]2677-we can not make any statements concerning tax treatment of donations received from outside [the United States]1-the united states . U.S. laws alone swamp [[our]2677-we small staff]2680-our small staff .

Please check [the Project Gutenberg]182-project gutenberg web pages for current donation methods and addresses . Donations are accepted in a number of other ways including checks , online payments and credit card donations . To donate , please visit : www.gutenberg.org/donate .

Section 5 . General Information About Project Gutenberg ™ electronic works

[Professor Michael S. Hart]184-professor michael s. hart was [the originator of the Project Gutenberg]2681-the originator of the project gutenberg ™ concept of a library of electronic works that could be freely shared with [anyone]1868-anyone . For forty years , [he]184-professor michael s. hart produced and distributed Project Gutenberg ™ eBooks with only a loose network of volunteer support .

Project Gutenberg ™ eBooks are often created from several printed editions , all of which are confirmed as not protected by copyright in the U.S. unless a copyright notice is included . Thus , [we]2677-we do not necessarily keep eBooks in compliance with any particular paper edition .

[Most people]2181-most people start at [our]2677-we website which has [the main PG search facility]2684-the main pg search facility : www.gutenberg.org .

This website includes information about Project Gutenberg ™ , including how to make donations to the Project Gutenberg Literary Archive Foundation , how to help produce [our]2677-we new eBooks , and how to subscribe to [our]2677-we email newsletter to hear about new eBooks .
